6,116 produits enregistrés
0
11 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
1
Recommandé
10.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 23 janvier 2021
This way to the TACOMA DOME!!!!

Introduction
Tacoma is a narrative focused game, a "walking simulator" developed by Fullbright, the creators of the lauded Gone Home[gonehome.game]. The game involves exploring a space station, uncovering information about its former inhabitants (as well as the future of year 2088) through recorded scenes and a detailed environment.

Everything that Gone Home got right, the deeply meaningful topics of the narrative, the empathy for the every-day average person, the sonder-ful and wonderful environmental storytelling - this game does it better. The studio's sophomore game definitely shows off everything they've learned from Gone Home - and their mastery of narrative places this game at the peak of the "Walking Simulator" genre. The only problem with this game is that it didn't last longer (about 2 hours, for me)

Gameplay
As you might expect, this story focused game is fairly light on gameplay. Most of it involves rewinding, fast forwarding, and watching scenes unfold. The game was heavily influenced by Sleep No More[en.wikipedia.org], a play where the narrative unfolds by actors interacting around you, alongside you, rather than in front of you. The gameplay also involves picking things up and looking at them. Nothing too exciting, no elements of challenge or puzzles, but this should not surprise you.
Watching conversations unfold on Tacoma station. 
Une capture d'écran de Tacoma
Par : marglark

The only other elements of gameplay come from the interactive environment, with things such as dart boards, pool tables, or micro-gravity basketball courts for you to play with.

Story
"Wow. Oh, wow."
That was my reaction to this game once it finished. It's hard not to gush now. This is the most immersive narrative I have ever experienced. Maybe like a movie you could live in for a few hours. There are little details everywhere, which add up to a fiction that is very easy to believe. My favorite was the crossword puzzle - a mundane object for the protagonists, but a tiny, dizzying window into the future universe outside the space station. The "Gone Home" mechanic of "pick things up and turn them around in your hands," not only works, but seems to hit home runs of intrigue with every little thing you pick up.
Mundane objects are carefully crafted, including this silly toothbrush. 
Une capture d'écran de Tacoma
Par : marglark

The narrative itself is smooth and coiled tightly. Not really cliche at all, and each piece of information plays a part in a cohesive whole, which is an even more impressive feat when you take into account that you might experience more or less narrative depending on how deep you explore, and still end up with something cohesive.

Graphics
The game has beautiful elements , but the game is also concerned with making a space station mundane, so not everything is beautiful. But everything is carefully crafted, and adds up to making this futuristic pocket universe real. My favorite part of the visuals is the lighting, the shadows cast by the sun into each of the rooms to remind you that you are on a space station, that gravity is actually centripetal force.
Dynamic lighting caused by the spin of the space station. 
Une capture d'écran de Tacoma
Par : marglark
Audio
The soundtrack is great. It has a similar punk aesthetic to Gone Home. There's also an original song written by a Fullbright intern!

The voice acting is also great by necessity. Everyone had to communicate their personalities with voice and body language, no facial expressions, and they succeeded with flying colors. Also ODIN's voice is smooth as butter, I could listen to it all day.

Technical & Other
As I mentioned before the game is short. The game time is extended with a director's commentary mode, which I fully recommend. The developers are very charming! The only reason I have as many hours logged as I do is because I encouraged my partner to play it as well.

The game ran smoothly on my RTX 2070, so I'm not sure how helpful that is.

Overall
Tacoma is an amazingly deep narrative experience and it is definitely worth your time. If you are a fan of walking simulators, there is no question, you should play this game. If you aren't yet a fan, please give it a try - as long as you aren't expecting action or difficulty, it should not disappoint.

Follow our curator page, OCG-Curations, if you like and want to see more reviews like this one.
 
marglark
817 produits enregistrés
2
70 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
2.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 aout 2017

>Tacoma is estimated to take around 2 to 5 hours to complete. How deep you dig and how much detail you find is up to you. Tacoma is a non-combat, non-puzzle-focused game. The details of the story and gameworld are there for you to discover at your own pace.

That's from the game's description. It's important. 2 hours, and I poked around a bit. 5 hours if you pick up every bag of chips and piece of trash laying around and admire it.

Overall, this is just a really, really, really short book that is somewhat interactive. You don't influence the outcome one bit, nor can you influence the 'interactive' scenes. You just watch them. You can move around and watch from different angles, but that's all it is.

Once you watch the scenes, the game progresses and tells you to turn the page, so to speak. Then you go watch another chapter, with only 3-4 chapters, depending on how you look at it.

Did I enjoy it? Yes. It was a good story. It was deep and suspenseful, for as little story as there is.

Is it worth the money I spent on it? No, not even close. Nowhere near it. A 2-hour 3D movie doesn't cost this much. There is no replay value here, either. Once you see it, that's it. You've experienced all it has to offer. By the time you finish, the beginning is still fresh enough that there's no desire to re-do it.

Overall - thumbs down, because it's being sold four at least four times what it's worth, in time and content.
 
foundflame

33 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Non recommandé
4.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 février 2018
The Coma 2088: A Space Borefest.

  • Do you like snooping around other people's items, when they are not around?
  • Do you like playing games with nothing interesting or engaging going on?
  • Do you enjoy playing games that bash you over the head with their own political ideals?

Well, then Tacoma, may just be the story for you.

The following quotes about this game...

PC Gamer a écrit :
“A mystery that grabs hold of you the instant your magnetic boots clamp to the station and never lets go... Immensely rewarding.”

And...

Destructoid a écrit :
“A story that's both gripping and emotional... The little details packed into the space station are touches of the sublime.”

...Are falsehoods

Let me explain,

There is some nice aspects to this game that I really liked, the whole premise itself really intrigued me that I had it in my wishlist but before I got around to it, it came as part of the monthly Humble Bundle and there was much rejoicing... just not for long.

The visuals are satisfying enough, the whole premise is extremely interesting but that is about it, everything else is shallow and tedious for me, beyond my belief.

Your character is Amy Ferrier, a space enginneer contracted to recover data from the Tacoma Space Station, but spends the whole game looking around the station orbiting the moon for clues to resolve this 'grand mystery' as to what has happened there but sadly the mystery aspect is severly lacking. I spent the whole time looking around for some semblance of an interesting story, yet found none. There was no emotional connection, I felt nothing but the need to jab myself in the balls with a fork to help stay awake while playing this tedious tripe.

One aspect that I liked (but was also VERY disappointing) was the Augmented Reality memory access, that you can unlock when you enter a new area for the first time, as you then watch humanoid 3D projected images representative of the Tacoma crew, interact with one another and their surroundings, while you listen to what they were discussing, leading up to the events that brought your character Amy to Tacoma to begin with.
I loved that mechanic in games, it reminded me of the similar game mechanic from the Capcom published title Remember Me where you can rewind, pause and then replay. Here it is used to follow different characters from the same scene, to then access more data when the NPC's open up their own AR device, as we then learn something else new. At least in theory.

So, why is something that I really like, so very disappointing?

Well, that is because it is all in the service of nothing. How it was implemented. It wasn't used to reveal some great twist (just once) or to move the story along, it was just more backstory than anything else. Every time I opened up the NPC's own AR interface, I hoped for a juicy jaw dropping reveal as to what was going on but what I kept getting, was even more back story through the characters' own communication with each other, which would be fine if it wasn't such a tedious read and became relevant within the story itself but it doesn't, most of the time. It is filled with meaningless platitudes and declarations of love for one another. I DID NOT CARE. I wanted a story, I got a dodgy soap opera played out over in Tacoma's own AR twitter. What a waste of potential and such a missed opportunity.

Apart from liking the premise of Tacoma, it is also very polarising with them shoving their politics into the game, for no other reason than for the developers to say to you 'Hey, we are Progressives and this is our world view,' Rather than have something to say about it, it is just there for the sake of it. It adds nothing and is immersion breaking because it is an ideal, not reality in anyway. As soon as I spotted this, I knew none of those crew members were going to be the antagonist/s and predicted correctly who was. It then ceases top be a mystery.

So if that is off putting to you, then I do not recommend this game at all. I mean, they don't really say it out loud but it is hardly subtle about it either, to the point where as soon as I read one character's profile in their AR interface HUD, I raised an eyebrow and it wasn't long after that, that I saw what was coming next. This is not that important to me, I could have put up with it but I found it very noticeable and it really felt like it ruined the game, as it made it predictable and overshadows the narrative. That does not endear me to any game (or movie, unless it has something to say regarding it).

This may partially explain the sheer volume of unwarranted praise, as far as I am concerned that this title has recieved because if you cannot tell by now, I really dislike Tacoma.
It may also help to explain the lack of anything engaging within the story here because it isn't interested in telling a great Sci-Fi fable of mystery and intrigue, it is far more focused in telling you what it is, rather than engaging us with a potentially great story and it does that through a tedious bore of characters, who are not guilty of Wrong-Thinking.

In fact, if they were capable of it, I wouldn't at all be surprised if these developers were trying to socially engineer people, with their ridiculously obvious propaganda but thankfully, they are terrible writers.
I have no problem with them having their Progressive ideology but my problem lies with their ideology being paramount over that of a good story, when I believe it should be the other way around. I wonder, did they help edit Rian Johnson's script for The Last Jedi? That's how blatant it is.

Unless you are on the Far Left and like tedious, soap opera dialogue, avoid The Coma Tacoma.

Now to preemptively defend myself from the inevitable slow witted, angry easily triggered & permanently offended.

I am not Right Wing, nor am I Alt-Right, I am certainly not a Nazi or Hitler reincarnated and most importantly I am not 100% against Progressive Ideals. I am, however, against bad story telling and very interested in a great Science Fiction, which is absent from this game. They could have easily had a decent story within the game right along side their identity politics, if only they had something to say regarding any of that but they don't do it.
They seemed far more interested in looking like what their own perception of what a good person is, rather than to tell an interesting and engaging story. It is akin to enjoying smelling their own farts and then expecting everyone else who smells it, to enjoy it too.
I am also not against homosexuals or transgendered people, I believe they should be able to do what they want within the confines of the law but that goes for everyone else is too. Whether intentional or not, this game feels a lot like they were more interested in Social Engineering than to make great games. In fact, the only reason I mention it is because it was blatant to the point where it was a detriment to it's own narrative as I knew who was going to be the bad guy as soon as I spotted what this game was and I was proven correct. I'm sure I am not the first.

It reeks of propaganda and FTR, I am a traditional Liberal, a word that has forever been tainted because of the sort people who make games like Tacoma.
 
Punkster
475 produits enregistrés
17
8 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
3.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 novembre 2018
Learning from the mistakes of Gone Home
Tacoma
is Fullbright's second endeavor into the walking simulator genre and this time they've done it right.

As I mentioned in my Gone Home review here, one of my main issues with Fullbright's first game was not the story itself but rather its presentation to the player. Pure expositional text and/or dialogue is a terrible way to get the player involved in your adventure game.

Tacoma enthralled me immediately with it's AR (augmented reality) system from the trailer and the way it plays out in the game is brilliant to say the least.

You will be playing as Amy, an investigator send to the Tacoma space station in 2088, to find out what happened to the 6 person crew aboard. Uncovering the story comes via the form of an AR system which recorded the events that took place on the station. Since the premise is set in the distant (or maybe not so distant?) future, expect a lot of sci-fi/sci-fantasy elements to be prominent throughout the entire plot of Tacoma but at the same glimpse into social and political commentary of the future of humankind.

The AR feature is a near perfect medium to explore these stories and finally learn the truth regarding Tacoma and its crew. Upon entering an area you will unlock a short AR session, lasting around 2-5 minutes, in which graphical silhouettes of the crew will play out that specific scene.
This allows you to freely explore and delve deeper (or rather as deep as the game allows you which is not a lot but that's fine) into the psyche and history each crew member and the events that took place during that time period.

Furthermore, the AR system allows the user some form of manipulation via rewinding/fast forwarding or exploring different areas of the recording to give a deeper sense of exploration. Again, don't expect anything too complicated from the game but it certainly felt quite refreshing to use this system in a walking simulator game.

Their relationships with each other, their personalities with their faults and graces, will be inferred by the AR system replays and of course by reading their mails and exploring their personal quarters.

The story as you'd expect has plenty of twists and turns but at its core is an alright sci-fi entertainment. Nothing too revolutionary for fans of the genre but the fantastic voice acting did wonders to keep me interested in the crew and their stories. There's an air of mystery as it is to be expected and unlike Gone Home, that mystery remains a mystery till late in the game.

The length is short, around 2-4 hours with leisure 100% exploration, and truth be told I was hoping for a tiny bit more because I very much enjoyed the overall experience of the game.

There are a few puzzles to solves, almost the entirety is finding codes and keys to access some optional areas or open lockers, but nothing really beyond that.

Even in Gone Home, I noticed that Fullbright had potential. Sure it was their first game and for the most part it felt very bland despite the interesting premise, but in Tacoma they have actually done a pretty stellar job in the visual storytelling department. The story is well presented, the characters are pretty decent (game length in a limiting factor for proper character development) and the space station itself along with the AR system felt really fascinating to explore. As far as walking simulators go, especially for sci-fi fans and despite its short length, getting this one on a sale is very solid choice that will keep you satisfied for a few hours.
 
Ionpath
1,015 produits enregistrés
0
51 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
3.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 aout 2017
Полная версия, без цензуры и со всей страшной правдой - http://www.fatcatslim.ru/2017/08/myortvyiy-kosmos-recenziya-na-igru-tacoma.html

А вот здесь вы можете подписаться на куратора Steam - http://steamcommunity.com/groups/vgblogsru#curation

От Tacoma ждали слишком многого. Ролики интриговали перспективой проследить личные истории сразу шестерых персонажей и узнать некую масштабную тайну. Да и стилистика казалась очень и очень интересной: вроде бы далёкое - 2088 год - будущее, но с примесью анахронизмов из фантастических фильмов 80-х. И конечно же романтика бескрайнего космоса (хоть речь и шла о базе на орбите Луны).

Но по факту в Fullbright двинулись по самому простому и очевидному пути, вместо того, чтобы сосредоточиться на сюжете и придумать новые приёмы повествования.

Если отбросить в сторону весь контекст, то выясняется, что Tacoma не может предложить ровным счётом ничего. Ну, кроме разве что симпатичной картинки, выдержанной стилистики и неплохо оптимизированного движка Unity.

История представлена набором клише, местами плохо подогнанных к друг другу. Если не вдаваться в подробности, то возникает чувство, что абсолютно всё, включая финальный "Вот это поворот!" - сочинения какого-нибудь не слишком расторопного и сообразительного семиклассника. Совершенно нелепые твисты, акцент на личных драмах, которые выеденного яйца не стоят - в игре есть всё, что обычно встречается в произведениях "российских фантастов". Да и интригу выдержать создатели не в силах, поэтому истинные причины происходящего понимаешь если даже не в середине двухчасового прохождения, то где-то около.

С механикой тоже не всё ладно, хотя казалось бы. Стандартные прогулки и чтение записок и личных дневников в Fullbright решили заменить... прогулками и чтением записок и личных дневников, но с нюансом! Во-первых, различные отсеки разблокируются поочерёдно и строго по желанию авторов. Во-вторых, архивы с данными в 90% случае повреждены, поэтому часть информации вы не получите. В-третьих, нам приходится расшифровывать голографические записи, сделанные ИИ станции "Такома", так что приготовьтесь бегать за несколькими героями, чтобы проследить всю цепочку их мыслей и действий. Взламывать личные терминалы тоже позволяют строго в определённые моменты, так что приходится перематывать вперёд-назад пропущенные участки. В результате продолжительность и без того скоротечного приключения увеличивается примерно вдвое. Но все эти манипуляции с трёхмерными AR-записями очень быстро надоедают, потому что не все они одинаково полезны и интересны для общей сюжетной канвы.

Да и вообще Tacoma сложно воспринимать как законченное произведение, а не очередную технодемку. Интересная вселенная, которую можно обозначить как "посткиберпанк про покорение космоса", намечена лишь пунктиром. Центральные персонажи довольно шаблонные, да и раскрыты плоховато. Главная отрада - визуальная эстетика: в свои лучшие моменты игра немного напоминает упрощённый до невозможности Prey. В остальном рядовой (но, правда, сносный) симулятор ходьбы, создатели которого обещали слишком много всего интересного.
 
atomic_reactor
6

I really enjoyed this as a follow-up to Gone Home. The mystery is intriguing and I really liked getting to see how it played out. The space station is a neat environment and used well to tell the story. The AR sequences are elegantly implemented too. Good stuff all around.

Évaluation publiée le 30 septembre 2017
Solid narrative exploration game with a speculative SF theme that hits all the right marks. Varied cast of characters, and a story that keeps you guessing until the very end. Really smart main mechanic behind the storytelling.
 
Lord_Kristof
0
11 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
3.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 février 2019
Новый симулятор кручения вещей в руках от разработчиков Gone Home. Да-да, это те самые игры, где уровень проникновения игрока атмосферой зависит от того, сколько вещей вы осмотрите и как долго будете это делать.

Сюжет прост, как... Чёрт, если честно, даже не знаю. Он прост настолько, что после прохождения мысль только одна: и это всё? И ощущение, будто вся история прошла мимо. При этом везде говорится о невероятных поворотах, неожиданном финале... Почему всё это меня не коснулось? Это точно была та игра?

Российские обзорщики сильно ругают игру за толерантность. Ну т.е. экипаж станции состоит из 6 человек, среди которых (подмножества пересекаются): 5 не-американцев, 4 женщины, 3 гея, 2 человека с сильно лишним весом (в космосе???), 1 мусульманка (даже в платочке на голове на фото в личном деле). Окей, не проблема, но это как-то используется в сюжете? Нет. Расовые конфликты? Нет. Тогда в чём смысл набирать такую разношёрстную компанию? Чтобы показать, как в будущем всё хорошо, и процветает дружба народов? Или чтобы обвинить официальные издания, которые посмели бы оценить игру менее чем на 1000 баллов из 100, в нетолерантности? Разработчики просто взяли современные чувствительные темы и нагло эксплуатируют их не ради сюжета, но ради плюсов к карме. Потому что характеры никак не раскрываются и персонажи, в отличие от своих объёмных проекций, плоские. Ещё один действующий герой, которого можно было раскрыть - ИИ космостанции. Но и тут неудача. На ИИ он совсем не похож, скорее на ограниченно запрограммированного виртуального ассистента.

В игровой процесс входит, как уже упоминалось ранее, кручение предметов, а также просмотр записей произошедшего. Каждая запись длится несколько минут, и обычно действие происходит в нескольких комнатах, по которым разбредаются персонажи, поэтому чтобы узнать всё целиком и прослушать все диалоги, надо проиграть запись несколько раз, меняя локацию. Это немного утомляет, потому что каждый раз ожидаешь, что получишь что-то интересное, но... Всё очень пусто и безэмоционально.

Комп у меня такая себе картоха, но всё равно не понимаю, откуда взялись дичайшие фризы при смене локации. Мы просто едем в лифте (кстати, там классная релаксирующая музыка), откуда лаги длиной в десяток секунд?

Крайне удивило интерфейсное решение. Обычно в играх при открытии игрового меню со всякими инвентарями, способностями, картами и заданиями есть несколько вкладок, которые удобно переключать. Здесь же это происходит так: открывается меню с четырьмя расположенными по углам экрана опциями (карта, сообщения и т.д.), игрок выбирает опцию, и... Нужная ему штука открывается сбоку. Чтобы её увидеть, надо сдвинуть курсор. Это трудно описать верно, но такие странные интерфейсы в играх редко встретишь.

Ещё тут есть карта, которая сделана примерно с такой же оригинальностью, как и интерфейс. Тоже лучше один раз увидеть.

Зато песня из титров Floating Room - Dead Weight ушла в плейлист, но эту заслугу трудно приписать разработчикам. А покрутить в руках можно хоть рулон туалетной бумаги. Более вероятно, что просто симулятор ходьбы - это не мой жанр, и пора прекращать жрать кактусы.
 
Jade
1
72 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Non recommandé
2.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 décembre 2018
In a story-heavy video game, it is important that a story be well-told. I think this does... okay on that front. The AR log mechanic was decently executed and intuitive, and novel enough in its way.

But it is also important that your story be GOOD.

The setting is the near-future where apparently astronauts are not subject to physical standards of any kind, and AI apparently obviates the need for professionalism or expertise, or even any substantial amount of work.

Space is an inhospitable place. Most of your time spent in it is spent ensuring you will stay alive. Physical fitness and constant diligence are imperative to survival, and any health complications at all disqualify you because the human body was not built for space and the slightest hiccup could kill you.
And yet 90+% of the AR recordings you find are of people spending their time goofing off, navel-gazing, or wringing their hands rather than actually working.
And I'll be frank: If you want me to buy a story about space, try not shoehorning in your overweight/midget married lesbian couple into it like a couple of token inclusivity check-marks. Token inclusion is INSULTING, not a compliment. If you don't know how to insert a character NATURALLY into a story, chances are good you probably shouldn't insert them at all.

Spoiler Alert:

And of course the icing on the cake is that the protagonist is a member of an "A.I. Liberation Front" which "rescues" software from its oppressive creators, and the antagonists are cartoon villains who would kill a half-dozen people to help persuade people to legalize fully A.I.-run stations rather than just making automated stations with dumber software that didn't qualify as A.I. It's an embarassingly transparent narrative.
And as usual, a story about A.I. becoming self-aware dumbs down the concept so much as to make it meaningless. The nature of consciousness? We can't even prove it exists among HUMANS, so it makes for a very interesting concept to explore in a story, full of self-reflection and doubt, and consideration of our own existence and mortality.
But instead they reduce it to: The computer did something against orders, it must be a real boy.

In conclusion: The story would have been okay if it had been set virtually ANYWHERE but in space. But because they clearly have no appreciation for what life on space entails, it falls horribly flat.
 
Kire_DuHai
3
7 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 décembre 2018
Di certo uno sci-fi che merita, trama abbastanza interessante e che "prende", ben curate e variegate le ambientazioni nonostante le ridotte dimensioni dell'astronave. Il gioco è scorrevole e molto semplice, così come grafica e sonoro, un passatempo che intrattiene ♥♥♥ interesse, soprattutto se si ha parecchia voglia di cercare e leggere. Ho apprezzato l'assoluta mancanza di violenza e le formule di investigazione... I "problemi" (volendo definirli così) riguardano durata e rigiocabilità. La prima è quasi imbarazzante, finito in 4 ore ed è stato più il tempo che ho perso alla ricerca di achievements che per il gioco stesso, considerando che l'ho acquistato in offerta a poco più di 4€ va detto che ti costa 1 euro / ora gioco, nonostante ciò non rimpiango assolutamente la spesa. Rigiocabilità praticamente nulla, ma è una caratteristica di questo genere di giochi. Ho difficoltà a consigliarlo a prezzo pieno ma di certo è un'esperienza ludica che andrebbe fatta!
 
JNT | Keyser Söze

0
Recommandé
3.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 février 2018
A walking simulator by the developers of Gone Home. I didn't really care for Gone Home, have they improved with this game? In my opinion, yes. You're on a spaceship with recordings left of people due to their employer recording EVERYTHING. Even them showering. Though what you see is more an outline of a person without significant detail.
The recordings comprise entire areas and quite a few people. You will not be able to see everything in one go, but you can rewind and fastforward the recording at any time.

The story, what happened on the space station is quite interesting. I enjoyed the characters, which of course is important when that's all you basically have. Aside from what happened to the crew there is another overarching story concerning why you came to the space station. Making sure you stay interested.

Would recommend to people that don't mind Walking Simulators, though this does have more interactivity than you might expect from one.
 
omega64
1,865 produits enregistrés

Recommandé
2.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 décembre 2022
I’d say this is one of the best of its kind, if you’re into walking simulators.

I could enter three major sections of the space station in a specific order and play back AR recordings of the ghostly appearances of the crew members. It was even possible to rewind and fast forward while walking between their spacetime placeholders. Sometimes I could access their AR logs and mail system too. The only thing that required a little bit of attention was if a 4-digit code for a door was revealed.

Pros
  • Very detailed and pretty graphics, with lots of objects to gaze at.
  • The voice acting for the colorful placeholder actors is excellent across the board.
  • Sensible user interface and controls.
♥♥♥♥
  • Don’t expect any puzzles. The only thing you need to do is to look out for 4-digit codes.
  • Prepares the ground for multiple endings but only appears to have one.
8/10
Extended version: https://blog.chordian.net/2022/12/23/tacoma/

Сказать что я разочарована - не сказать ничего. 419 рублей за 40 минутную игру с невнятным сюжетом "из ниоткуда в никуда". Графика красивая, управление легкое, но на этом все. 3 точки для осмотра и возвращаемся на свой корабль который летит не известно куда...Серьезно? Серьезно на это было потрачено столько денег? Эта игра не стоит больше 50 рублей. Если хотите во время часового обеда на работе релакснуть - это оно... но, черт возьми, не за 419 рублей!

Recommandé
6.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 mai 2019
Tacoma ist ein kleiner aber feiner Walking Simulator mit einer spannenden Geschichte, die so ganz anders verläuft, als gedacht.

Die Story spielt an Bord einer Raumstation zwischen Erde und Mond. Unser Auftrag ist es, nach einer Katastrophe die Künstliche Intelligenz der Raumstation zu bergen. Ein einfacher Job, wären da nicht die Stationsaufzeichnungen und persönlichen Logbücher der ehemaligen Crewmitglieder, die wir während unserer Bergungsmission Stück für Stück rekonstruieren und so den eigentlichen Hergang der schockierenden Ereignisse erfahren. Hierbei muss sich ein guter Teil der Story auch im eigenen Kopf abspielen.

Die Art und Weise, wie die Geschichte erzählt wurde, hat mir hierbei sehr gut gefallen. Anhand der Aufzeichnungen projezieren wir die Vorgänge in den Raum. Hierbei erscheinen die Besatzungsmitglieder nur als farbliche Umrisse. Dennoch kann man die verschiedenen Persönlichkeiten schnell voneinander unterscheiden, hat doch jeder seine eigene Körpersprache, seine eigene Stimme und seine ganz eigene Geschichte. Dies wird noch intensiviert dadurch, dass auch das ganze Schiff, die privaten Quartiere und Büros viele kleine Details über jede einzelne Person an Bord und ihr Leben innerhalb der Gemeinschaft preisgeben. Bringt man die Lust und die Geduld auf, sich Zeit beim Erkunden zu lassen, wird man viel mehr zu entdecken haben, als es auf den ersten Blick erscheint.
 
Ayyynchen
948 produits enregistrés
0
20 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
5.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 avril 2018
细节的堆筑，冰山的一角。
这是我通关Tacoma以后的第一反应。

本作令人惊艳的地方，在于细节。
细节，既是指游戏内建模可圈可点的清晰程度和细节刻画，也是指游戏外对氛围、背景的层层铺垫，也指游戏本身优化、本地化的精细程度。
细节之美，存在于Tacoma的方方面面。其对细节的刻画，从很多方面来讲可以说是登峰造极的。

画面

平心而论，综观Tacoma的画质，不能讲使人惊艳，但用审视17年游戏的挑剔目光放在其身上，也绝无可能说其不合格。
而在Tacoma最引以为豪的细节上，小到磁力靴、手套上适时亮起的指示灯，大到一个个可调查物品以假乱真的纹路、文字内容和配色（尽管硬件的限制仍旧造成了美中不足的缺憾），无数细节充斥于空间站中。
当玩家突然找到了足以博其一笑之处时，那抹真实感和沉浸感即是Tacoma的妙处之一。

情节

抛开一切修饰和铺垫，讨论狭义上的，线性的主要剧情，Tacoma在其中涉及了AR、AI等热点技术，以及星际殖民、未来科技、人性这些传统而永不过时的话题，甚至还包括一些（架空的）历史、意识形态讨论。但与现在为数不少的”蹭热点“的信息垃圾不同，Tacoma确确实实将这些要点纳入了故事之中（而非强行压缩了进去），向玩家交了一份短小但足可差强人意的答卷——一个发生在未来，反应当下人们善恶观、价值观，涉及了幻想中的未来科技、太空要素的大团圆的小品故事。

剧情的短小是本作最大的缺点，商店页面的介绍所言不假，其流程很难长于5小时，这在现在的快餐式游戏中似乎更是完全无法被理解的——我为什么要花钱买一部几个小时就通关的东西？
但真的是这样吗？
我们来仔细想想，当你在玩Farcry，在玩起源的时候，你到底在玩什么？
是制作者锐意打磨的精彩剧情吗？是制作者精心留下的一点点细节、彩蛋吗？
遗憾的是，尽管我不否认上述内容的存在，更多的时候，我在跑图，我在完成基本由机器生成的、单调重复的支线（甚至是这样的主线），即使我玩的是巫师3这样久负盛名的鸿篇巨制，也避免不了把大部分时间拿去探索一个个”？“号。
去掉这一切”电脑陪你玩电脑“的时间，这些游戏剩下的，那些真正让制作组花了大功夫录制的CG、编制的剧本，传递的思想……这些东西大概能让你体验多长时间？
把一个游戏中最新颖的模式、最优秀的体验、最丰富的情节、制作人最想向你传达的思想，压缩在最短的时间里，大概要多长时间？

这就是Tacoma了，它让你玩到一切制作组为你提供的、用新颖的模式展开的有趣要素和创意，并在重复和单调感吞没你之前落下帷幕。
再看看是哪些要素让它做到了这点：
Tacoma成功而又创造性地引入了AR元素叙事，其中的沉浸感无疑为这一场温馨的太空小品增色不少，我无法想象这款游戏有朝一日若能挣脱硬件的禁锢，保持其画面水准进入VR时将能给玩家带来多大的冲击（当然硬件的限制让这很长时间都只能是场梦了www）
另一个堪称惊艳的点即是存在于零散细节中的对游戏背景的刻画。在我看来，尽管有游戏体量的限制，Tacoma利用碎片细节交代游戏背景的处理手段和处理能力都足以让人为之拍案叫绝，比起质量效应、巫师这种世界观宏大且完善的游戏，Tacoma在丰富度上或有不足，交代手段上却更为高明。日常用品、新闻媒体、生活碎片……Tacoma应用了能够刻画未来生活的一切表现形式，构筑了这一个涉及不多却真实感强烈的未来空间站，甚至是整个太阳系，还有这群性格各异却都能被反映出来的生还者，这是最让我感到讶异和佩服的手笔。

体验

从刺激的战场退下来，体验这款散步、观影模拟器，可能会让很多习惯了3A大作的玩家感到一时间的不适。毕竟，本作没有战斗，按键简单不需要操作空间，解密要素存在感微弱，甚至连全篇最大的阴谋也会在最后干干净净地暴露在玩家眼前。
但是，这才是生活。
生活不会把你时刻扔进战场，即使你无时不刻能感受到其存在；生活不会随时给你发来一个个谜题，仅仅是因为你有解开的能力；生活不会给你编织一个个所谓的巨大阴影，哪怕你发在推特上的阴谋论已经收获了上万个like和上千转推。
生活是Tacoma，是纯粹而真实的体验，是一个真正的、普通的人的一次精彩历程。
没有哗众取宠的超级英雄，远离抱着不放的各式枪械，偶尔体验一下这样的游戏，也挺好的。
玩家在Tacoma里面可以做一个人会做的事情：拿起一个逼真的工艺品细细端详，掏出一本杂志翻翻封面封底，甚至恶趣味地把骷髅头玩具拿去扣篮；玩家也具有极其节制的上帝视角：遍历过去特定时点的时间轴，出现在允许的时间和空间点，但这一切终究是历史的成像，你可以了解，却不能改变。

另一个很容易影响游戏体验的因素是本地化程度，值得庆幸的是，本作支持包括简中在内的多种语言（这些语言甚至直接出现在游戏内的创作要素中，而非仅仅作为游戏本土化的翻译文本而存在），翻译也具有一定水准，就算放在现在的steam环境下，这也弥足珍贵。

总结

+创新的叙事手法
+令人惊喜的模型细节
+史诗级的背景铺垫——技巧意味上
+丰富的人物刻画，而且是不仅仅为了主要故事服务的多元刻画
+贴心到位的本地化措施
+有深度的故事，有文化和思想的交流和冲击
+清新的游戏体验
+丰富的热点话题

-游戏剧情过短

综观整个Tacoma，游戏透露出了制作者的一种极度的节制和追求——对自己和玩家滥用上帝特权和杀戮特权的节制，对游戏细节巧妙而又认真到几乎病态的追求。
这解释了为什么这部作品不适合那些不愿在游戏中体验生活，一切行动需要靠游戏内的激励实现而无论这激励有多么低劣的快节奏玩家——Tacoma注定不是一作快起来的游戏，能够驱动玩家感受这款游戏所构建的虚幻的真实的力量，必须根植于玩家的内心。
没有明确的指令，没有低劣的激励，有的只是制作者构建的，让“快人”费解，“暇人”有机会品味的这种节制，这种追求。
但就是这种节制和追求，恰恰是我们都应当去尝试理解的。这不仅是游戏制作者独有的，更是每一个玩家，或者说，每一个人，作为对自己人这一最大特性的认同而必须要具有的节制和追求。
我们生活在游戏之外，没有一日千里的未来科技，没有心向善良的人工智能，没有血流成河的杀戮地狱，没有为所欲为的上帝特权，也没有鼓掌之间的时间空间。
但我们是人的性质不以任何要素而转移，生而为人，保持着矛盾而统一的个体和社会属性，心怀善意和谦卑，贯彻自己的“真实”。
这是Tacoma上的每一个成员在做的，也是我们该做的。
 
Chu_Nep|马萨契瑟姆的萨尔
0
9 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0

You know when players say they can't understand all the negative reviews because a game was so good? This was just the opposite for me, I tried so hard but just couldn't get into it. It was a confusing jumbled mess with no direction from the game where to go or what to do next. Not even the slightest tiniest nudge. I really wanted to like it, I really appreciate different quirky games. It just didn't click for me, but I guess many other players like it so I guess there's got to be something good about it.

Recommandé
2.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 novembre 2021
2088年の宇宙ステーション「Tacoma」で重大なアクシデントが起きたため、下請け作業員の主人公がTacomaに乗り込み真相を明らかにするウォーキングシミュレーターです。

システム的には戦闘も謎解きもないウォーキングシミュレーターであり、進むべき場所はわかりやすく指示されるため迷う要素はゼロです。
Tacoma内は完全な無人となっていますがAR（拡張現実）データが各所に残されているため、これを回収することが主目的となります。
ARデータを再生するとTacomaのクルーたちの過去の映像と音声が現在のTacoma内に投影されます。
それを見ればアクシデントの内容とそれにクルーたちがどう対応したかがわかるのですが、同時にクルーたちが持つメールなどの文書も見ることができるため、クルーたちの背景や行動理由もわかるようになっています。

ARデータをずっと見ていくだけなので少し退屈な進行ではありますが、ストーリーは意外な展開を迎えますし、そこに至る伏線もあちこちに張られており、全体的に面白いストーリーでした。
2時間程度でクリアできるのでサクッと良ストーリーを楽しみたい方にオススメです。

 
Reversal!

1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante

グラフィックと操作性は良いと思います。ただ一点残念なところは宇宙だけに主人公の動きがゆっくりなところでしょうか、これは人によって評価は変わるかもしれません。
私としたらもう少しストーリーのボリュームが欲しかったなと思います。
 
BLUE

7 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
4.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 décembre 2019
Tacoma is a short story-based game, so I wouldn't say it's worth the full price, unless you explicitly want to thank the developers.

It's a game tagged as a walking simulator and the title pretty much holds true. You explore branches of a space station, listen to dialogue scenes, and occasionally solve the mini-puzzle of locating a key or finding the code for a keypad. Otherwise, the game is simply to learn about the characters and the events that have occurred.

You board this space station in the goal to find out what has happened with its crew. Using the technology you have and the ship's system, you find "replays" of digital versions of the crew and what they were saying in certain moments. Though the occasional replay is broken or corrupted. Also, while some of the replays are going, you can observe what a crew member was looking at in their own system, i.e., emails, documents, etc.

This replay system is also a bit different in that they trigger for areas and not per person. For instance, when in the crew quarters, the replay begins, and you might only see a couple of crew members. You have the ability to fast forward or rewind the replay, and you can run around all of the crew quarters to find the other members of the crew. That way, you can follow each member across the entire time window and see what's going on when some of them are by themselves.

The game had two story aspects that seemed predictable; one of them held true, but the other didn't. So it was a double-edged sword on that part. Nevertheless, I found the whole "replay" system intriguing and it was nice to explore the ship, so the experience was enjoyable.
 
Dravvad
0
11 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
8.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 février 2018
Tacoma is, at its heart, a classic mystery populated with interesting characters and a twisty plot. It provides players with a small world to explore, allowing players to feel like they’re playing an active role discovering what happened.

Players take on the role of a salvage contractor sent to investigate what happened to the crew of an abandoned space station. Your goal is to recover the station’s AI core, exploring the habitats to learn what happened to the crew along the way.

While there are codes and keys to find and notes to read, the most interesting about the station and its crew come via a very believable augmented reality. You can play, fast-forward, and rewind recorded holograms of important events that took place aboard the station. Tacoma's core appeal comes from watching the characters behave differently as they move between areas and interact with each other. You might find one of the crew members having a panic attack in a room by herself and then make her way to another area where she speaks to a colleague in a calm manner.

Tacoma is proof that the American studio Fullbright knows how to tell a good story. Easy to navigate, Tacoma feels like a real and lived-in place loaded with details to discover.

THE GOOD
- Intriguing storytelling
- Strong characters
- Very good voice acting
- Incredibly detailed environment

THE BAD
- Charcters can feel underexplored
- Not especially interactive for some players

8/10

DISASTER | BAD | MEDIOCRE | OKAY | GOOD | GREAT | AMAZING | MASTERPIECE
 
DanishScorpio
1,254 produits enregistrés
0
6 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
9.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 mars 2018
Es un paseo de tranquis por una nave espacial, investigando qué le sucedió a la tripulación. Hay pequeños detalles chulos (es lgtbi, feminista, pro-liberación del tibet...salen libros de S.Plath y M.Atwood...) , hay referencias al mundo bdsm y hay un gato! Bueno, que si no te gustan los juegos cortos, de ir paseando y abriendo puertas y diálogos, Tacoma no es para tí. Pero si disfrutas ♥♥♥ los escenarios de cifi futurista ♥♥♥ IA's y empatizar ♥♥♥ sentimientos humanos, puede gustarte. (Al menos el final me ha sorprendido).
 
JennyLlop N7
0
9 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
2.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 octobre 2019
Not a bad little walking sim with graphics reminiscent of Prey. More a watching sim really, all the exposition is through holographic recordings, which you have to rewind and then watch the 'action' from other areas. Less than 3 hours to complete and lacks the narrative of Firewatch or Observer but worth it on a heavy sale £2-4 at most. 6.5/10

Évaluation publiée le 28 juillet 2020
Produit reçu gratuitement

I am not recommending this so I can give people a heads up between all the recommended reviews:
the story is rather soft, don't expect any messed up plot twists or some dark ending.
(I wouldn't have played this game if I knew it was just all happy days with some drama)

Don't get me wrong, the developers did a great job on delivering the story of the Tacoma crew this just wasn't the experience I was looking for so I am not recommending this because the game is bad, but because I wouldn't recommend it to certain people like myself.


The game did feel refreshing, It was interesting following the crew around in these uncertain times, the voice acting was fine and I didn't get bored listing to most of the conversations. But I was waiting for the moment where the story would kick off but this just didn't happen. It was too much of a happy story with a happy ending for me. Just not my piece of cake.

Évaluation publiée le 9 février 2018
Бывают игры, что требуют от Вас недюжинного скилла. Бывают такие, что просто развлекают, лишь местами заставляя поднапрячься дабы игрок не забывал, что он таки в игру играет и челлендж должен быть.
Конечно же имеют место ещё и игры, вызывающие на поединок с самими собой исключительно ваш мозг, закидывая сложными загадками.
Tacoma не относится ни к тем, ни к другим.
Tacoma 
Une capture d'écran de Tacoma
Par : TOTALFILM

Она словно Journey просто позволяет игроку "Пройти через себя", не ставя ему палки в колёса. Выдвигает на передний план свою сюжетную подоплеку, никак не обременяя загадками или сложными для прохождения моментами.
Задача игрока в данном случае - посетить все отсеки корабля и изъять данные, что представлены в виде записанных голограмм экипажа.

Как и во всех подобного рода играх, существует уйма необязательного контента. Переписки, дневники. Просто расставленные в каютах вещи, что помогут составить наиболее полное представление о лоре игры. И это один из тех случаев, где этого самого контента....в меру. Тут нет десятков тысяч страниц текста, прочитав последнюю из которых игрок скорее всего забудет, что же было в первых. Всё в меру и исключительно в правильных местах.
Ну а что касается самого сюжета. Часто ли вы сталкивались с сюжетом, где....целых два клиффхэнгера?
Tacoma 
Une capture d'écran de Tacoma
Par : TOTALFILM

Начиная игру, у вас в голове быстро выстроится общая картина происходящего. И эта картина скорее удручает, просто таки крича о своей банальности.
Тем более приятен момент, когда сюжет разворачивается на 180 градусов. А потом ещё раз преподносит сюрприз, в самом конце.
Омрачает момент лишь общая забагованность игры.
Сразу говорю, если у вас игра намертво виснет, то не стоит снижать настройки графики. Виснуть она будет в тех же местах.)
Самое смешное, что лечить это надо переключением на английскую версию.
Да, по непонятной мне причине, у меня игра отказывалась работать с определённого момента. Продолжила только после смены языка на оригинальный.
Tacoma 
Une capture d'écran de Tacoma
Par : TOTALFILM

Ну и не знаю ставить это в минус, или же плюс. Но игра очень короткая. Я её завершил за 3 часа, получив при этом все достижения и успев прочитать все переписки, просмотреть голограммы и прочее.
Тем не менее послевкусие она оставляет исключительно приятное.
И я как человек, что сейчас играет в основном на PS4, был затянут вот этой игрой обратно на ПК. Просто потому что она на консоли от Сони так и не вышла. Это что-то, да значит.)

Recommandé
2.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 aout 2017
If you are a fan of "Walking Simulators" such as games like Gone Home, then you can't go wrong with Tacoma. As a fan of the genre, I believe that this towards the top of the charts and has all that I want. A compelling story, good visuals, and lots of stuff to interact with.

It took me just over two hours to complete my first run-through and I feel like I want a little bit more (I missed some stuff so might play again.) The fact that I have a good sense of each character, and want to learn more and more about them, speaks to the writing and delivery. The way in which stories link into each-other adds a layer of depth that too many games don't have. You have multiple story-lines (all inter-twined) weaving in-and-out of each other to add realism and another dimension to this game.

If you are a fan of the genre then I think it is at the top of the list and I highly recommend it. If purchasing a game for $20 and only spending a few hours on it upsets you, then don't purchase this right now.
 
MaCrane

5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
4.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 avril 2018
Mission brief: Crew of Lunar Transfer Station Tacoma evacuated. Subcontractor shall board Tacoma. proceed to Data Access Points in each habitable section and transfer AI data from Station to subcontrator vessel. Retrieve AI Central proccessing network. Return intact AI to Venturis.

Úvodní brífink shrnuje hru Tacoma poměrně přesně. V roli výše zmíněné subkontraktorky Amy vstupujete na opuštěnou stanici s úkolem získat hardware, respektive “wetware”, staniční umělé inteligence. Aby vám nebylo při prozkoumávání stanice tak smutno, máte k dispozici ještě zařízení na augmented reality (hmm.. rozšířená realita? Ta čeština nám občas zní trošku divně:-), díky kterému můžete přehrávat záznamy z dění na stanici těsně před evakuací. Díky kombinaci prozkoumávání osobních předmětů a možnosti přehrávat konverzace pomocí AR pak získáváte jasnější a jasnější obrázek toho, co se to na té stanici vlastně stalo….

AR mechanismus zaslouží ještě další zmínku. Konverzaci můžete posouvát tam a zpátky, a všechno probíhá v reálném prostoru - takže každou scénu budete moci sledovat několikrát: Když přijde inženýr do scény, kterou sledujete až uprostřed záznamu… co dělal do té doby? Povídal si s jinou postavou? Vraťte scénu zpátky sledujte jí tentokrát z jeho perspektivy.. (a pak vám začne dávat smysl, proč se to celé odehrává na vesmírné stanici - holt si to vyžádal způsob vyprávění:-)

Tacoma je vlastně spíš taková povídka. Hra je naprosto lineární, volba hráče je spíš v tom do jaké hloubky hodlá prostředí a osud 6 členů posádky zkoumat. I když se to pojme důkladně, hra není moc dlouhá (za 4 hodiny jsem, myslím, viděl všechno). Linearita podobná knize, ale zase pobízí k tomu hrát pomalu a třeba i na chvíli hru odložit a zkusit se zamyslet kam příběh vlastně směřuje..

Za kolik stojí: 1,5-2€

p.s.: Stejní autoři dříve vydali hru Gone Home - tu jsem ale nehrál, tak nemůžu srovnávat...
 
Blevajznik
1,341 produits enregistrés
0
13 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
1
Non recommandé
2.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 juillet 2021
Космический мусор

Любая оценка является субъективной, в том числе и данный обзор, поэтому прошу не судить строго и не считать меня гелертером. При формировании общей картины мира, людям свойственно полагаться на мнение условного большинства, даже если их мнение отличается. К сожалению, игра Tacoma не достойна настолько высоких оценок, и на то есть несколько весомых причин, главная из которых – пустота и отсутствие значимых событий.

Спасение рядового ОДИНА

По сюжету мы прибываем на космическую станцию Tacoma, чтобы разобраться в том, что случилось на станции, и куда подевался весь персонал. С помощью искусственного интеллекта, называемого ОДИН, мы получаем доступ ко всем видеоархивам и материалам станции. Мы становимся невольным инсайдером и видим все, что происходило на станции в разные периоды, в том числе незадолго до подачи сигнала бедствия. Изучать архивы совсем необязательно, потому как наша единственная задача – установить устройство передачи данных в специальную панель, после чего начнется долгая загрузка. Повлиять на скорость копирования невозможно, вследствие чего проявлять индифферентность становится все сложнее. Дождавшись полного завершения загрузки, мы извлекаем устройство, затем повторяем аналогичную операцию в двух других отсеках станции, после чего разблокируем финальную часть, в которой забираем сам модуль ИИ и покидаем станцию.

ОДИНочество вдвоем

Геймплей можно назвать уникальным, нетипичным для большинства «бродилок» или квестов. Мотивировать себя к исследованию всех уголков станции, загружая аудиовизуальные образы персонала, нас побуждает только нежелание стоять без дела, и дожидаться полной загрузки данных в наше устройство. Проявлять квиетизм сможет далеко не каждый игрок, видимо, на это и был расчет при формировании главной идеи игры. Если Ваше кредо – докопаться до правды любой ценой, то готовьтесь к тому, что в какой-то момент можете испытать катарсис. В какой-то момент игры, может показаться, что эти проекции и образы – живые люди, произойдет метанойя, после чего может появиться эмпатия к этим персонажам. Наш компаньон ОДИН реконструирует всю картину происходящего, наблюдать которую можно будет с любого ракурса. К сожалению, ни на какие уже случившиеся решения повлиять невозможно. Не каждому может понравиться чувство полной беспомощности.

К графике претензий нет, все выглядит достойно. В игре присутствует огромное количество предметов, с которыми можно взаимодействовать. Весь этот хлам можно разбрасывать по своему усмотрению, сваливать в кучи, или же придумать иные способы развлечения. Любое занятие, которое удастся найти во время прохождения, достойно уважения. Порадовало наличие бильярдного стола, с адекватно проработанной физикой, а также кольца для тренировки броска мяча при отсутствии гравитации. Ближе к концу игры, блуждая по всем уголкам станции, удается найти компромат на руководство станции. Деструктивная политика, направленная на получение выгоды здесь и сейчас полностью дискредитируюет проект «Пояс Venturis», подвергая опасности жизнь и здоровье членов экипажа. В экстренной ситуации принимается решение погрузить персонал в криогибернацию, для выживания и дальнейшего спасения. В самом финале события развиваются настолько стремительно, что хочется сбежать со станции вместе с ними. Персонал пробуждается после сна, собирается возле стыковочного шлюза и покидает станцию. Нам остается только проследовать за ними, хотя в реальности это только проекции.

Не Tacoma как все

Честно говоря, пусть лучше я буду диссидентом и пойду против мнения большинства, выставив негативную оценку, чем похвалю игру, мотивируя кого-то на трату времени и денег. Игра покажется совсем другой при первом знакомстве, и может, по итогу, вызвать разочарование в дальнейшем, не оправдав ожиданий. Хочу извиниться перед моими дорогими читателями за все агнонимы и плеоназмы в данном обзоре. Что касается самой игры, не могу рекомендовать к покупке. Одноразовая игра на пару часов, без желания повторить. 5 баллов из 10.
 
V1tal1ty Of Doom
346 produits enregistrés
0
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0

Playing Tacoma was a fun experience. It has an immersive story and it's set in Space! What more could you want? Well, maybe a few more hours of gameplay since you can do everything in about 3-4 hours (1-2 if you rush through it). Still, I really liked the characters and piecing together things by myself. I recommend getting this game if you like narrative experiences and a future space atmosphere (it's not very heavy on puzzles or anything though). Thumbs up!

Évaluation publiée le 14 février 2018
1인칭 3D 어드벤처 게임입니다.
(3D멀미 방지를 위해 옵션에서 시야를 넓히고 하세요.)

우주정거장에서 무슨 일이 있었는지 보면서 이곳저곳 탐사하는 게임입니다. 의외로 돌아다닐 수 있는 공간이 많지 않기 때문에, 클리어에 필요한 플레이시간도 그만큼 짧습니다만 가볍게 즐기기엔 오히려 적당한 것 같습니다.

개인적으로 게임 중반쯤 설마 승무원들이 탈출하지 못하고 극저온 상태에서 사망했으면 어쩌나 걱정했는데 다행히도 제가 선호하는 해피엔딩으로 마무리되서 좋았습...니다.

Évaluation publiée le 10 mai 2020
Really good narrative adventure that actually escapes the common pitfall of walking sims where they feel tedious and dragged out. Had simple mechanics and minimal puzzles but just enough interaction to keep you engaged. It's really the story that will draw you in. I also found the ending pretty refreshing, considering i fully went into this expecting everyone to die .
 
phrenesis
0
19 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
6.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 aout 2017
Fullbright has done it again. Tacoma is utterly beautiful - not just visually but in every single part of it. Not a single detail has gone un-thought-of in this game. The polish is exceptional.

The story is interesting and the method of narrative is unusual and intriguing, the visual design is cohesive and enjoyable, the voice acting is excellent, the level design is absolutely top shelf stuff, the animations are filled with little organic details that make them stand out even when they're deceptively simple in design, A tiny detail that absolutely thrilled me was the way all the characters (in their holographic ghost form even) have different body shapes!!

Sure, it's not a long game - my first playthrough (which was hardly exhaustive considering how many achievements I haven't gotten!) took about three hours. But it's exactly the right length for what it is. It's a self contained experience and I was not left wanting in any capacity. If it was any longer it would be bloated with padding.

As Fullbright's second game after Gone Home, it completely lives up to expectations, and I can't wait to see what the studio does next.
 
Erinkyan
0
17 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
16.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 aout 2017
Pros:
- Story. Obviously not going to spoil it, but it's a damn good one, and it contemplates the lengths to which corporations are willing to go in the name of profit, AI rights and oversight, andthe role of AIs in future human society: As people, or as machines.
- Characters. They're well written, with their own personalities and backstories. Even the AI, ODIN, has a personality all his own and goes through a major internal conflict around midway through the story, though it's only hinted at. However, Tacoma is very short, and its ability to fully flesh out and realize the six (or seven) characters that inhabit Tacoma Station is limited.
- Setting. Aside from the station itself, documents scattered around Tacoma provide an insight into the unique world Fullbright have created for the game, and its refreshing take on the role of corporations in the future.

♥♥♥♥:
- Price. Tacoma is roughly the length of a long movie, and $20 is, in my view, expensive for a game this short.
- Lack of interactivity. The ability to carefully investigate the station alleviates this problem somewhat, and the game's main mechanic, the ability to view, pause, and rewind recordings of the station's inhabitants, is certainly unique, however because the story is set in the past, relative to the protagonist, the ability to affect the outcome of the plot is nonexistent.
 
doormatt
194 produits enregistrés
0
47 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
4.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 aout 2017
Tacoma ultimately suffers from trying to be too different from Gone Home in all of the wrong ways. Where Gona Home had a tight story, Tacoma is loose. Where Gone Home had implied story, Tacoma's is much more laid out. Where Gone Home had a small number of characters to get emotionally invested in, Tacoma has too many.

I really wanted to like the game, and preordered it the second it was available to do so, I ultimately was left feeling disappointed. I just didn't care about the characters and the story is at times disjointed enough that I couldn't get invested with some of them. It doesn't help that the story is fairly obvious and none of the events are surprising. Tacoma is a trope filled mess where all of the events can be guessed by even the most casual sci-fi fan.

Tacoma seems to be a game designed to try to address critisisms of Gone Home from a checklist without any real attention to the criticism is actually saying.

I really wish the game was better, I really wanted it to be. But it just ended up being a disappointment.
 
Ginger Gaming
1,794 produits enregistrés
0
9 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 janvier 2020
Listen, I don't really like walking sims. I don't understand the need to try to validate gaming by making games more like movies. Games are capable of telling stories that are not possible in other media, and I always walk away from walking sims feeling a little uncomfortable with the question of whether I would have enjoyed a movie of this length with this story.

That being said. Fullbright has earned the praise they've been given. I played Gone Home long ago and found it a lot more engaging than what was at the time the high point of the genre (Dear Esther devs, if you magically some day read this, suck an egg). And Tacoma follows suit. It is an exemplar of its genre, I can't deny that. A beacon of environmental storytelling in a sea of idiots who think using creative commons paintings as assets is good world design.

Main complaint: it's just not long enough. It feels awfully clipped in a lot of places. There's literally a point where one of the recordings is shown as 20 minutes and then because of what happens in the plot it jumps straight from the end of the first minute to the start of the last two. There's just so much in-between stuff that is hinted at but then cut, theoretically to make the story tighter, but all it feels like is that the narrative doesn't breathe (haha get it).

Some people call these "immersive sims," right? Not all of them are immersive. This one is. So let me live in the world and get to be with these characters just a little bit longer.
 
Fauxy
586 produits enregistrés
0
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 décembre 2018
Review zu Tacoma

Tacoma ist das zweite Werk der Gone Home-Entwickler. Zwar fand ich, dass Gone Home ein solides Spiel war, jedoch den Kontrast zwischen detailierten Räumen und weniger detailierten Räumen nicht gut hingekriegt hatte. Ein selbiges Problem hat nun auch Tacoma. Es gab beispielsweise kaum Gründe sich die Toiletten in der Station anzusehen, da diese einfach zu uninteressant gestaltet worden waren. Ein Höhepunkt war da noch, dass es merkwürdig aussehende Zahnbürsten gab, und, dass das Paar Nat und Bert zwei Zahnbürsten in ihrem Bad besitzen. Auch Flure, ebenso ein Schwachpunkt in Gone Home, waren nie Orte, an denen man lange verblieben ist, weil sie schlichtweg belanglos waren.
Und das ist okay. Es sind zwar Punkte, bei denen ich mir gewünscht hätte, dass sie etwas detailierter gestaltet worden wären, aber bei Nichteinhaltung wäre das jetzt auch nicht allzu tragisch gewesen. Worauf ich jedenfalls hinaus wollte ist, dass Fullbright teilweise ihre Fehler aus dem Vorgänger ausgemerzt haben, andererseits man jedoch auch Alte hinzugefügt hatte. Dazu zitiere ich mal aus meiner Gone Home-Review:

Das große Problem von Gone Home sind die Untertitel. Diese sind u.a. nicht korrekt, sind nach längerer Spielzeit einfach verschwunden (kein Scherz, die ploppen einfach weg und nur das Neuladen des Spiels behebt dieses Problem) und passen bei längeren Schriftstücken nicht auf den ganzen Bildschirm, weshalb man dann oft nur 3/4 eines Briefes übersetzt bekommt, was bei Handgeschriebenem wirklich eine Qual zum selber Durchlesen sein kann.[...]

Und etwas Ähnliches passiert schon wieder. Für mich sind die Untertitel von Tacoma ein kleiner nerviger Störfaktor. In Tacoma untersucht man nämlich die Crew-Datensätze, um einzelne Teile, wie bei einem Puzzle, zusammen zu bringen und das große Bild im Ganzen zu verstehen. Nur ist es so, dass, wenn man eine Aufzeichnung pausiert, die Untertitel verschwinden und um diese erneut lesen zu müssen, kann man nicht stoppen, sondern muss zurückspulen, was sich mit dem Voiceover natürlich nicht wirklich toll anhört. Wie gesagt, nur ein kleiner Störfaktor, der mir unter die Ohren gekommen war.
Wie dem auch sei. Genug Negatives über Tacoma berichtet. Tacoma ist, abgesehen von kleineren Schwächen, wirklich fantastisch und eine deutlich hochwertigere Alternative zu Gone Home!
Wieder einmal ist der Detailgrad atemberaubend. Es gibt einfach dermaßen viele Details, man glaubt es kaum! Kaffetassen hinterlassen runde Kaffeeflecken; im Aufenthaltsraum gibt es Schlagspuren vom Billiardqueue, da man beim Ausholen mit dem Queue wohl gegen die Wand gedonnert ist; die Beziehungen unterhalb der Charaktere werden nicht nur mit Audioaufzeichnungen oder Chatprotokollen aufgezeigt, sondern auch mit diversen Objekten, die sich in deren Räumlichkeiten finden lassen; und noch vieles mehr! Ich möchte nicht zu viel verraten, aber ich habe mir bei den vielen Details wirklich an den Kopf gefasst, so verblüfft war ich da!
Auch das Spacesetting und die Tatsache, dass man stets allein auf der Raumstation ist, hat mir sehr gefallen! Meiner Meinung nach hat zwar schon Gone Home versucht eine gewisse Isolation zu etablieren, aber bei mir hat es da irgendwie nicht gefunkt, im Gegensatz zu Tacoma!
Tacoma ist wirklich hervorragend und für Genreliebhaber definitiv ein Muss!

Kommen wir für die Schnellen unter uns einfach mal zur Pro-Contra-Liste:

Pro:

+ Bei diversen Gegenständen zeigt das HUD eine Beschreibung, oder Übersetzung des Objekts an. Das war wirklich gut gemacht und deutlich eleganter, als einfach nur Untertitel drüber zu legen. Vor allem, da das szenentechnisch recht gut gepasst hatte, da man sowieso per Visor sich die Datenaufzeichnungen ansehen muss
+ Tacoma hat auch irgendwie etwas von einem Detektivspiel. Wenn man wirklich seine grauen Zellen anstrengt und versucht sich jedes noch so kleine Detail zu merken, dann wird man für seine Ausdauer wirklich belohnt! Mit weiteren Details, die sehr faszinierend waren, versteht sich
+ Der nutzbare AR-Desktop ist ziemlich cool, auch wenn man ihn nicht häufig verwendet hatte. (Das ist eine Art Overlay, dass wie ein HUD funktioniert) Die Überprüfung der AR-Desktops der Crewmitglieder und deren dortige Aktivitäten waren ebenso höchst interessant!
+ Ein erneut sehr hoher Detailgrad, der den Spieler verblüffen wird!
+ Die Geschichtenerzählung, die auf AR-Desktops und Arbeitsplätze basiert, hat mir wirklich sehr gut gefallen! Auch die Beziehungen unterhalb der Crewmitgliedern werden umfangreich beleuchtet und nicht zu schwer präsentiert

Contra:

- Die Ladezeit beim erstmaligem Laden ist schon arg lang
- Kurze Laderuckler beim Umherreisen zwischen Stationen via Aufzug
- Sollte man eine Aufzeichnung stoppen, so verschwindet der Untertitel, insofern ärgerlich, da ich dann umständlich zurückspulen muss, nur um mir durchzulesen, was bereits gesagt wurde. Jene Situation ist zwar nicht häufig aufgetaucht, doch bei Erscheinung dieser, ist das wirklich nervig gewesen

Prontra:

+- Keine deutsche Vertonung, lediglich deutsche Untertitel sind vorhanden
+- Das Intro ist nicht vorspulbar...
+- Es hat mich persönlich gestört, dass, wenn ich nicht direkt zu einer Geräuschquelle blicke, dessen Ton gedämpft zu hören bekomme. Hat mein Amy Ferrier, der spielbare Charakter, etwa Segelohren, sodass ich nur nach vorne hören kann? Laut Lichtbild auf ihrem AR-Desktop nicht...
+- Man kann nicht sprinten. Wie bereits erwähnt sind Flure nicht wirklich interessant gewesen und vor allem bei der Jagd nach Errungenschaften hätte ich mir gewünscht zu sprinten, um schneller von A nach B zu kommen

Tacoma wäre vielleicht sogar eine wirklich faszinierende VR-Erfahrung. Vor allem mit dem AR-Desktop den man vor die Nase kriegt. Tacoma sollte man als Fan des Walkingsimulatorgenres nicht entgehen lassen! Die Spielzeit mit allen Achievements betrug bei mir 5,3 Stunden. Unter Umständen kann man auf einen Sale warten.

Ich danke fürs Lesen und wünsche sehr viel Spaß beim Spielen! ;-)

 
Vazeyo

Évaluation publiée le 3 février 2018
Tacoma is another interesting story told via walking sim, just like its predecessor Gone Home. The AR recordings are an interesting narrative twist that allows the player see what different characters are doing and talking about at a given time. However, I feel this game's environment doesn't flow as well as Gone Home's does and that the major areas of the game feel more segregated.
 
The™ Baron

7 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
8.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 juillet 2023
A semi mystery detective game where you investigate an abandoned space facility to piece together what happened. It's not bad but also generally not as good as the many games of the same genre available.

Unlike The Return to the Obra Dinn, the mechanism falls generally flat compared to the nifty time travel, instead you access past recordings of the crew and piece together clues through conversations and their AR displays. As a mystery it also isn't really anything groundbreaking.

Compared to Gone Home, they used the same method by trying to provide environmental clues to flesh out each crew member but in the end I felt it fell flat compare to Gone Home or games such as What Happened to Edith Finch. There are generally no puzzles per se, nor secrets, a few cursory code breaking and locks which are quite simple. In the end I couldn't connect with the crew or really felt any excitement in playing through.

As a puzzler, that is the weakest link of all as there are generally none of quality, making it more a walking simulator though comparing it to Firewatch the story and discoveries also again pales in comparison.

In the end, its a nice short game to bide your time but it won't be ground breaking, the mystery is not that enticing and crew quite forgettable despite effort to make each unique and their relationship with each other despite some attempts to inject emotion and making us care, fails to deliver.
 
kervinchong
1
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
5.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 septembre 2019
Spannen auf der Raumstation

2017 luden die Entwickler Fullbright aus Portland (bekannt von Gone Home) ein, das Unglück auf der Tacoma-Raumfahrtstation im Jahre 2088 zu untersuchen. Mit einem neuartigen erzählerischen Konzept schufen sie in Tacoma eine interessante Erfahrung, die bei mir aber erst im letzten Drittel zündete.

Odin, hörst du mich? – Die Geschichte und das Spielprinzip
Es ist 2088 – das All ist von Menschen verschiedener Nationenvereinigungen besiedelt und wir – Amy Ferrier – sollen ein Unglück auf der Tacoma-Station untersuchen. Unter Anleitung der fremd- und eigensinnigen KI Odin betreten wir also in Ego-Sicht die Station und bewegen uns durch Personalabteilung, Maschinenraum und Biomedizin, um die Ungereimtheiten an unseren Auftraggeber zu übermitteln.
Dabei aktivieren wir in jedem Sektor eine Augmented Reality-Szene, die von der KI aufgenommen und entschlüsselt wurde: Man sieht also alle Personen in Umrissen ihren Tätigkeiten nachgehen und Gespräche führen, muss sich an ihre Fersen haften, um alles mitzubekommen, und öfter das Ganze wiederholen, um die zeitgleichen Gespräche der anderen mitzubekommen. Dazu gibt es ab und zu Spots, an denen weitere Informationen zu den Personen abgerufen werden können (Bilder, Chats, Anrufe usw.). Eine Vielzahl von anklickbaren Objekten sowie die gewonnenen Infos geben ein umfassendes Bild von den Problemen der Protagonisten wieder. Wichtigste Themen sind dabei die Alltäglichen: Macht der Gewerkschaften, Vereinbarkeit Arbeit und Leben, Jobsicherheit, Abschied von der Familie, gleichgeschlechtliche Partnerschaften und zeitgenössische Politik – aber natürlich vor allem, wie man auf den „Meteoriteneinschlag“ reagieren sollte.

Showering... 
Une capture d'écran de Tacoma
Par : Godofhellfire

Wer will meine Daten? – Eigene Erfahrungen mit Tacoma
Das Narrativ, das sich durch die stückhaften Aufzeichnungen zusammensetzt, ist bis ins Kleinste durchdacht. Jede Person hat einen ausgearbeiteten Hintergrund, Familien- und Freundesbeziehungen usw. Und doch hat mich das Ganze nur durch das innovative Prinzip beeindruckt. Das Spielerische ist sehr mau und auch die Geschichte hat mich erst im letzten Drittel gefesselt und mitgerissen. Ich als Point und Click-Spieler war vor allem verwirrt, dass man zwar alles begutachten und aufnehmen konnte, nichts aber irgendwie mit irgendwas verwenden. Bis auf ein paar offensichtliche Codes gibt es auch keine Rätsel. Alles dient im Grunde nur dem Zweck, ein Bild der sechs Crewmitglieder in ihren letzten Stunden zu zeichnen.

Ah, das war also die Story (letzter Paragraph)! 
Une capture d'écran de Tacoma
Par : Godofhellfire

Im All trinkt man Bischofspils – Grafik, Musik und Sonstiges
Die Grafik von Tacoma ist recht gut, an sich gefällt mir eben eine sterile Raumfahrtstation wesentlich weniger gut als eine Hütte in der Natur. Die Figurenhologramme sind simplifiziert, aber in ihren Aktivitäten (Essen, Sex, Duschen, Arbeiten) lebensecht und toll animiert.
Über die Musik und Hintergrundatmosphäre kann ich nichts Schlechtes und nichts Gutes sagen, sie fiel mir schlichtweg nicht auf. Auch weil sicherlich Wert auf die Verständlichkeit der Gespräche gelegt wurde, die klar und deutlich auf Englisch mit deutschen Untertiteln akzentuiert wurden.
Ich habe 5 Stunden als Amy auf Tacoma verbracht, lässt man die Details beiseite, kann man das Spiel auch in 2 Stunden schaffen (hat aber sicher wenig davon, weil man nichts verstehen wird). Den Audiokommentar der Entwickler werde ich mir noch zu Gemüte führen.
Ansonsten hat man noch 8 Sammelkarten und 12 Achievements, von denen die Hälfte einfach, der Rest recht schwer zu erreichen ist.

Wer mit wem und warum? – Finales Urteil
Tacoma hat bei mir lange nicht gezündet. Hätte ich bei zwei Dritteln aufgehört, wäre meine Beurteilung negativ ausgefallen. Denn das Erkunden des Unfalls durch die Gespräche war meist langweilig und es gab kaum etwas zu tun – außer, dass ich mich als Spanner gefühlt habe. Und das, obwohl ich den Detailgrad bewundert hatte, den die Entwickler beim Entwerfen der Personen und ihrer Beziehungen, ihres Hintergrunds und ihrer Motivationen an den Tag legten. An sich hat es das letzte Drittel herausgerissen, denn wenn man den Plot als Hauptbestandteil des Spiels ansieht, dann ist dies zusammen mit dem Schluss richtig klasse. Tatsächlich kommen alle Fäden zusammen. Somit empfehle ich das Spiel gerade den Leuten, die Spaß an wenig Interaktion, aber tiefen Geschichten haben.

Seemed to me like a rubber doll, but it was something else... 
Une capture d'écran de Tacoma
Par : Godofhellfire

Tacoma punktet durch innovatives Erzählen einer Zukunft im All in Abhängigkeit von KI und großen Firmen. Wenig Interaktivität, viel Details und ein sehr gutes letztes Drittel reichen für eine knappe Empfehlung.

Hast du Lust auf mehr Reviews mit einmal mehr und einmal weniger archäologischen Anmerkungen? Dann komm vorbei und tritt meiner Kuratoren-Gruppe The Archaeologist plays… bei.
 
Godofhellfire

6.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 mars 2018
适合喜欢依靠环境细节沉浸式了解故事剧情以及其背景的步行模拟类玩家。

对于不喜欢此类枯燥发掘、文本量众多、游戏时长短，认为步行模拟甚至不算游戏的快节奏玩家来说想必是糟糕的体验。（差评也大多于此）

作为Fullbright继《Gone Home》后的第二部作品，继承了其优点，但叙事流畅更显大众。6位员工的兴趣爱好、性格描写几乎都能从周围环境中可见一斑，还有一些有趣的小互动，可以看出Fullbright希望迎合更多玩家的妥协。

整体而言《Tacoma》像是一部短小精湛的太空剧情片。

以下吐槽涉及剧透：
1.部分文档里描述了未来中国妄图控制西藏（？），甚至因为某些原因整个种族灭亡的设定。

2.通关后，再看商店页面的
关于这款游戏 a écrit :
文图里斯公司正在准备回收空间站 AI。他们需要你的帮助。
“他们”这个双关很有趣。

3.同样是在上一条里面的：
关于这款游戏 a écrit :
随着任务的进行，你将探索一群空间站已故工作人员曾经的生活和工作细节。
“已故”这个词会让玩家先入为主。
 
ラ
3,064 produits enregistrés
0
6 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 avril 2021
If you like science fiction works such as those of Clarke, Asimov or Niven, then Tacoma is a unique piece of immersive storytelling that you really should check out.

Tacoma is labeled a "walking simulator" probably to let people who expect action games know that this is not one. But the label of "walking simulator" doesn't justly describe the game itself. Tacoma is primarily a novel way of storytelling. Your character, Amy, is a corporate subcontractor sent on a "clean up job" to a damaged space station. The space station has a crew of six, plus one AI. A major eff up happened on it three days ago, with some unclarity on how and why. In all the game except the ending itself, Amy is essentially a fly-on-the-wall watching a story unfold. As you proceed from area to area, you're able to access the station's half-corrupted recordings of the various events that had occurred in those areas, and replay them in "augmented reality" (AR). This AR means that while you walk freely through the rooms and corridors in their present-moment state, your visor adds the wireframes of the six crew members moving around, along with the conversations they had exchanged, back when that recording had been made.

The story of what really happened on that space station is thus not laid out descriptively, it is something that you're piecing together throughout the game by observation. Most of the game is spent in those "AR replays" where you can follow the various crew members to find out what they are doing, what they are telling each other, as well as what they are not telling each other but keeping on their computers or trying to text to one of their off-station contacts (which you can find out about by pausing the AR replay to look at their PDA screens whenever they take them out). As the story unfolds, you'll be connecting what has really happened there and wondering what shall happen to each of the crew members - which you will ultimately find out, and then it will be time for you to tie the one remaining loose end.

Tacoma's SF world-building is rich, and its method of storytelling - freely walking around as you play and replay AR recordings - is novel and unique. Tacoma pulls this off very, very well. It's an old trope of storytelling that the same events get recounted from the perspectives of its various participants, but even when that is done, you're usually taken into the shoes of each of those participants. Not so in Tacoma; in Tacoma you remain in Amy's shoes throughout, you move about through the AR replays as you please, be it to chase a particular crew member to see what they were up to, or to pick up various objects to examine them, or doing whatever else you wish. A few of those objects are giving relevant background to what happened, while most of them are just elaborately crafted objects offering immersion into the experience of living inside such a space station.

So although the broad concept of "seeing the same events from the perspective of its various participants" exists, you remain the observer of all those participants. As if you were a ghost floating through the scene, except that it's the other way around, you are really present there (after the fact), and the other crew members are "ghost AR wireframes" moving around you, but still each of them is made quite real, from their voices (very good voice acting) to all the personal items and traces they left behind. It is a fresh and interesting storytelling concept, enacted in a richly-built SF world, which I recommend you to experience.

P.S. Most negative reviews seem to be off-put by Tacoma being a 2-3 hour game that costs 17 EUR. That is technically correct - other than there being another hour for someone who wishes to explore and soak in all the detail - but whether that should put you off from getting it, is your call. If the price is a problem, you might wait for a sale, but Tacoma being just a few hours long is not a problem when those few hours are a deeply immersive experience into a really good SF story.
 
boris.di.blejd
0

Évaluation publiée le 6 février 2018
A very lovely story. In this novel, you walk around and interact with objects and recover various pieces of information from desktops and from data left behind. Find out what happened to the Tacoma crew, and it's AI, Odin.

I really enjoyed the whole story. It takes around 2 hours to complete, and you can get all the achievements in one run. The characters were interesting, and I am very, very happy on how it ended. You should seriously play it.

By the way, the intro song is "Find me" by Szjerdene. Your welcome.

"5/5"
"Rather magnificent"
- Odin

Évaluation publiée le 30 octobre 2017
As always with Fullbright, the game is story rich, gripping and manages to surprise you at every turns. Saying too much would be spoilery, but it's another great success, same as Gone Home, so do not hesitate.
