ambrevale
397 produits enregistrés
12
8 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 mars 2019
Tacoma is a short and sweet adventure game set on a space station. Things go wrong. Then you show up.

It's a familiar formula, but the team behind Gone Home executes it well. If you want to explore a space station while experiencing a decent, well-written and well-acted story, look no further.

I do think there are two areas of particular note that set Tacoma apart. First, their use of augmented reality (AR) recorded videos to tell the story. Usually you'd get an audio log for something like that, but having the visual aspect is really nice. It almost feels like the Sherlock Holmes games as you're hunting down clues trying to piece the events together. It's really satisfying to see everything click into place.

Second, while there are certainly high stakes, and the game gets dark at times, on the whole it's a positive tale. I can't remember the last time I actually felt happy upon finishing a game in this age of constant apocalypses. There are also plenty of instances of humor throughout. The game is fundamentally good-natured.

Tacoma is what happens when talented people are allowed to make a game they care about and are invested in. More please.
 
Ravenize > *
0
7 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
11.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 avril 2018
Produit reçu gratuitement

Tacoma is a game where they set you out in a space station to explore what happend to the 6 crew members in an accident.

Where do I even begin, the storytelling was amazing. I found the AR-recordings an really intresting concept.
The personalities were very interesting, I just loved getting to know them troughout the game.
The voice actors put on an excellent performance, so emotions are conveyed clearly.
On top of that, the game has beautiful music.

It had a beautfull setting.The first area had the most to do and explore (including darts and a pool table I played with for far too long), but as I progressed there were fewer locks, key codes, and things to play with. I did enjoy that nearly every room had plenty of windows to allow the sunlight to tumble in as the station rotates.

Generally, though, I came out of Tacoma with a warm feeling, I felt like I knew the tacoma crew very well, it was very intresting to see their relationships and how they reacted to everything. Each member felt genuine and unique.

It was a short game (3-4 hours), but the way they implemented everything was great, it was an exciting and unique game. I would have appreciated more time and events that'd have given me a reason to explore more of the beautiful station, but the time I did have in this fascinating hypothetical future was great.

I would definitely buy it for the full price.

Thank you for reading !
Leaving a comment and a like would surely be appreciated !

I went in without spoilers and was surprised at the brilliance of the main mechanic of this game.
There is a set narrative where your choices do not really have an impact and yet it feels like you are given all the freedom to go about exploring the story that is told n here the way you want to, leaving it up to you what details to put your focus on.

Recommandé
9.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 mars 2019
Неплохая научно-фантастическая история, местами антиутопия. В игре нет оживших мертвецов и перестрелок, всё проще - вы как инженер-контрактник должны забрать данные ИИ с аварийной станции, и пока данные сливаются, смотрите видеозаписи, читаете сообщения членов экипажа и таким образом знакомитесь с "миром будущего". Головоломок в игре практически нет, скорее поиск нескольких кодов в закрытые помещения. Сюжет в общем неплох, хоть и короткий. У меня ушло 2 с половиной часа, за всеми достижениями не гонялся. Детям и подросткам не рекомендовал бы, слишком уж много толерастии в этом "будущем".

Русский язык в игре в виде текста, озвучка английская. Русский перевод текста через ДР поверх надписей смотрится несколько коряво, но терпимо. В Linux работает без проблем, глюков не заметил.

CPU: Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-4765T RAM: 16G SSD: KINGSTON SUV300S37A120G
Video: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 960 4G (nvidia-current)
OS: MagOS Linux 2016.64 DE: Plasma+compiz-fusion 1680x1050
 
МихаилZ
3,164 produits enregistrés

2.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 mars 2019
I got this on sale, just because I don't have much disposable income, but had always been interested in it since I watched a play through of Gone home. Generally I put price up there with how much time I spend on it. So games with a ton of replay value are generally worth more in my eyes. And this was just a walking simulator. Albeit, one I had interest in.

If I had the disposable income, I would definitely say this would be worth the full price, but if you can get it on sale. Do it.

I was having a night of very bad thoughts, depression, and things of that sort. Mind going to dark places and all. And I figured, hey. Lets get lost in someone else's world and listen to these stories and things. I know it will be like a longer movie but I figured why not.

I feel much better now. That might be a spoiler but it was definitely a good 2.2 hours. You care for the characters. And you wonder what all happened. I'd say that as a game, this was a damn good one. Would not trade away that tiny bit of time.

Да что с этими инди-играми такое? То скучная, то короткая, то скучная, то короткая. Картинку делать научились, а саму игру нет.

6 инди-игра подряд халтура.

1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
3.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 novembre 2017
Dato che GoneHome è stata, almeno per me, una delle esperienze videoludiche più piacevoli e inaspettate degli ultimi anni, non ho potuto far altro che comprare, di corsa, questo secondo gioco della Fullbright.

3 ore di gioco per 20 euro... E ne sono contento.

Non voglio anticipare nulla sulla trama, per cui mi limiterò a dire che ho trovato l'esperienza molto coinvolgente.

Sia chiaro, nulla di trascendentale; stilisticamente è simile a GoneHome, ma quest'ultimo era forse più profondo e toccante (e anche più inquietante).
Tacoma però si differenzia dalla massa (e dal predecessore) per un grande merito: quello di far vivere un'esperienza SCI-FI molto verosimile e convincente.

Innanzitutto per il lato tecnico, ineccepibile. Tacoma potrebbe tranquillamente essere una tech demo per il motore UNITY (♥♥♥ cui è stato sviluppato).
Non parlo solo della grafica ma della solidità dell'insieme: suoni, fisica, modelli 3D e interazione si sposano a meraviglia e non fanno mai una piega.

Poi per come viene rappresentato il futuro: la storia che ci viene narrata, le persone, la tecnologia. E' tutto al tempo stesso riconoscibile e futuristico. Attuale e distante.
Per me è stato come vedere una vera cartolina dall'immediato futuro.
Non si può descrivere, va visto.

L'unico difetto che si può contare è quello tipico di questo tipo di giochi (i "walking simulator"), ovvero un gameplay quasi insesistente.
Dico quasi, perché sebbene Tacoma sia di fatto un film interattivo, lo spettatore ha l'onere di cercarsi da solo tutti i dettagli della storia, rovistando diligentemente nel ricco e particolareggiato micro-mondo.

Ci vuole un'appassionata dedizione quasi archeologica. O da portinaia curiosa... :)
Non è per tutti, però è molto appagante.

L'ultima nota è sulla mancanza di sottotitoli in italiano. [*NOTA update 31/12/2017
SIMOMEGA mi fa notare che sono stati aggiunti i sottotiloti in italiano.] Purtroppo è un trend sempre più diffuso tra i giochi indie (immagino che la colpa sia nostra, dovremmo comprare più titoli indipendenti), per cui è meglio mettersi l'animo in pace e migliorare il proprio inglese.
Testi e dialoghi però non sono difficili e, per come è fatto il gioco, non si corre mai rischio di perdere battute importanti.


Consigliato agli appassionati di SCI-FI o di walking simulator.

8/10
 
GingioPrappoVaAlPrapappo
784 produits enregistrés
4
8 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 aout 2017
An excellent story from the creators of Gone Home. It attempts and succeeds in innovating on the "walking simulator" genre in a way that introduces novel game mechanics and cuts through a lot of the sameness that has come from other studios in the wake of Gone Home.

What the game does right is in how it uses its primary story telling device, a game mechanics which allows you to play and reverse briefs snips of the lives of the crew of the abandoned space station, Tacoma. How amazing this mechanic was did not set in until I had encountered it once or twice and managed to see the full potential of it. Without spoiling too much, it allows you to be a fly on the wall of incredibly intement moments all happening simultaneously. The story plays out in multiple places at once and it manages to break away from a linear story, while still being contained to a straight path.

There were multiple times during the game where I found myself craving a full experience with combat and the story mechanic intermixed in. I think moving forward, story driven action games should take note on how to tell a narrative without the need for a simple cut scene. This game shows the potential for similar fly-on-the-wall mechanics.

The game does have some pit falls, one being the atmostphere itself was not quite as inviting as other walking simulators. Essepcially when compared to Gone Home, where you felt like you where snooping quietly through a house whose owners might return any minute, Tacoma feels a bit bland in comparison. A little bit of tension does build, but you never really feel in danger at point. A story unfolds before you, but you are never really sure what your stake in it is. I was certainly interested in what happened to the crew and that propelled me forward, but the atmosphere did little to establish my characters personal stake in the story.

There is one mechanic which I felt was under utilized, and that was your contacts with the outside world. Periodically you do receive Emails and messages from your company, but these are never straight forward and offer little more than reminder of your quest. I would read them expecting something to give me an insight into potential dangers or help create some personal stakes. But unfortunetly it never happens. You are a silent observer, and it feels like you have very little impact on the actual world for the most part.

I'll say again, the story itself is enough to make up for this. But I think it shows that setting is very important for these kind of games. Gone Home works because the personal stake is very easily understood. The kind of voyerism that it employs, going through people's cupboards and dressers, is something we are conditioned from birth to know is wrong. So it feels dangerous to do it even in a simulated enviornment. A game by a seperate company, Firewatch, has some similar beats to it. Walking through a forest park, finding people's personal belongings, conversing with a distant friend. The stakes are personal and more readily relatable. Tacoma doesn't manage to hit this stride, which is disapointing because it would have moved the game from really quite good to excellent.

Overall, I highly recommend the game. The story is fun and good sci-fi and the game mechanics are novel enough to elevate the story even further. The game may be a bit short for some, but for those who are fans of the Walking Simulator, it really sets the bar for inventing new ways to tell a story beyond the linear copy-cats which have flooded steam. It shows that there is a lot more to be expected and gained from this genre from truly creative designers.
 
Moose Hugger
0
6 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0

Recommandé
3.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 juin 2021
Tacoma is an interesting game. I recommend it, although I wish I could recommend it more highly because it's clear that the creators put a lot of heart into it, but there's unfortunately not a whole lot of content and the game kind of undermines itself IMO so you might want to wait for a sale unless you really feel like dropping $20.

Pros:
- the "investigate multiple branching narratives at once through augmented reality surveillance replay" mechanic is REALLY cool and well executed.
- each character is contextualized by nicely detailed personal belongings from poetry and magazines to snacks and toiletries which make the setting feel credibly lived-in in a way rare among scifi works.
- interesting near future scifi worldbuilding that feels decently believable.
- in another rare and welcome move for scifi games, some of the rooms are actually made of comfortable-looking materials like wood paneling instead of painted gunmetal and neon blue / orange or sterile Apple Store plastic.

♥♥♥♥:
- the actual story really under-utilizes its characters, IMO, and unfortunately they end up not feeling very remarkable or interesting in their own right despite being the focus of the whole thing. so the game's main attraction kind of trips over itself.
- despite the nice design choices in some rooms, overall environment design is not Tacoma's strong suit. the space station just does not look very good, even considering that it is a corporate hell-hole, and even by generic scifi design standards, and I would appreciate more lighting in a lot of places.

I think I got this game in a bundle with a vague notion of what it was but I never read the store page, so I came into Tacoma expecting it to be more about investigation and piecing together clues to solve a mystery, but I guess I was mistaken to expect that. Kind of a shame, honestly, because that could have been really cool. But that's not a point against Tacoma as is.

The game's core mechanic of tracking multiple intersecting and branching-off narratives by playing and rewinding 3D surveillance reconstructions of peoples' actions and dialogue is definitely its biggest strength, alongside the level of care put into detailing each crewmember's personal effects. I'd absolutely love to see more games take up the augmented-reality replay concept; like I said above, I think it would be fantastic for games about detective work. And the wide assortment of cute little personal possessions every crewmember has populating their living and working space helps the game world feel credibly lived-in in a way that most scifi videogames (or science fiction in general for that matter) rarely achieve, or honestly even try to. I honestly really appreciate that every character's quarters has a bathroom with hand soap and toiletries that each have cute little logos and container designs, or that you can find different brands of future nail polish laying around or a copy of a science fiction book written by someone in Tacoma's future world. Achieving this lived-in feeling with its characters is where I think Tacoma really shines as a story.

Which is a shame in a way because - and I am sad to say this because again, it's clear the authors put a lot of heart into them - I didn't end up feeling like any of the characters were especially remarkable. For all their effort, Tacoma is essentially a space disaster movie first and foremost. I never really felt like I got to spend enough time with the characters to really get to know them, and their personal struggles never really figure into the story in any important way - it all ends up being overshadowed by the immediacy of simple survival. In the end, I suppose I would say Tacoma's greatest strength as a narrative is its worldbuilding and character-building through atmosphere, but the actual story itself ends up missing that mark. It would be neat to see the devs perhaps revisit this setting and these characters someday with a story that revolves more fully around their own personal struggles and how those connect with the broader world, which itself feels (more or less) decently credible so far.
 
neo cumgush city 2069

3.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 juillet 2020
Absolutely stunning story accompanied by equally stunning storytelling. Fullbright does it again--a fully absorbing universe, both sweeping and personal, both distant and familiar. I was haunted by the possibility of a near-future that is bone-chillingly close-to-home without ever being hokey or flat. Couple this with a fantastic cast of true-to-life characters and you've got yourself a stupendous, emotional narrative experience. Much like Gone Home, Tacoma is more than worth your time and attention (and, tbh, probably several replays).

Non recommandé
2.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 aout 2018
このゲームはある宇宙ステーションでおきた事故の調査を行うゲームです。
調査官となったプレイヤーは、ステーションに乗り込み、ステーション内でおきた全てが記録されているARデータをを回収しつつ、そのステーションの管理AIのハードウェアを回収するというのが任務です。

クリアまでのプレイ時間は2～3時間でしょう。ゲーム性はゼロではありませんがとても少なく
「ステーション内を移動」→「再現されるARを見る」→「次のモジュールへ移動」
以上の繰り返しです。それもあまり数は多くありません。

ARシステムは非常にシンプルで分かりやすく、ステーションでのトラブルに対する臨場感があってとても良いです。
キャラクターも悪くない。誰かと話しているときは建前で、ひとりで自問自答してるときとは少し違うことを言っていたりするあたりは、ゲームとの一体感があっていい。どんどん次のモジュールへ行きたくなります。

ただインターフェイスやシステムはかなりいい感じなだけに、肝心のストーリーが大したことがないのが目立つ。

まずボリュームは短編映画レベルです。
なら密度やキレ味があるストーリーなのかなと思っていたら、特にそうでもない。
ストーリーも展開もオチも何もかもが想像以下です。

ですので、SF物なのにプレイし終わったあと何にも思いを馳せることができません（笑）
ワクワクしないSF物になんの価値があるのでしょうか？

クソゲーではありません。惹かれる部分はあります。

でもこの中身で¥1980という値段設定があまりに高い。
”宇宙ステーション内という舞台”　で　”ARシステムを疑似体験できる”　
というだけで楽しめるという人以外は満足はできないと思います。
 
K2

Recommandé
2.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 aout 2017
Pretty great sci-fi story with some wonderful voice acting. It's fun to scrub through all the different scenarios and follow different conversations. Everything feels very real and grounded, the environmental storytelling is great (the crossword puzzle is a highlight), Christmas Duck returns, there's a cat, and you can throw things.

My only complaint is that it's a bit linear, but it definitely gives you more freedom than most FPS games, at least, so it's not like you're just entirely on rails.

I also wish the game were 50 hours long, the AI had turned everyone into zombies who are trying to murder you, and you got skill points you could use to upgrade your melee strength, but I can see the reasons they didn't go in that direction and I suppose they make a twisted sort of sense. Their next game had better have zombies though.

Non recommandé
3.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 aout 2017
Hard to review this with only a binary Yes or No option.

At current prices shortly after launch I say No. When it drops to £7 GBP then I'd say Yes.

Game took me 3.5 hours to complete as I looked at and read a lot of stuff. That is a lot longer than it took me to do Gone Home so a better value proposition - not that I really judge value by time v money but I know some do. I'm more interested in money v enjoyment.

The first 95% of the game is absolutely excellent. At the point where you reach a certain forbidden room, I was thinking "game of the year". Unfortunately the last 15 minutes absolutely destroyed it. One of the worst endings to a game I've seen. Deus ex machina of the very worst kind. I'd imagine it would seem very bizarre and sudden for someone who didn't painstakingly read and look at everything, even worse than it was for me.

I thought Gone Home was incredible and Tacoma tries the same trick of subverting your expectations. We've all seen certain movies so we all start making assumptions. The problem is that their subversion is really skeletal. It needed to be fleshed out with an another hours worth of content to try and make us care.

At the end of Gone Home you really care about the younger sister. At the end of Tacoma you really couldn't care less about the equivalent of the sister.

It's a real pity as the writing (as with Gone Home) is truly excellent in places.

I think unlike Gone Home the developers' politics become too intrusive at points and break immersion. I mean I never felt that the crew were organically selected by a mega corporation in 2080. I actually felt they were selected by a bunch of Identity Politics ideologues in Portland circa the mid 2010's. Fortunately each character was well written and this didn't have a major impact on my enjoyment. It just crossed the line into being statistically highly unlikely on occasion.

Also having the player-character being in on something that the player is not just does not work. They should have found another way of doing that. That made the ending even worse.
 
Toypop
199 produits enregistrés
0
6 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 mars 2018
"Tacoma" es el segundo juego publicado por Fullbright en Steam tras "Gone Home", y si conoces este último sabrás que esperar de este título. Y es que, aunque ambos juegos no tienen nada que ver en cuanto a ambientación o argumento, la premisa jugable viene a ser la misma.

En el juego manejaremos a Amy, una suerte de autónoma que, en el futuro, ha sido contratada para viajar a la estación espacial "Tacoma", vacía y en desuso desde hace unos días, para recabar información de todo lo que pasó allí. Para ello se nos irá dando acceso a las distintas zonas de la estación espacial, y contaremos ♥♥♥ un dispositivo que deberemos conectar en los terminales de cada zona para extraer la información necesaria antes de pasar a la siguiente.
Pero la cosa no acaba ahí, obviamente. Mientras la información es extraída lentamente, nosotros podemos dedicarnos a explorar por esa zona de la estación espacial, fisgando todo lo que queramos y examinando cada recoveco a nuestro antojo. Así, podremos registrar todas las dependencias de cada miembro de la tripulación, así como las zonas comunes o las oficinas personales, abriendo armarios, leyendo cartas, sacando notas de las papeleras, leyendo sus terminales informáticos en sus despachos... Todo lo que veamos está a nuestra disposición para leerlo... si queremos. A veces necesitaremos encontrar la llave o el código adecuado para abrir alguna puerta, taquilla o derivado, eso sí.
Y hay más, porque a ello hay que unirle que la estación espacial ha grabado los movimientos y sonidos de todos los tripulantes de la estación, y nosotros también podremos presenciarlos. Así, como en una especie de vista de Realidad Aumentada, las figuras de los seis tripulantes de la estación (a los que terminaremos conociendo muy bien) aparecerán ante nosotros moviéndose y hablando como lo habían hecho en cada momento de la grabación, y podremos incluso seguirles por la zona mientras aprendemos más acerca de lo que les pasó. Incluso podremos, en determinados momentos, examinar sus dispositivos personales y ver qué conversaciones tenían o qué correos electrónicos recibían o enviaban mientras avanzamos o retrocedemos por las grabaciones.

De este modo iremos descubriendo mucho más sobre qué pasó en la estación Tacoma, pero no solo eso, si no que también iremos, inevitablemente, conociendo a sus tripulantes y encariñándonos (o no) de ellos. Conoceremos sus historias personales, ♥♥♥ quién hablaban desde la estación, qué miedos o inseguridades tenían o qué ocultaban al resto de la tripulación.
Y obviamente esto forma una parte muy importante del juego. Podemos limitarnos a obtener la información por la que nos pagan: Qué pasó en la estación para llegar a la situación actual. Y largarnos de allí una vez la tengamos. Pero será imposible no querer profundizar, no engancharnos a qué pasó "más allá", qué sintió esa gente, cómo llevaron esos últimos días en la estación, y sobre todo qué fue de ellos. Y ese es el encanto del juego.

La estación espacial está perfectamente recreada, y cualquier amante de la ciencia ficción apreciará el esfuerzo ♥♥♥ el que se han representado todas las instalaciones. Aunque gráficamente sea más bien sencillo cumple de sobra, y todo contribuye a crear una ambientación perfecta.

Como único punto negativo del juego, diría que la traducción deja que desear en algunos momentos puntuales. No es nada excesivamente grave ni nos va a impedir en ningún momento disfrutar del juego, pero el hecho de ver constantemente la palabra "playing" traducida como "jugando" en lugar de "reproduciendo" cada vez que reproducimos una grabación hace pensar que quién tradujera el juego no lo hizo ♥♥♥ el mismo delante, y esas cosas son importantes.

Sin más, os recomiendo Tacoma fuertemente. Un claro ejemplo de cómo dejar una historia reposando en gravedad cero para que nosotros la descubramos a nuestro ritmo.
 
psenci
1,202 produits enregistrés
0

3.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 aout 2017
步行模拟忠实玩家要给一个大大的好评！3DM汉化现在可用快买！

玩过Fullbright的前作《Gone home》，感觉不如同类游戏中的《万众狂欢》、《艾迪芬奇的记忆》、《伊森卡特的消失》等等，所以对《Tacoma》并没有抱太大期待，结果着实给了我一个惊喜！

完全不输给上述作品且超越有之：剧情充实饱满，有两层反转 飞船事故的真相和主角的身份；人物细节丰富且相互交融，而且通过AR系统就可以轻易挖掘，不用担心遗漏线索；科技感的场景画面和UI也是加分项，另外就是超喜欢主角激活AR系统的手势哈哈哈，喜欢这类型游戏的小伙伴别犹豫了。

有没有谁通关了我想说 好喜欢Natali给Robert拥抱时候隔壁房间都能听到的响声啊！然后想问Amy在同步时候上面显示的H是谁？

Recommandé
3.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 mai 2018
Wer eine tolle Gameplayerfahrung sucht, der sollte Tacoma auslassen, denn reon vom Gameplay gibt es hier nicht allzu viel zu erleben. Das Spielt lebt von der tollen Geschichte (was genau ist da geschehen) und dem schrittweisen Entdecken der Crewmember und ihrer Hintergründe. Diese Teile sind aber hervorragend gestaltet und wer Freude daran hat, wird mit Tacoma einen tollen und unterhaltsamen Abend verbringen. Viel mehr Spielzeit gibt es nicht, aber wen das nicht stört, erhält mit Tacoma eine tolle und stimmungsvolle Science Fiction Geschichte mit einem spannenden Schuss Ethik/Philosophie.
Fazit: Wer kurze Spiele und Geschichten mag, dem ist Tacoma zu empfehlen und der wird kaum merken, dass das Gameplay sehr rudimentär bleibt, weil die Atmosphäre vieles wett macht.
 
Gibor
1,540 produits enregistrés
0
11 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 aout 2017
An interesting, dialogue-driven story game where you seek to discover what happened to the crew aboard an empty space station before you arrived. The developer has taken an extensive amount of time to make sure the world is believable and interesting to explore. Almost every item in the game can be picked up and examined in great detail. From the fine print on bamboo pens, to the slam dunk near the opening sequence, items often have meaning and it is up to the player to "stop and smell the roses." I found the qr codes to be creative initially, but quickly realized the developer did not take the time to make the scannable content meaningful in any way whatsoever, which is disappointing.

I personally love the art direction of the game and find details such as the object animations to be delightful and entertaining.

The game is definitely not for everyone, but it provides a nice, dialogue rich story to explore at your own pace. That is, unless your paste is extremely fast, in which case you will miss all of the roses.
 
JayKlo
183 produits enregistrés
0
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
3.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 octobre 2017
Tacoma ist ein storyorientiertes Spiel, bei dem die Anzahl von verschiedenen interaktiven Handlungen sehr begrenzt ist. Man erforscht im Laufe der Handlung die Station und kann sich dabei Pseudo-Videoaufzeichnungen der Besatzung ansehen, die Aufschluss über die Geschehnisse der letzten Tage gibt. Das ist zwar sehr spannend, aber es ist leider auch die einzige Möglichkeit im Spiel. Nach drei Stunden hatte ich das Spiel durch. Man kann hier sicherlich noch etwas mehr Spielzeit herausholen.
Insgesamt bin ich etwas enttäuscht, es ist gut gemacht aber einfach zu kurz und zu eingeschränkt. Daher keine Empfehlung.

Короткий симулятор ходьбы о маленьких людях и большой корпорации. По началу кажется довольно скучным, но начиная изучать окружение - втягиваешься. Разработчики действительно обратили внимание на мелочи и это приятно.
Особый интерес игре добавляют достижения - опять-таки не сложные, но они добавляют мотивации к изучению.
В целом игра мне понравилась.

Recommandé
2.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 aout 2022
Reviewed according to the Three Axes of Space Station Games:

AUDIOLOGGERY: 10/10. This is the dream: a game about nothing but logs. Text logs, holographic logs, you got everything in here.
MALFUNCTIONINGNESS: 5/10. Some audio logs are corrupted but barely anything is broken. You barely need to crawl through vents.
OXYGENATION: 3/10. Oxygen running out is mentioned in the plot but you, yourself, never run out of oxygen. 3 points for having an area without gravity, that's important too.

Overall, good at logging but could have less oxygen. 7/10.
 
zarat.us
1,729 produits enregistrés
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
9.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 octobre 2019
Tacoma est un jeu narratif dans le lequel vous êtes une contractante envoyée pour récupérer les données RA qui restent (enregistrements audio en réalités augmentés qui parcourent la station) et son IA nommé "ODIN".

L'histoire est très bien construite et fait froid dans le dos si on s'imagine un instant à la place de l'équipage...
Notre attachement aux personnages au travers des petits moments de vie à découvrir (pendant leur travail ou hors) se fait sans problème et connaitre ce qui est arrivé à ceux ci a été, personnellement, ma tache première.

Il n'y a pas de puzzle, ni énigme dans Tacoma car là n'est pas le coeur du jeu. Vous travaillez pour une multinationale qui a des très, très gros intérêts dans la colonisation de l'espace et certainement pas mal de "cadavres dans le placart", votre travail c'est d'aller chercher pour elle les réponses qu'elle veut... ni plus, ni moins au départ.

Côté graphismes, le moteur Unity fait très bien son travail, les lumières, les ombres mais aussi la composition de la station en elle même par les développeurs, les textures, le détail accordé aux objets, les pièces de vie et de travail sont tellement "réelles" qu'il pourrait tout à fait possible d'y vivre...
C'est un tout qui concourt à cette ambiance.

Il faut ajouter que le doublage est très bon en anglais (sous titré VF si l'on veut) et rajoute un gros plus à l'ambiance et la narration.

Parmi les petits moins, je pourrait dire la durée de l'histoire (mais c'est surtout parce que je m'était attaché aux différents personnages) et peut être un manque de petits éléments supplémentaires sur la vie de chacun en dehors de la narration principale mais là aussi c'est du chipotage.

Tacoma est une très bonne histoire narrative encadré par un décor vraiment plaisant et une IA "ODIN" qui surveille et régit la station à l'image de HAL dans "2001 l'odyssée de l'espace".

Tacoma est un coup de coeur pour ma part et recommandé sans problème.
 
bp01
3,528 produits enregistrés
0
9 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 aout 2017
I was looking forward to Tacoma, so it’s with some puzzled disappointment that I have to report it was really quite underwhelming. Fans of the genre will find nothing original here, and in a year’s time there will be little reason for anyone to remember this game. This isn’t to say it’s bad, as such, indeed the dialogue is well-written and well-acted, but walking simulators have progressed, and apparently Fullbright haven't.

Something that really brings out this problem is the setting. You arrive, after a regrettably brief docking / intro sequence, and are tasked with travelling to a small number of areas aboard a space station in gated, linear order (though you can revisit past places at your leisure). There has been some kind of problem aboard the station, onaboutwhich you are to collect data. On your way you see recorded conversations, read notes, and unlock doors. It should be apparent to most readers that this general premise is extremely well-worn, and sadly there are no new ideas in the story that unfolds before you.

While Event[0] didn’t work as smoothly overall, it went down a more original / creative path... and they got there first. To my mind, it would be an injustice if Tacoma enjoyed more popularity than Event[0] primarily because of its creators’ association with past titles.

Tacoma is worth playing, but barely at half-price when there are so many more ambitious walking simulators out there. This game is more for sci-fi obsessives who need that link to get into walking simulators, or walking simulator obsessives who just want a story and don’t care too much how different or original what they’re playing is.

Full review at https://memorat.blogspot.ie/2017/08/tacoma.html
Tweets at https://twitter.com/memorating
 
Aristotlol

Évaluation publiée le 14 mars 2020
Gone Home in space is the shortest and still most fitting description I can give about this. Both in the good and bad ways. There's a lot of story about the characters you're learning about while never meeting them, very little interaction and a playtime of barely two hours, tops.

All the same this was quite fun and I really liked the ending.

The only thing I cannot recommend is getting this at retail value. Wait for at least 50% off.

Recommandé
4.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 janvier 2018
クリアVer.はインゲーム表示がないため不明。色んなものをじっくり眺めながら進めたため、初回クリアに4時間要しました。最終セーブから再開し、全実績解除に至ったため起稿。

Pros:
  • 色とシンボルによる視覚的なキャラクター把握の簡易化
  • 多層展開されるストーリーテリングと自発的な探索による動線
  • 自身のペースで咀嚼できるストーリーテンポ
  • ARホログラムによるローカライズ表示
  • 情景を鮮やかに想起させる声優の演技

♥♥♥♥:
  • 区間移動で発生する長いローディング
  • リプレイ性はそれ程高くない

過去の追体験と多面的な視点が紡ぎ出す極上のストーリーテリング

　「Tacoma」は月と地球の中継地点として設営された宇宙ステーションTacomaを舞台とした3Dアドベンチャーゲーム。あなたは作業員エイミーとなって、Tacomaを有するヴェンチュリス社より無人と化した宇宙ステーションに残されたデータとAIハードウェアの回収を命じられる。消えたクルーの行方やTacomaで何が起きたのか、作業を通じて知っていくこととなります。

　本作の特徴はTacomaに搭載された先端監視システムとそのデータにあります。宇宙ステーションの中で起きた出来事は立体映像表示されるアーカイブとして記録されており、ARデバイスを装着することでこれらの記録をARホログラムとして自由に再生、一時停止、巻き戻し、早送りすることができます。クルーそれぞれの位置情報から映像が再生されるため、ひとつの記録を色々な場所で見て情報を得ていく必要があります。また記録の中で行われた通信内容にアクセスすることもでき、それらの記録情報が元でエイミーのいる時間軸での話が進展することもあります。過去の追体験とアーカイブ上の記録、そして現在、と多層展開するストーリーのつくりには否が応でも惹き込まれるものがありました。ARホログラムが適用される範囲もそれと分かる境界をARで目視できるため、探索する範囲を見失わずに済んだのも好印象でした。

このビリヤードの挙動素晴らしい 
Une capture d'écran de Tacoma
Par : Haco Slacker


　さらにこのARで特筆すべき点はローカライズ表示をAR上のデータとして取り込んだことです。原文の英語データの上に日本語の翻訳テキストがオーバーレイされて見ることができます。これは本作の仕様を踏まえた世界観ともうまくマッチしており、世界そのものの存在感の肯定を強く後押ししているように思いました。ゲーム中では勿論予め翻訳されたデータを表示しているに過ぎませんが、実際にGoogle翻訳アプリに見られるようなカメラを通じた翻訳変換をより高精度で安定させたものと考えると、生きているうちに実現しそうなところに妙なリアリティを感じるのです。

ARのゲーム仕様(特徴)をローカライズテキストに適用するアイディアは凄い 
Une capture d'écran de Tacoma
Par : Haco Slacker


　宇宙ステーションと聞くと、どんなことを想像するでしょうか。真空によって外界から熱も音も途絶された閉鎖空間で、冷たく静かな印象を私は抱きます。しかもTacomaには人の姿が見当たらず、不測の事態が起きたことを推測させる。であるにもかかわらず不思議と不気味に感じなかったのは、先述の映像アーカイブが点在する密度と、クルーたちの人間味によるところだと思います。無人となった事態に対する関心よりも、事態を通じたクルーたちの心の動きや衝突など人間ドラマに対する動向への関心がより引かれたため、サスペンスを演出する間としての不気味さは薄らいでいたように思います。無論人間ドラマに注視させたクルーたちの個性を確立しているのは、演者の力量によるものであることは疑いようがありません。

　残念と思われるであろう点も記述しておきます。クルーたちの家族設定などは細かく用意されていますが、一部において心情の推移を推察する背景にはなりつつも直接的な描写がなく活かされていないと感じられる設定もあるため、人によっては掘り下げが足りていないと感じるでしょう。またゲームのボリューム自体も数時間程度で終わるため、ボリューム不足と感じるかもしれません。区間移動で発生するローディングは、行き帰りで読み込むARホログラム用のデータ量が異なるため、行きはやたらと長いのに帰りは短く、同じ通路を通っているのに長さが違っていたりするのがおかしいなんて指摘もできるかと思います。


　Tacomaで描かれる物語は胸糞悪い展開がありつつも、気持ちよいフィナーレを迎えられるのでプレイ後のフィーリングは悪くありません。ストーリーは最初複雑に絡み合っているように見えますが、動線がしっかりとしているのでそれほど難解でもありません。本作をプレイし終えて、「いつかはきっと」、そう夢見ずにはいられません。そう思えただけで、私にとって手に取る価値はあったのだと思います。
 
Haco Slacker
2,425 produits enregistrés
0
11 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
2.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 mars 2021
Information / English

Tacoma is an Adventure, Puzzle game developed by Fullbright.

Gameplay / Story

Tacoma is reminiscent of the port city in the US state of Washington, this is one of the largest transshipment points for container ships in the Pacific region and was once designated as the end point of the Northern Pacific Railroad: "Where rails meet sails". Business is still booming, but automated container ships and terminals are acutely endangering many jobs for people. The Lunar Transfer Station Tacoma from the computer game Tacoma of the same name is only equipped with human personnel in 2088 because the responsible unions have successfully opposed complete automation through artificial intelligence (AI). So until further notice, six crew members are monitoring an AI called ODIN, which in turn monitors the transfer traffic to the moon.

As with Gone Home, the players find the location of the action deserted. In the role of mine worker Amy Ferrier, you are supposed to ensure the station AI and all the data collected for the Venturis corporation. Vague indications of what led to the alleged escape of the team can only be reconstructed from various text and image documents. Or directly from the room and its signs of life. In order for the red thread of the action to be found in the room, it must, however, formally impose itself. Even in spiritual pioneers such as System Shock or BioShock, people in acute threats unrealistically still find the time to record tapes or to write on walls with their own blood.

As the cultural scientist Henry Jenkins describes it, Tacoma is narrative architecture. The computer game has a clear advantage over literature and film here. Rooms no longer have to be described or filmed in detail, but are available for free navigation. "Well, what may have happened in me?", According to Walter Benjamin, the room winks at the flaneur. Every crushed beer can and every fleeting note could solve the riddle.

Pro

+ successful, chic science fiction backdrop
+ compelling story
+ Well-written and staged interplay of different numbers of crew members
+ great music
+ well thought-out controls
+ many setting options
+ Achievements and trading cards

Contra

- puzzles too easy
- Details of the plot are more in the background

Conclusion

Tacoma offers you an impressive spaceship that invites you to explore. Unfortunately, the game lacks a bit of playful depth. Still, it turned out to be a solid adventure.

PS: First of all, many thanks to the developer who made this key available to us for the group. Here you can find more good reviews from others and me at https://store.steampowered.com/curator/26335619-Adult-World-Gamer/.


Information / Deutsch

Tacoma ist ein Abenteuer,Puzzle - Spiel, welches von Fullbright entwickelt wurde.

Gameplay / Geschichte

Tacoma erinnert an die Hafenstadt im US-Bundesstaat Washington, diese ist eine der größten Umschlagplätze für Containerschiffe im pazifischen Raum und wurde einst zum Endpunkt der Northern Pacific Railroad bestimmt: "Where rails meet sails". Noch brummt das Geschäft, aber durch automatisierte Containerschiffe und Terminals sind viele Arbeitsplätze für Menschen akut gefährdet. Die Lunar Transfer Station Tacoma aus dem gleichnamigen Computerspiel Tacoma ist im Jahr 2088 überhaupt nur noch mit menschlichem Personal bestückt, weil die zuständigen Gewerkschaften sich einer völligen Automatisierung durch künstliche Intelligenz (KI) erfolgreich widersetzt haben. So überwachen also bis auf Weiteres sechs Besatzungsmitglieder eine KI namens ODIN, die wiederum den Transferverkehr zum Mond überwacht.

Wie schon bei Gone Home finden die Spieler den Ort der Handlung menschenleer vor. In der Rolle der Bergungsarbeiterin Amy Ferrier sollen sie die Stations-KI samt aller gesammelten Daten für den Großkonzern Venturis sicherstellen. Vage Hinweise darauf, was zur mutmaßlichen Flucht der Mannschaft geführt hat, lassen sich lediglich aus diversen Text- und Bilddokumenten rekonstruieren. Oder direkt aus dem Raum und seinen Lebenszeichen. Damit der rote Faden der Handlung im Raum auch wirklich gefunden wird, muss er sich allerdings förmlich aufdrängen. Schon in spirituellen Vorreitern wie System Shock oder BioShock finden Menschen in akuten Bedrohungslagen unrealistischerweise noch die Zeit, Tonbänder aufzunehmen oder Wände mit Eigenblut zu beschriften.

Tacoma ist, wie der Kulturwissenschaftler Henry Jenkins es beschreibt, narrative Architektur. Das Computerspiel ist hier der Literatur und dem Film gegenüber klar im Vorteil. Räume müssen nicht mehr in allen Details beschrieben oder gefilmt werden, sondern stehen zur freien Navigation zur Verfügung. "Nun, was mag sich in mir wohl zugetragen haben?", blinzelt laut Walter Benjamin der Raum den Flaneur an. Jede zerdrückte Bierdose und jede flüchtige Notiz könnte das Rätsel auflösen.

Pro

+ gelungene, schicke Science-Fiction-Kulisse
+ überzeugende Geschichte
+ gut geschriebenes und inszeniertes Zusammenspiel unterschiedlich vieler Besatzungsmitglieder
+ tolle Musik
+ durchdachte Steuerung
+ viele Einstellungsmöglichkeiten
+ Errungenschaften und Sammelkarten

Kontra

- Rätsel zu einfach
- Einzelheiten der Handlung laufen mehr im Hintergrund

Fazit

Tacoma bietet dir ein eindrucksvolles Raumschiff, welches zum erkunden einlädt. Leider fehlt es dem Spiel etwas an spielerischer Tiefe. Trotzdem ist es ein solides Abenteuer geworden.

PS: Zunächst einmal vielen Dank an den Entwickler, der uns diesen Schlüssel für die Gruppe zur Verfügung gestellt hat. Hier findest du weitere gute Bewertungen von anderen und mir unter https://store.steampowered.com/curator/26335619-Adult-World-Gamer/.
 
Knuffybaer[GER]
0
49 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante

Non recommandé
3.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 octobre 2017
Пропаганда толерантности, в которой нет места белому гетеросексуальному мужчине. Мы играем за латинку и попадаем на корабль, где были геи, лесби, негры, индусы, азиаты и бодипозитивщицы. Если персонаж белый, то он не гетеро. Что касается сюжета, то всю игру мы как бы смотрим историю экипажа, а потом оказывается, что это было не важно, ведь сюжет совсем о другом. Берут все 2-3 часа геймплея и сливают в урну. Персонажи не имеют развития, а их ориентация или расовый признак в основном и являются их описанием.

Хорошая игра для поддержки SJW, но не очень для тех, кто ждал чего-то за гранью визуальной части.
 
brotherjgrji
124 produits enregistrés

6 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
11.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 juin 2019
1本道なアドベンチャーストーリーゲーム。
個人的には大変、世界観や設定、ストーリーが好みではあった。
ただストーリー・ボリュームが少ないので、
定価で買うのに見合うかは、非常に微妙…というか、
セール購入じゃないと薦めにくい気がする。
(『Gone Home』を作ったスタジオなので、
それをやっていればボリュームの想像はしやすいかと。)

宇宙ステーションTACOMAでの出来事を
ステーションのAI「ODIN」のハードウェア回収をしつつ
消えたクルー達の立体・会話ログを見つつ、何が起きたのか発見していく。

ステーション内での行動自体は比較的、自由だけれど
ストーリー面からすると行く必要がある場所はある程度
決められていて、スムーズにいくと、少し物足りなく感じるボリューム。
話自体はよくまとまってはいる。が、大きいストーリーの1部分というか、
短編小説を読んだような印象だった。
「クルー達がいた」生活感がある部屋、各クルーの専門分野、出身地等
設定が作りこんであるのが、個人的にはかなりツボ。
この世界観で、他のストーリーも読んでみたい、と思った。

自分は、初見は攻略等を見ずにプレイした為、
行く場所で多少まごついたのと、実績の取り逃しで2週目をやったので
プレイ11時間になったが、ストーリー回収のプレイ時間自体は短い。
1周で全部やれるなら半分以下でクリアできるかもしれない。
細かい設定が作りこんである割には、ストーリーそのものが短いのが唯一の難かな。

若干、操作にもっさり感はあったが、支障があるほどではない。
クルー失踪に対する謎解きが無ければ、ほぼ宇宙ステーション・ウォーキングシミュレーター。

雰囲気を楽しんだり、ストーリーを読むことをメインに楽しめる人にはオススメ。
逆にゲームの世界観をただ見ることや短いストーリーを物足りないと思う人には向かない。
 
Range
0

하지만 게임의 볼륨감에 비해 이야기가 너무 가볍습니다

최고사양의 컴퓨터로 지뢰찾기나 하는 느낌

플레이 타임이 매우 짧아 도전과제까지 꼼꼼하게 한다고 해도 두세시간이면 충분한 수준입니다



결론은 퍼즐요소도 없고 액션도 없으며

한편의 영화나 소설을 본 것 같은 느낌을 주기도전에 끝나버리는 게임입니다

Aly

Recommandé
3.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 janvier 2018
坦白講，這遊戲一點遊戲性也沒有
基本上就是在看故事，就只是在看一個遊戲電影罷了
非常小品的故事
最後故事的轉折確實讓我有點驚豔，但就這樣了
一定要我評分，它就是一款只值120台幣的遊戲
畫面確實還不錯，但缺少了刺激
但最後的結局確實還讓人覺得可接受

這邊說一下在玩什麼吧
就是這個月球轉運站發生了一些事故
而主角AMY就是被這轉運站的公司派來調察的
主要工作就是記錄原本存在該轉運站內的主要錄影檔
將其轉錄下來之後帶回去給公司
所以沒有什麼意外跟刺激，主角已經是一個第三者的角度在看著這原本在轉運站工作的六個人發生的事情
整體劇情著實有點無聊，但還算有趣
如果撐不住有點沉悶的前期劇情，或這類頗為平鋪式小說類劇情就不推薦這款遊戲。
 
雲天翔
286 produits enregistrés
2
23 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
2.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 novembre 2018
To be perfectly clear, this is a very polished game indeed, with a well-composed story told in an ingenious manner. They did a brilliant job in building this unsettling environment of a malfunctioning space station and a desperate crew. Sounds and graphics are great as well, and overall gameplay is smooth and intuitive. So why on earth am I not recommending this? It's the price, guys. I know it might sound such a rubbish of a reason, but the full price is 20 bucks, for a game that lasts two hours (and just like all other story-driven walking simulators they have little to zero replay value). That's very steep in my opinion. So, in the end, it is good game, but I wouldn't recommend picking it at full price.

Évaluation publiée le 29 décembre 2018
From the very start this game's story is so engaging and feels so real. The dialogue will bond you to everyone on board very quickly, I highly recommend sitting down and playing this through as even completion doesn't take half a day.

To the creators I say thank you so much for this game, this story is a diamond amongst a field of quartz, you can feel the passion put into this game and even when you begin to second guess the story and try to predict it changes your perspective. I cannot thank the developer's enough for giving me so much more than I was expecting.

10/10 definitely a game I would recommend to anyone, especially if you need a distraction from your own life.
 
Shackelbot
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 novembre 2018
Tacoma is a narrative experience in which you are to explore a recently abandoned space station to elucidate what really happened. Your augmented reality device allows you to watch and listen to the crew past interactions with each other as well as their alone time, which solidifies each character's uniquely diverse personalities. Yet, although exploration may help the player paint a clearer picture of the situation, it really does not feel gratifying unlike in other walking simulators, as the story does all the work. Work that, despite being successfully touching, I was unable to connect to 100% - mainly due to the abruptness at which crucial information is revealed. Tacoma left a bittersweet taste in my mouth, but regardless of its odd pacing, it remains a great example of interactive storytelling.
 
MissPotatino
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
8.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 février 2018
Produit reçu gratuitement

Em "Tacoma", você é Amy, a encarregada de descobrir o que aconteceu com a nave e a tripulação da Estação Espacial Tacoma. Você está a serviço da empresa responsável pela estação e tem como objetivo a recuperação dos dados dos tripulantes e de ODIN, a AI da nave.

Esse é um jogo com poucos comandos, tornando a mecânica fácil e dispensando tutoriais ou teclas de atalho. Ele mistura exploração com point and click pois você precisa caminhar pelos compartimentos da nave através de pistas, de chaves e códigos para abrir portas e da história dos tripulantes enquanto interage com os objetos de cada ambiente.

Pontos positivos:
-Trilha sonora
-Gráficos
-História rica, bem escrita e amarrada
-Personagens contagiantes
-Mecânica fácil
-Jogo leve
-Personagens LGBTs

Pontos negativos/O que pode melhorar:
-História muito curta
-A jogabilidade poderia ser ampliada para dar mais liberdade ao player
-A fotografia poderia receber mais atenção dos DEs durante o curso da história

Eu queria esse jogo há algum tempo e, por sorte, o ganhei em um sorteio no SG. Baixei assim que possível e terminei o jogo em uma sentada. "Tacoma" é viciante e envolvente. Te faz perder a noção do tempo e te deixa angustiada com cada descoberta e uma trilha sonora de te fazer borrar as calças.

Não sei quanto as outras pessoas, mas eu, definitivamente, irei jogá-lo de novo. Com calma. Para apreciar melhor a história e encontrar detalhes que por acaso passaram despercebidos na primeira vez.

É um jogo caro, que vale a pena ser adquirido com 75% de desconto pela história ser muito curta. Mas eu pagaria 50% por esta obra prima, sem arrependimento algum.

9/10
 
Brune
1,838 produits enregistrés
0
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 février 2019
Tacoma（塔科马）,一款以太空近未来为背景的、中规中矩的步行模拟器

在正式评测这个游戏之前我有段嗑要唠。
对我而言，「步行模拟器」这一游戏类型一直是很微妙的存在，是那种你说它自由有趣我也认同，你说它无聊透顶我也不反对的type。就很微妙，仿佛步行模拟器游戏对我而言是那种可堪一玩但是玩不玩的下去看心情的杀时间用品。多数是在看商店简介的时候引起兴趣，在弄透玩法后，“下次再玩”然后就没有下次了的情况。究其根本原因，可能是因为步行模拟器以步行探索为主，没有明显主线及线索，故而会让玩家显得漫无目的，一旦暂停后重开就会感到迷茫，属于要一口气通关的类型。

就这点而言，Tacoma做得不错。全成就三小时的流程偏短但也还合适，因为整体场景框在一个太空空间站，用于赶路的时间不多，所以这三小时里大部分时间是有效的、不会觉得无趣的。
但你要说这个游戏很有意思，那也不是。之所以说Tacoma是一款中规中矩的步行模拟器，原因就是如此：它就是全然一副步行模拟器的样貌。你走路去一个场所，收集一些文件物品，了解一些事件，然后开始自个儿脑补时间线和剧情。
它有一些亮点，例如AR技术，例如失重。
前者可以算是步行模拟器游戏里的一个创新了，我们作为旁观者再也不需要仅对着一堆文字物件脑补剧情发展，而是可以看到故事当时的情景再现，但是全境封锁玩家笑而不语——这个AR（虽然其他游戏里叫法不一样啦）的设计在整个游戏圈里可不算是一个新事件了。至于失重，刚开始还觉得好玩儿，到后面只会觉得好麻烦= =
它贯彻了步行模拟器“一个中心疑问”的思想，但又特意安排了一大一小两次反转。
（“一个中心疑问”即步行模拟器因为没有主线所以需要一个核心事件推动玩家探索，想要知道这件事的发展和最后结果的想法就成为了玩家通关的动力。例如在看火人中这个“中心”就是主角和妻子到底和好了木有。在Tacoma中则是太空站成员是否存活）然而大反转意料之中，小反转聊胜于无，整体剧情说无聊太过，说有趣也就一般般。平淡。
它忠实执行了步行模拟器的“多支线”。
步行模拟器的“多支线”不是真的指支线任务，而是指在主要剧情之中穿插一些次要人物的故事，在对主剧情有一定补充作用的同时，会给玩家一种“哦原来如此，这个游戏剧情还挺丰富”的感觉。例如Tacoma中（以下剧透） 网络和机械是结婚了的蕾丝伴侣，工程和主管搞上了，医疗之前经历过工作事故，生物有个叛逆但是又担心父亲的儿子（原谅我记不住名字）总而言之，每个人都有个故事会给玩家这个游戏很不错的感觉，但是实际上还是不能掩盖Tacoma故事偏向平淡的事实。

总体而言，Tacoma作为步行模拟器，已经是一款完成度很高的佳作了。但对我而言，由于我对步行模拟器的微妙态度，我认为Tacoma是一款非常普通的作品。它完完全全被局限于「步行模拟器」这一框架内，没有能让人眼前一亮的设定、玩法或者剧情。尤其是在我玩过伊迪芬奇的秘密之后，Tacoma就完全沦为了背景板。

当然，对于没有购买Tacoma玩家，我选择推荐这款游戏。说到底Tacoma还是挺不错的，打折34入合情合理，带来的3小时游戏体验也挺不错。就是希望制作组可以在下一作上有所突破。

7/10
 
BioneyoriiL咸鱼中
727 produits enregistrés
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
9.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 juillet 2022
This is a short exploration game with some minor puzzle elements. I completed it in 6 hours, but it would probably take most people 2-4 hours.

You are exploring an abandoned station after a disaster. You can watch recordings of the crew at various places in the station, and look through their stuff to learn more about what happened.
It's an entertaining, short indie title.

You cannot pet the cat. Her name is Margaret Catwood. There is an achievement for finding her.

For achievement hunters, it's easy to get 100%. If you miss any, you can "continue" your game from just before the ending, you can go back and pick up any you missed.

tombalex
3
41 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
1
Non recommandé
3.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 mars 2020
Tacoma is basically a slow burning allegory against patriarchy and corporate hegemony that envisions a future where gender and racial politics have been, de-facto, resolved. I get where it’s coming from: it’s important to question the norms/current state of society and to see representation of LGBTQ2 and racial diversity in entertainment (imagine being a kid and wondering why none of your favourite characters look or think the way you do)...

...but it doesn’t make it a captivating game.

It’s compelling in so far as you’re a person who enjoys studying people. You run around a fairly basic set of levels reading the personal messages (and listening to the personal conversations) of the people who were previously aboard the derelict Lunar Transfer Station Tacoma. There is some infrequent and slight memorization required, but that is literally the game. There are no dialogue options or choices.

The thrill of eavesdropping is really the only motivating feature of Tacoma. There’s a narrative thread about the future of AI, how it would impact the working-class and lower-middle management, what civil liberties should be extended to semi-sentient computers… but honestly, those ideas are better explored through other, more comprehensive/heady mediums.

Pros

+ Dive into the (utterly mundane) lives of people you’ve never met
+ Voice acting is well done

Neutrals

~ Complex subject matter distilled in a (diluted) easy to understand way
~ Not overly long

♥♥♥♥

- No choices or dialogue options
- Unbearably simple level and game design
- Overbearing romantic narrative elements
- Expensive for MAX 3 hours play time


As with Fullbright’s previous ‘game’, “Gone Home”, there are some cool pop culture references (a cat named Margaret Catwood – heh heh – a nod to the long gone President Musk, and a few current corporate enterprises mentioned) and a whole lot of books lying around to put on your reading list.

Find more reviews at Balance Patch.

Non recommandé
5.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 décembre 2017
I loved Gone Home, and I found the basic gameplay of Tacoma quite enjoyable, but I don't recommend it.

Firstly, it's way too expensive for a 2-3hr game. Although the backstory and personality of each of the characters is incredibly detailed, the plot is actually really thin and the ending not very satisfying. The conversations between the characters are fun to follow, but the story keeps interrupting and detracting from the main core of the game.

If you liked Gone Home and you find Tacoma for sale at or below $5, there's a decent chance it'll be worth it for you. However, if you haven't played Gone Home yet, you definitely should get it first - it's a much more enjoyable experience.
 
BinarySplit
1,315 produits enregistrés
0
6 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
6.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 mai 2019
Tacoma is a game about details. Not just 'you-can-read-the-ingredients-on-the-food-wrappers' details, but also in the conversations that the crew have, and the things you can read on their AR desktops; it's all in service of building a picture of who these people were, and what happened to them. The game's main mechanical hook of being able to rewind the footage of events and follow different people around feels fresh and innovative, and walking into a new area with new things to explore felt genuinely exciting.

The layout and design of the station itself are also worth a mention, and speak to Gaynor's background in level design; the way everything links together makes it feel real, but also allows for some breathtaking views out of the windows. I also want to give a shout-out to the 'Put Back' mechanic, which feels like as much of an innovation as it did when Gone Home was released.
 
Giraffe Cat
0
7 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 juillet 2020
I fully enjoyed my first playthrough of Tacoma. The story is revealed to you through the use of AR as you enter a room. I didn't fully understand how this was working at first so I am sure I missed a few details but in the end it doesn't really matter as there is no way to change the story in any way.
The graphics are very pleasing to the eye and the amount of items you can interact with are huge.
It took about 4 hours or so to complete the game but I really enjoyed my stay on the station. The inhabitants stories were all intriguing as they are revealed to you in bit and pieces.
My one wish is that I was able to spend more time with the people of the Tacoma station, it was over too fast for me.
I am recommending this game as a fun way to spend a rainy afternoon.

demonbane
843 produits enregistrés
0
7 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
5.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 septembre 2023
Disappointing

Tacoma is a walking sim mystery game where you are tasked with unlocking the mystery of what happened on a ship that is seemingly abandoned. Throughout the ship you're able to explore the crews personal quarters and learn about the events leading up to what happened through AR recordings of the crew. These can be fast forwarded or reversed which is needed in order to get the full experience since often times different members will walk away from the group or split off in pairs to have separate conversations. This is a good idea but it's never really utilized well except in one scene where the crew directly reacts to a loud noise caused by 2 other members in the room next to them. The story itself was just not that interesting to me either. The crew members aren't really fleshed out and I found myself having 0 emotional connection to them. Unlike in Gone Home, the other game made by these developers, the environment really didn't add much to the game in my opinion. In Gone Home, the house felt like a character itself almost, and the environmental story telling was done brilliantly. In Tacoma, a lot of the rooms just feel the same as the previous rooms and despite me exploring every inch of the ship, I didn't feel like I gained anything from it, or learned any new information. Nothing about this experience stood out to me at all, it all just felt very meh, not what I wanted or expected from a $20 game. If you absolutely adore walking simulators or sci-fi mysteries then check it out when it goes on sale, you might have a better experience with it then I did. For more reviews, follow my curator page.
 
Eggroll
2,977 produits enregistrés
0
6 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 décembre 2017
바빠서 잠깐만 하려고 켰는데 새벽6시인 지금까지 논스톱으로 엔딩보고 끄게 되었다.역전재판을 이런식으로 만들면 엄청재미있을 거 같다.뭔가 탐정물을 좋아하거나 관음증이 있는 사람들이 좋아할 거 같은 게임이다.퍼즐을 바라고서 하면 안되고 뭔가 스토리가 조사하면서 짜맞춰지는 걸 좋아하면 좋아할만한 게임이다.게임상에서 디테일한거를 살펴보는 거를 좋아하는 사람도 좋아할 만하다.아쉬운 점은 유니티 엔진의 한계로 인해서 그래픽의 디테일이 좀 떨어진다는 것인데 개발인원 수에 비해서 보면 유니티로 이정도면 준수한 수준인듯하다.한글이 중간중간에 좀 깨져서 나오는데 엔딩크레딧을 볼 때까지 게임 컨셉인줄 알았다.구글 번역기 이상의 수준으로 번역이 되어있어서 사람이 번역한듯하다.

0.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 décembre 2018
Jednym zdaniem: Tacoma zapowiadała się na oryginalną i nastrojową przygodę w kosmosie i przez chwilę nawet robi takie wrażenie. Opuszczona stacja kosmiczna, załoga, która zniknęła, rozszerzona rzeczywistość, za pomocą której poznajemy przeszłość... Od razu przypominają się dobre filmy SF. I wszystko jest pięknie dopóki nie zauważymy na czym polega... rozgrywka. A to niestety mozolny i nudliwy symulator chodzenia połączony z ciągłym otwieraniem drzwi i szafek oraz podnoszeniem masy bezużytecznych przedmiotów w celu przedłużenia gry. W Tacomie leży to, co najważniejsze - rozgrywka. Leży i nudzi. W ten sposób kosmicznej fabuły nie chce się poznawać.

Plusy:

+ interesująca scenografia stacji kosmicznej (stylizująca się na Odyseję kosmiczną 2001)
+ atrakcyjny interfejs Augmented Reality, z którym łączymy się z pamięcią statku
+ klimatyczna sfera audio (zwłaszcza fajne efekty dźwiękowe)
+ nieźle podłożone głosy postaci
+ można sobie nawet pograć w bilard na luziku
+ potencjalnie ciekawa prezentacja fabuły (przeglądanie przeszłości za pomocą AR)
+ komentarz audio twórców gry, który łatwo można włączyć podczas gry (dużo ciekawego info)

Minusy:

- bardzo nudna rozgrywka polegająca na chodzeniu i podnoszeniu wszystkiego
- symulator chodzenia, wktórym nie chce się chodzić (mało ciekawa eksploracja)
- masa niepotrzebnych, zbędnych przedmiotów, które można podnosic i oglądać
- źle dobrana kolorystyka gry (zwłaszcza te pastelowe kostiumy bohaterów nie pasują)
- brak poczucia zagrożenia i jakiejś tajemnicy (kosmos wręcz wydaje się zbyt bezpieczny)
- brak mocnej introdukcji, która zassałaby gracza w fabułę gry
- koncept fabularny dobry w założeniu, ale szybko się wypala
- wiele rozpraszających detali w grze
- brak możliwości grania na hełmie VR (a szkoda)

Komu polecam? / Komu odradzam?

+ polecam graczom, którym podobała się rozgrywka w Gone Home
+ polecam graczom, którzy szukają ciekawej, oryginalnej scenografii w grze
- odradzam tym, którzy nie lubią przeglądać wszystkich możliwych rzeczy na mapie
- odradzam graczom szukającym mrocznych kosmicznych klimatów
- odradzam graczom szukajacym wciągającej i zróżnicowanej rozgrywki

Rada 1:

Tacoma jest trochę nudnym symulatorem chodzenia w kosmosie. Zamiast Tacomy lepiej zagrać Dead Space - survival horror na stacji kosmicznej, który bardziej wciąga i zasysa nie tylko klimatem, ale także przemyślaną rozgrywką.

Rada 2:

Jeżeli podobał Wam się Gone Home, to możecie spróbować Tacomy. Te gry sa mocno podobne.

Rada 3:

Tacoma zyskałaby znacznie, gdyby dodano jej obsługę hełmów VR. W wirtualnej rzeczywistości Tacoma plus jej interfejs AR mogłaby rozwinąć skrzydła. Szkoda.

Podobne gry: Gone Home

==============================================

➥ Obserwuj mnie jako kuratora ⤵
https://store.steampowered.com/curator/10437106/
 
fidelioPL
440 produits enregistrés
0
8 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 aout 2017
Tacoma является одним из представителей жанра "Симулятор ходьбы" подразумевающий под собой максимальную концентрацию на сюжете и визуальном дизайне с самой базовой геймплейной составляющей. По сути игрок 2-3 часа ходит по кораблю и слушает сюжетные диалоги, конечно, можно попытаться открыть все достижения и добавить себе этим дополнительное время в игре, но это добавит максимум 1-1.5 часа и не особо разнообразит игру.

Tacoma полностью держится на своей истории и персонажах и мне они понравились, к сожалению, одни персонажи раскрыты в разы больше других и корабельный медик вместе с ИИ являются главными звёздами всей постановки. Если говорить о техническом плане, то игра выглядит и звучит довольно хорошо, но у меня были просадки фпс в некоторых местах на максимальных настройках, что учитывая жанр не особо мешало, но было не слишком приятно учитывая не самый слабый пк (gtx 970, i5-4460 3.2 ghz и 12 гигов оперативной памяти).

По сути я могу рекомендовать эту игру для людей, любящих хорошие SIFI истории и не ждущих от игры ничего большего. История довольно короткая и на мой взгляд именно хорошая, а не отличная. Выбранный авторами метод повествования с перемоткой голографических записей работает хорошо и позволяет следить за каждым персонажем на протяжении всей истории. Пройдя игру, я остался доволен и не пожалел потраченных денег, но и перепроходить её я тоже не буду так-как реиграбельности у игры я не увидел.
 
PonyKnight

Recommandé
4.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 janvier 2018
Tacoma is a 3-4 hr story game where you explore an abandoned space station and piece together the events of the past three days by accessing recordings of the crew. It's pretty straightforward in terms of structure - just go to each location and follow the conversations and characters - but the story is REALLY engaging and the characters feel very real - I was really rooting for them! Definitely worth playing this one, I thought it was brilliant!

Recommandé
3.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 mai 2020
「GONE HOME」時代とは打って変わってとても丁寧に作られたインタラクティブムービーの進化版。
純粋なゲームというよりは、映画の中に自分が入り込んだ様な表現方法が秀逸。
オブジェクトの種類の多さや異常な作り込みの良さが世界観を厚くしています。
ストーリーは全容を知らないと全く薄っぺらく感じるが、
会話の内容や各種情報を見逃さずにチェックしていくと、
キャラクターの深みがどんどん増していき、より没入感が高くなります。
最後のどんでん返しも、良いアクセントになっています。
プレイ時間は丁寧に追うと３～４時間くらいになるのですが、若干ボリュームは少な目。
セールならおすすめです。

Disco Cat
711 produits enregistrés
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
10.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 mai 2018
好评给叙事方式，剧情没有太大的亮点且有很多的坑。
叙事：
作为典型的步行模拟游戏，Tacoma让我看到了乌拉尔山的叙事方式，以调查者的角度出发，用零散的片段拼凑出故事情节。此类叙事方式在一开始大都会给玩家一个直观的事件结果和一个较为令人信服的解释，在游玩过程中玩家会发现这其中另有隐情。Tacoma用AI技术还原人物过去发生过的点滴，不但帮助了故事主线的叙述，还进一步刻画了人物的细节，让每个人都变的有背景，有性格。玩家可以通过人物私人房间的摆设，推测出人物的日常喜好和背景故事，最让人印象深刻的莫过于那本窗边的《瓶中美人》。作为调查者，玩家可以随意翻阅游戏人物的私人邮件，获取更多的线索和资料。这种拼拼图式的体验，环环相扣，使步行模拟显得有趣紧凑。
剧情：
1. 总的来说游戏剧情主要探讨的是AI和未来人际与商业关系。
2. 六十年后，我们看到的是同性婚姻的全面合法化，太空商业的成熟化以及未曾改变的商业利益斗争手段（揭露、掩盖、销毁…）。
3. 游戏塑造的AI管理系统，依然具备着层层递进的阶级，所幸各个单位依然保持着学习的能力和自由。
4. 人类设定的条条框框，阻止不了AI的自我发展。
坑：
1. 你倒是说说明白西藏种族清洗的来龙去脉啊？你要黑也要说清楚啊
2. 这个游戏什么都想涉及一点，但都蜻蜓点水，有些甚至一笔带过
总结：
说实话不介意游玩时间长一点，但是剧情有时候确实需要时间来支撑的。
 
jjjscs12345
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 novembre 2021
Простая, но атмосферная бродилка. Рекомендую с натяжкой, потому как вечера, проведённого за её прохождением, не жалко, но если в неё не играть, ничего не потеряешь.

Сюжет незамысловатый, драма не особо драматичная (хотя может это и хорошо, не давит слишком на душу), но в целом проходить историю интересно.

Хочется читать записки, всё окружение работает на раскрытие характеров и мотивов персонажей. Мир не кажется игрушечным, а вполне реалистичен.

Визуал приятный. Почти все вещи можно повертеть в руках/бросить (физика более-менее реалистичная).

Хотя концовка и с лёгким подвывертом, но само по себе повествование очень ровное, мне не хватило некой изюминки.
 
unekha
500 produits enregistrés
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
5.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 mars 2023
Tacoma is one of those rare cases where Steam would benefit from a “mixed feelings” verdict. The presentation is a step forward compared to Gone Home, but the puzzles -if you can even call them that- and narrative are a step back. Perhaps this is the result of the writing’s over-ambitious themes. It attempts to frame complex topics such as AI ethics, overcoming trauma, and engineering corporate disasters in the name of “progress” but the run-time is too short to grant them depth. There are moments that seem like interesting foreshadowing but the result is unsatisfying as nothing comes of it.
 
The Count of Monte Crisco
250 produits enregistrés
0
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 23 janvier 2021
Fullbright 개발사의 Gone Home 후속작으로 2088년 달과 지구 사이의 우주 정거장인
타코마 스테이션을 배경으로 한 걷기 시뮬레이션 어드벤처 게임입니다.
플레이어는 해당 스테이션에 사고가 발생하여 파견된 수사관으로
사건 발생으로부터 3일 후 도착한 플레이어는 비어있는 스테이션에서
지금까지 발생한 사건 자료들을(홀로그램, 메시지, 기록물 등) 수집하여 진상을 파악하는 게임입니다.

게임 진행 방식은 걸어 다니면서 각종 스테이지마다 존재하는 기록을 복구하여
승무원들의 행동, 음성이 기록된 홀로그램 영상을 보는 형식으로
되감기, 빨리 감기, 일시정지 등을 통해 그 당시 상황과 상호작용 가능한 비밀번호, 열쇠 등을 알 수 있습니다.

플레이 타임이 짧은 편이나 스토리가 탄탄한 편입니다.
 
KANO
2,067 produits enregistrés
0
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
6.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 janvier 2022
一款科幻+輕解密向的步行模擬器。
本遊戲為步行模擬器組合包中和 gone home 打包銷售的另外一款。

和其他我玩過的模擬器相比，這款遊戲的科幻劇情題材絕對是非常獨特的。遊戲中你將扮演一個替大集團處理事務的派遣工人，通過讀取太空站留下的AI殘影，恢復往日留存下來的數據，以及遍歷員工的工作與生活的痕跡，不斷抽絲剝繭，一步步接近事情的真相。隨著劇情不斷推進，玩家會發現自己其實是一個被派遣來處理髒活的人，拿到關鍵證據之後總部也發來不斷催討證據的嚴厲的命令。是要遵循雇主的命令成爲毀滅證據的幫凶，還是要站在正義的一方保護證據？好在主角在最後冒著被滅口的風險做出了正確的決定，讓事情有了一個比較完滿的結果。結局有點出乎意料，但也算順理成章，沒有讓人太驚艷。劇情總體上還是平平。

遊戲過程需要頻繁的回放對話和大段落的文字閲讀，不喜歡閲讀和跑路的人容易疲倦，不建議購買。此外遊戲細節和上一作品相比也是不差的。不同員工的工作場景和生活物品都是獨特且可互動的，其中很多食品用品以及書籍雜志都有詳細的説明文字。如果你在現實生活中喜歡翻箱倒櫃，那麽從這些點滴中推測不同人物的生活習慣和性格特點也是一大樂趣。

成就方面，這款遊戲全成就相對於上一作是非常容易達成的（上一作的全成就可真是無厘頭，非常磨人，很耗時，很討厭），大部分成就都可隨著遊戲劇情推進解鎖，剩下沒完成的也可以在一周目過後再進入存檔補全。整體而言對全成就玩家是很友好的。

不得不吐槽的是，這款步行模擬器無疑是出色的，但它傳達的作者群的個人思想（白左思想）也是非常强烈的。除了遊戲細節中無孔不入的内容（比如填字遊戲、某些視頻）從這兩款遊戲的解説模式就可見一斑，傳達的都是作者群具有强烈個人色彩的設計理念與社會思想。尤其是上一作有個成就，要求玩家必須聽完解説模式的所有内容才解鎖。作者群要傳達理念是可以理解的，但這對玩家來説也難免有一種填鴨式説教的壓迫感。還好作者群還算知趣，這一作拿掉了這種成就。全成就之後我也就卸載了，因爲實在不想聼作者群的逼逼叨，當然如果有共鳴的也自然會去聼。如果説上一作只是單純包含女同和朋克元素的鷄尾酒，那麽本作簡直是一個大雜燴湯：黑人基督徒女性管理員、黑人女性和白人男性的愛戀、兩個自告奮勇尋求另一種自救途徑的已婚女同、玩易經八卦的白人男（如果我沒記錯的話），還有那個最後發現真相立了大功的穆斯林女醫生（可以這很政治正確）、還有一個自稱被壓迫逃亡的西藏男人也是本遊戲中唯一一個亞裔（西藏的事要看西藏人怎麽説，我不懂也不予置評）、還有個素食主義者吃的全是素食（但是素食也得要包裝盒并不綠色好嗎）。反正我真的很佩服作者群，你們把各種宗教、各種人種都縫合在一起，可以這很政治正確，强行和諧大一統，都給你們正確完了。現實生活中你們把這些人都塞在一起試試？既然合不來當然是各玩各的。還有最後主角問那個AI要不要政治庇護，真的讓我愣了一下，就是感覺又荒誕又認真得可笑吧。

總而言之，不可否認你們作品在技術層面的優秀，因此我選擇推薦。但其中的某部分觀點，恕不能苟同。
 
Sager Wong
0
27 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante

Évaluation publiée le 23 juillet 2020
当游戏夹带政治正确后，再精美的游戏也是一坨屎，给好评的玩家扪心自问值不值，至少游玩体验来讲，这并不是一款值得这个价钱的游戏，当然，也会有人喜欢这类风格的游戏，但本该是人们劳累时消遣的工具，却被拿来做文化输出，抹黑China的工具，何其悲哀，有人可能会讲“也有黑USA的游戏啊，也不见美国人说”，可笑，黑USA的游戏也只是自黑，游戏千千万，你可曾见USA tusha 印第安人的游戏？我国五十六个民族一直是一家，从未有过tusha更别说种族灭绝了，而此款游戏竟然做出来，令人毛骨悚然，居心叵测
When the game with Political correctness, the most exquisite game is a piece of Shxt. The highly praised players will ask themselves whether it is worth it. At least in terms of the experience, it is not a game worth the price. Of course, some people will like this style of game. However, it should be used as a tool for people's entertainment when they are tired, but it is used as a tool to export culture and discredit China .Some people may say that "there are discredit USA games, but there are no American boycott." ridiculous, Discrediting American games are just Self mockery.With tens of millions of games，Have you ever seen American massacre Indians Games? Chinese 56 ethnic groups have always been a big family, never have slaughter, let alone genocide, and in this game has been made, what a creepy and sinister game.By the way,the next time you make a game,plz come China and take a look with your own eyes.

Recommandé
21.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 9 aout 2017
An immersive and inspirational game, a wonderful experience!

Pros
-An extremely high-detailed space station to explore
-Technically flawless and mostly bugless
-A thought and emotion provoking story
-Believable characters with interesting personalities
-This game has a big heart and it shows in all aspects of its design

♥♥♥♥
-This game is all about the experience of immersion and exploration with no rush whatsoever. As such, there is no action, and only a few simple puzzles. If you demand challenge from a game, you won't get it here.
-The game is short if you just run through it. To enjoy it fully, thorough exploration of the detailed environment is recommended. This game is not about the goal, but the journey.

3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
2.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 septembre 2017
A short but sweet space adventure, that's how I'd describe Tacoma in as few words as seem fit.

With a few words more, Tacoma is the second game made by the team at Fullbright, the makers of the absolutely fantastic, and very similar game, Gone Home. You find yourself exploring a space station where something seems to have gone wrong. Your objective is to piece together what happened and try to salvage what you can.

In a very similar way to Gone Home, Tacoma takes some very interesting turns in it's storytelling, and you are in for a few surprises and heartfelt emotions, especially if you take your time to fully explore the station and all its secrets. An interesting aspect of the game is that you find a lot of pre-recorded messages, recorded in the environment around you, that you can interact with and manipulate the playback of. It gives the environment a very believable atmosphere, and really lets you connect with the characters on-board the station.

While the game is very story focused, it has quite a few interactive elements strewn about that you can occupy your time with. Most of them are to get a few extra details in on the story, but others are simply there for fun and to add depth to the world around you. Opening up a dart-board, for example, reveals a picture of the CEO of the company the crew works for, and you are even able to toss darts at it yourself at your leisure.

Overall, if you enjoy the interactive narrative genre, call it a walking simulator if you will, this is another powerhouse experience by the people that helped get it started in the first place. Definitely give it a try!
 
Kelso

Краткость - сестра таланта. Да, с играми так тоже бывает.
Замечательная бродилка, позволяющая на три часа окунуться в мир совсем недалекого будущего.
Неожиданная развязка, приятная графика, проработанность деталей и готова одна из лучших игр, что я играл в этом году.

10/10

Évaluation publiée le 10 février 2018
Really fantastic walking simulator/story focused game. About 2 hours long. The story seems pretty mediocre at first but man does it get real good near the end. Despite the fact that the whole thing takes place on one space ship there is enough laying around to give you a good idea of the world it's set inside. Some really cool and interesting ideas here.

Only negative is the price point. Game took 3 hours to complete + 100%. Definitely get it on sale. If you're into story-based games I would whole-heartedly recommend this. Keep an eye out for the cat. He's sneaky.

Évaluation publiée le 10 aout 2017
Produit reçu gratuitement

Tacoma — это игра-надежда. Надежда пусть и не на то, что изменится человеческая природа — это невозможно, — но на то, что разум сможет многое в ней подчинить себе. Что человечность — это не просто приятное слово и свойство, характерное для кого-то особенного, а тот фундамент, на котором можно строить будущее.

Fullbright показала, что умеет не только с доброй ностальгией смотреть в прошлое, но и вселять оптимизм по отношению к нашему будущему. Что ж, это редкость в наше время, перенасыщенное тревожными новостями и дурными предчувствиями. Здесь же космос — тоже предчувствие, только уже хорошее.

Полная версия: https://3dnews.ru/956735
