1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 avril 2021
With Tacoma, Fullbright proves that they aren't just a one hit wonder; they're very much capable of creating new, worthwhile experiences within the "Walking Sim" genre. And while I do think the story is less impactful than Gone Home, it's still an entertaining journey and it's themes are as timely as ever, especially with the recent events regarding Amazon workers. And maybe it's because I recently played the God Awful "Suicide of Rachel Foster", but I found Tacoma's more optimistic view to be a pleasant change of pace from similar games. The voice acting is fantastic and the recorded conversations were a solid mechanic to help ground the story a bit more (as opposed to having a series of disconnected audio logs). Lots of care was put into this world and while the station itself isn't that visually interesting, the little touches of personality displayed in each characters work environments are. And in that regard, Fullbright continues to be some of the top dogs in world building and environmental storytelling. That being said I did feel that it dragged a bit in the middle, and I thought that more could have been done to raise the tension. But despite those minor issues, I can say that this was a great experience that's an easy recommendation for those interested... Unless you have a weird hatred for gay people in space... then I would say don't play this... but also seek help you goofy
 
Young_Nacho
188 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 avril 2021
Tacoma é um walking simulator de exploração (assim como Gone Home, mesmo estúdio) que dessa vez explora estação espacial. A história, por incrível que pareça, é sobre os personagens em si e não sobre a protagonista, Amy, que você só vai descobrindo através da recuperação de dados em vídeos (deve ter uma explicação melhor, mas confesso que o game nem apela tanto pra ficção cientifica). A narrativa é boa partindo que a história não se compromete muito em detalhar tudo ou se aprofundar sobre os personagens, apenas de mostrar como cada um é, seus relacionamentos, como pensam e suas vidas. Os gráficos para época já eram ultrapassados até mesmo para um indie, mas o que dá o tchan é a ambientação que é bem detalhada para uma estação espacial, se preocupando com muitos objetos em seus detalhes, assim como Gone Home. A jogabilidade poderia ser melhor, deram atenção a física e tals, mas acredito que se esqueceram de melhorar nas interações. A trilha sonora é praticamente ausente sendo lembrada em alguns momentos com músicas calmas, mas mais de momento e não para de tocar como acredito que foi a intenção. Gone Home é bem melhor nesse quesito, não por ser Rock, mas pela temática mesmo. É um game curto assim como Gone Home, mas pode bater fácil 3h dependendo de como a pessoa joga. Pra quem tem curiosidade se o game se parece muito com Gone Home, pode ficar tranquilo que a intenção do game é outra. Tem a representatividade que pregaram no primeiro Gone Home, mas não é objetivo principal do game.
 
Hiroshi
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 mars 2021
I personally liked this game enough to binge play it (~3 hours). It's like a "walking simulator" (45%) ,"visual novel" (45%), and "hidden item" (10%) game combined.

It's a like a "detective" game, but without the pressures of solving a case. You're an outside observer whose job is to simply collect AR/conversation/text data, but the characters and premise roped me into trying to figure out more. In other words, the game doesn't really force you to "solve" anything, but the entire station (Tacoma) is filled with clues and observations you can piece together yourself to figure out this theoretical life in the "2080s", the crew members' lives, the incident aboard the station, and other mysteries. There is some conglomerate/capitalistic commentary/criticisms, but a lot of it is lore-building.

The characters (represented by dummy-looking AR bodies) feel like true representations of people and fleshed out. Despite their AR appearances, they're not just fictional caricatures-- The devs have carefully crafted environments and objects, the voice actors have acted out interesting, believable dialogues/monologues, and the writing is simply on-point-- there are honest and human scenarios, some of which I can really sympathize with.

It really is a nice and unique format for storytelling-- one dependent on your own interests and desire to explore. I liked it more than Gone Home, the previous game made by Fullbright.

Three hours well spent!

Évaluation publiée le 1 février 2021
A great little game!

A story set in the future about a corrupt company and a disaster that occurs, made unique by the characters' personalities and relationships. I was impressed with how natural the dialogue was, and how authentic the characters felt.

Short and sweet, took me about 2 hours, but reading guides afterwards realised there was much more detail and nuance to explore. Just going through the story and reading the extra bits I found, I picked the story up easily as it unfolded and was pieced together.

I bought it on sale, and would recommend it if you can get it cheaper too. No regrets, glad I played :)


On a side note, if you love this game and don't mind reading, I'd HIGHLY recommend the book series Illuminae!

Контроль
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 octobre 2020
First of all, you don't play this game for the challenge. I mean, sure, there is exploration and puzzle solving involved, but that's clearly not the main focus here. No, the main focus are the characters and world. Both are put into the spotlight during the entire runtime of this four hour mystery game. You will become very intimately familiar with the crew of the Tacoma in particular, as you gradually uncover more and more about their personalities, relationships, history and all the pain, grievances, dreams and ambitions that they took with them aboard this space station. It grounds the characters in a way that is seldom seen in videogames, especially those within the scifi/fantasy genres.

All these elements tie into the greater mystery of what exactly happened to the crew, which you try to piece together by playing back AR sequences of what certain members of the crew were up to at certain points in time and space. As said, it's not a particulary challenging game, so reconstructing timelines ends up being fairly straightforward, but what keeps you hooked is the storytelling, which is done through wonderful, natural sounding dialogue and intricate world building where every object in the game can be picked up and examined. As is usually the case with scifi media like this (well, the succesful ones at least), even the space station itself has it's own distinct personality, like it's a seperate character all on it's own.

So in summary then, if you're looking for a memorable interactive storytelling experience, then Tacoma is a perfect game for you. Looking for more challenge and very involving gameplay mechanics, then look somewhere else.
 
SpectR0nn

I loved, LOVED, this game. Just finished it with 75% achievements, including a few secret ones. The worldbuilding is excellent, plot narrative and voice acting brilliant. Go for it if you need some food for the soul! Go for it even if you don't! Note though, that this isn't your typical puzzle game. You play this game for the story.
Score: 10/10

Bakuba
191 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 avril 2020
I haven't played anything quite like this before. I'd say it is a "narrative" game, set aboard a space station where you explore and find out what happened to the crew. The interactions you have in the game boil down to watching holographic projections of the crew as they spend their last moments on the ship. You also search through emails and messages, along with looking at various objects left around the station to piece together some backstory about each crew member, and finding access codes. Along the way you begin to unravel the mystery surrounding the station and what happened to its people.

I've seen the term "walking simulator" sometimes to describe this game. It's true that you do a lot of walking. But the game gives you a lot to look at and provides an interesting story to back it up. The plot itself is fairly easy to get to grips with and understand - I found myself following it reasonably well whilst watching all the crew projections, but it's just complex enough such that there are some details to fully work out. The game is not long, and the environment quite small, but looking around the station was a joy. There is also a bit of replay value if you didn't uncover absolutely everything on your first playthrough.

So an 8 out of 10 from me, and a strong recommendation for those that like story-focused games.
 
Steve Back
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Recommandé
3.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 mars 2020
Tacoma isn't as fanciful as Edith Finch or as literary as Dear Esther. Its secrets are less subtle than the hints in Gone Home-but that isn't a flaw in itself. Tacoma knows the story it wants to tell, and the setting it wants to tell it in. The game raises our empathy for the inhabitants of the station through learning about their relationships and histories, and then makes us fear where their story ends up. It's a winning formula.

I played Tacoma in a single sitting, just over three hours, which felt exactly right for the story being told and the mechanics being used. It's easy to recommend to fans of the genre. Like most walking simulators, it's best approached when you're already in the appropriate mood.
 
slight nope

1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
3.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 janvier 2020
I don't really know how to feel about this game. I generally like concept (listening to/ watching the 3D records of the former crew members interacting with each other) and I appreciate the attention to detail when it comes to the environment, but the story couldn't really draw me in and the tasks are very repetitive. Summerized I'd say:

Pros:
- cute artstyle, if you're into that
- interesting setting and concept
- fun to collect achievements

♥♥♥♥:
- short playtime (3-4 hours if you want to collect all achievements)
- rather monotonous story

I still recommend this game if you love story-based walking simulators in general, but I also recommend only buying it when it's on sale.

Очень короткая, обыскивая все комнаты, слушая все диалоги и пытаясь прочесть поврежденные файлы (Это сложно) на игру ушло 3,5 часа. Не сказать что здесь глубокий сюжет, он просто есть. Но за что действительно стоит похвалить игру, так это мелкие детали: листовки, баночки, коробочки, всё, что не прикручено к полу, можно взять, покрутить, почитать, а текста там бывает не мало. То, на чём обычно не акцентировано внимание и создает лишь декорации, здесь, единственный способ узнать о персонажах.

Recommandé
5.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 décembre 2019
I'd expect nothing less from the creators of Gone Home but it really is quite hard to emphasise what a fully realised world these writers have created, which is especially impressive considering every human being you witness is already gone, you don't get to interact with anyone really. Each character feels like a real person in a real world, information about characters, their relationships with one another, and lore about the world they inhabit is communicated to you in a way that never feels overly obvious or heavy-handed. Idk man, it's just good writing.
If I'm gonna be nitpicky, the movement speed could be a bit faster and the controls in zero-g are a bit finicky but that sort of thing hardly impacts the game as it's not the focus and to be honest probably helps it in some ways. I imagine travel in zero gravity is quite difficult and confusing.
Anyway, yadayada capitalism is bad but purchase this game maybe? At least the game agrees, no spoilers, but megacorporations are hardly portrayed in the most flattering light in this story. :)
 
autdroid
159 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 octobre 2019
总体感受：
TACOMA并没有非常巧妙的科幻设定或一波三折的惊艳剧情。它不是那种探讨科技发展与人类命运关系的纯粹科幻。它只是讲了个故事，利用简洁的UI结合AR系统，以充满科技感的风格，让玩家自行探索达到叙事目的。线性发展的剧情，引领玩家感受人物心境，接触不为人知的真相。

仅针对游戏性：
pros
+ UI非常简洁 指向性明确
+操作难度低 易上手
+具有创意的AR系统设定（拨弄时间轴还原场景）
+总体发展呈线性、细节探索自由化，每个玩家的体验都不大一样

♥♥♥♥
-场景比较单一
-剧情较简单，流程短
-优化一般
-中文翻译质量不佳
此条含剧透 -AI解放前线的出现比较突兀

游戏背景：
2088年，商业航天逐渐完善，针对富人的太空旅行服务业已成为现实。“塔科马”，一个负责给月球酒店提供转运服务的地月中转站，隶属于文图里斯科技公司（简称V-T）。它受到AR系统完全覆盖，所有通话、视频等信息都被AR记录。玩家操控的角色利用AR探寻事件经过。

精简游戏剧情：
剧透警告 V-T为逆转公司颓势，密谋害死塔科马人员以推动一项利己的政策，却被站内AI奥丁泄密阻止。V-T雇佣主角登上塔科马，清除机密文件、带回AI认知介质，没想到主角是AI解放前线的卧底，此行的目的是带领奥丁逃离V-T，为之提供政治庇护
 
来份冰糖🍓吧
549 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
6.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 23 juillet 2019
I'm not going to comment on the merits of a walking simulator. I like them.

As such, I will review this game against characteristics of a walking simulator. This game is a remarkable improvement over the studio's previous title, Gone Home. Which I also loved. The visuals, sound effects and music, and voice acting were far more enjoyable. I thought the segmenting of the game preserved the games pace and feeds the story in even bites. Seeing conversations in the past like its a tape recording and having to follow conversations between rooms and such, brilliant mechanic that was a lot of fun to play with.

The story was good, enough so that it kept me up a couple hours later than I intended to be up. At times though it feels forced. The behavior of the cast and the setting of a space station felt like, teenagers in space. At least some of the characters did. You spend a lot of time taking in the personal troubles of the cast, specifically around relationships, but the meat of the story is in regards to the boundaries of AI and you have to really pay attention to catch onto that. I wish the focus had been switched. Otherwise awesome game and I definitely yelled holy ♥♥♥♥ at my screen right before the credit role.

8/10, definitely recommend, especially if your interested in scifi or AI

It was a unique experience nevertheless. It has a great story and plot with some really detailed characters. It was kind of a surprise for me to see how much I loved playing in commentary mode. Hearing about all the little things from the development of Tacoma was so interesting to hear. I'd recommend this, but not to everyone. I can see how someone can get bored after reading so many texts and listening to so many things. But for me this game exceeded my expectations. Really happy with it!

Recommandé
5.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 novembre 2019
A lovely story delivered in a new and interesting way. Fullbright's writing shines again, this time making it effortless to grow attached to abstract representations of the characters. Like Gone Home, the environment of Tacoma is full of small details which give life to the characters and the world, while adding to its overall consistency.

It's a walking-simulator for sure, so it may not be your cup of tea if you don't enjoy them. But, if you're up for a story, Tacoma's got a great one.

agestraud1
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 mai 2019
You play as Amy Ferrier, a subcontractor charged with retrieving the AI aboard the Tacoma Station. The game plays like an interactive mystery novel with its chapters set in a specific order, but within each chapter, you can freely explore while the AI downloads into your handheld device.

Despite its playtime of only about three hours Tacoma depicts interesting and multilayered characters and shows off their interactions in Augmented Reality recordings which you can pause and rewind as you like. You can literally watch the footage from different angles. You can follow characters from room to room, entering and leaving conversations organically. Neat!

Tacoma is a shallow walking-and-reading simulator. It's well made and I've encountered only a single bug, and even though it did partially spoil the ending, I found the story intriguing and satisfying. But to get the full somewhat dystopian subtext you will need to connect all the dots yourself.

At no point, the game puts up a diagram of everything you've learned or even a journal entry, and while the major story points are shown in those AR recordings, everything else, the meat of the story, is learned by sifting through the crew's personal belongings, hand-written notes and messages.
 
ash
204 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
4.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 janvier 2019
Una historia espacial diferente
Nuevamente tenemos una trama madura de la empresa que hizo gone home, donde no se tratara de aliens ni cosas extrañas sino de las relaciones humanas que se desarrollaron en una nave espacial que tuvieron que abandonar por una causa que deberemos averiguar.
Nuevamente tendremos que recontruir la trama a traves de recuerdos, pero esta vez no sera a traves de diarios como el anterior juego, sino por una recontruccion digital. Cada tripulante de la nave tendra una historia propia y sus relaciones ♥♥♥ los demas.
Jugabilidad
Nuevamente tenemos que encontrar claves para abrir puertas o encontrar algunas llaves sumado a la reconstruccion de situaciones, esos 2 seran las maneras de avanzar por el escenario, a pesar de eso sigue siendo un walking simulator.
Musica
Habra bastante musica ambiental y por momentos habra temas mas emocionantes.
Duracion
Dura unas 4 hs, lo que mas lleva es encontrar las claves o llaves para abrir las puertas, no es necesario guia ya que todo se encuentra sin mayores problemas.
Conclusion
Se tomo varios elementos de jugabilidad del gone home y de relaciones sociales (la tematica lesbiana esta presente nuevamente) para este juego pero se lo adapto a esta juego de ciencia ficcion, conserva lo bueno y mejora aspectos, creeo a los seguidores de gone home les gustara y a los nuevos atraera la tematica espacial.
 
danielbarca888
452 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 31 décembre 2018
Really cool recording playback mechanic where you are rewinding and fastforwarding to get information that you need to proceed, and it manages to tell a decent although perhaps uninspired story that definitely relys on the characters more than the plot. As with this type of game it was lacking in interaction and mechanics. The rewind/ff thing helps, but outside of that you aren't doing much but opening doors and using a key. It's a step up from Gone Home, but compared to Edith Finch it just felt like I was watching a movie where I had to keep rewinding so I could listen to a different group of people. It's only a few hours long at most, so I think it's still worth your time, assuming you are okay with this style of game.
 
fiveeyes
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 23 février 2019
Horas jugadas: 5.1 / Precio de compra: AR$50,62

Este juego lo adquirí junto ♥♥♥ Gone Home sabiendo que era de los mismos creadores (Fullbright) ♥♥♥ la expectativa de encontrar algo igual o mejor que su antecesor. Y la verdad, así fue, no le sobró mucho pero lo logro.
Desde la historia debo decir que me atrapó mas que la de Gone Home, el cual la mayoría lo considera el mejor de los dos. Quizás la ambientación es mucho mas colorida y agradable en Tacoma pero si lo logra es solo por detalles.

Gráficos
Aceptables, para ser un juego indie de mediados de 2017. Bien pulidos y solo un bajo de fps notables al momento de usar el "ascensor" de cada sección de la estación. Tampoco hubo mucho para arriesgar en 2 horas de gameplay que es lo duraría sin dar vueltas. Muy marcados los contrastes de colores en las interacciones, cada personaje tenia su color correspondiente, ejemplo: el Líder de Ingeniería naranja, Jefa de Operaciones violeta, etc.

Sonido
Poco y nada pero bien utilizado en el momento correcto. Sin lucirse ni estropearse, solo sonido ambiente de una típica sala de espera, oficina o sala de estar. En Gone Home tampoco había soundtrack básicamente, ya que el mismo gameplay lo requería y contrariamente a lo que uno piensa, en este tipo de juego hace que la experiencia de juego sea mas inmersiva.

Argumento
La historia nos introduce como Amy, una contratista "infiltrada" que ingresa a la estación dañada llamada Tacoma (propiedad de la empresa Venturis) a recopilar información de porque y como la estación fue evacuada. Dicha estación es coordinada por una IA llamada Odin y 6 tripulantes, cada uno de ellos expertos en una profesión. En el trascurso de la exploración de la misma podemos recrear las situación generadas ahí dentro ♥♥♥ hologramas. Hasta que descubrimos que la estación fue saboteada intencionalmente por la propia Venturis, culpando a las tripulantes ♥♥♥ la intención de demostrar a la tierra que las estaciones espaciales ya no debían ser comandadas por humanos sino por maquinas y/o unidades de inteligencia artificial. Nuestro rol ♥♥♥ Amy pasa por recopilar la información y rescatar a Odin, quien ayudo a que los tripulantes puedan salir ♥♥♥ vida de la nave. Finalmente logramos salir ♥♥♥ Odin brindándole asilo político.

Jugabilidad
Bastante simple, como el genero lo requiere. Baste ♥♥♥ caminar, interactuar ♥♥♥ para abrir puertas, pantallas y mensajes. No hay mucho mas que decir. Tal vez algún que otro mini puzzles que son independientes de la historia del juego.

Lo bueno
- Buena historia
- Interfaz cómoda y amigable a la vista

Lo malo
- Su corta duración
- Demasiado lineal

Puntaje 6/10

Produit reçu gratuitement

J'ai vraiment adoré ! Le système de jeu n'est pas trop compliqué à prendre en main, le scénario et l'environnement sont super, rien à redire ! Bien sûr, il n'y a quasiment aucun gameplay si ce n'est ouvrir des tiroirs et revenir en arrière dans les enregistrements, il faut apprécier le genre, quoi.
Après, j'ai tout exploré et l'ai terminé en quatre heures et demi à peine, je me dis que seize euros c'est peut-être beaucoup, cependant les graphismes sont travaillés, l'univers sonore aussi, il y a vraiment de quoi faire !

Évaluation publiée le 12 décembre 2018
Really loved this, though I also enjoyed Gone Home, so I think this genre just gels for me personally. If you AREN'T a fan of narrative walking sim games and/or games without much action this might not be for you.

Using AR was a clever way to present the narrative, and I enjoyed hunting through the very detailed environment of the Tacoma. That said, there weren't many puzzles and what was there wasn't challenging, so I'd go in expecting a good story rather than a difficult game.

Recommandé
3.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 décembre 2018
追体験型ウォーキングシミュレーターAVG

宇宙ステーションTacomaで事故が発生、事故の詳細を調べるため、乗り込みARデータを回収していく、そのデータに残された、クルーたちの記憶

Gone Homeの制作者達の新作でGone Homeが好きなら問題なく楽しめると思う

クルーたちが事故当時何を考え、どう行動しようとしたのかをARデータから読み取り、追体験のような映画を観ているような感じになるウォーキングシミュレーター、Gone Home同様小道具なども手が凝ってあり、色々と楽しめる

セール時にGone Homeとセットで１０００円以下になるときがあるのでその際にでも買うといいかもしれない、ボリューム的にはどちらも２～４時間位の物なので長期時間楽しみたい人向けではない

Évaluation publiée le 27 novembre 2018
игра определенно заслуживает внимания всех любителей квестов и интерактивных историй.
сюжет довольно любопытный - 2088 год. вы расследуете некий инцедент: технические неполадки на космической станци, при которых команда ищет пути решения.
атмосфера затягивает настолько, что действительно начинаешь верить в то, что ты находишься на космической станции.
да. тут тоже есть типичный подбор персонажей по нынешнему канону лесбиянка-феминистка 2 щтуки. индианка-любительницаИИ, китаец-гей-отец. босс-сильнаяинезависимая-негритянка. при этом все персонажи ненавязчивы, поэтому все смотрится крайне гармонично.
атмосфера 10
сюжет 10 (довольно любопытный финал)
задачки 10 (не нудные, довольно легкие, но при этом интересные ходы решения)
персонажи 10 (хотя и с минусом, потому что эти стереотипы выбешивают уже)
стоит ли играть? определенно стоит. несколько часов жизни с космическим экипажем - это что-то

Benz
119 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 octobre 2018
If you're looking for a game with the same "feel" as Gone Home, you're going to be sorely dissapointed. The mechanics of walking around and learning of the events of the past few hours is carried over from Gone Home, but the tone is flipped upside down. You won't feel the same kind of connection to the crew of the Tacoma, or to the station's AI, ODIN, as you did with your little sister. Where the game makes up for this, however, is it's use of overlapping conversations, and the intuitive control scheme which lets you navigate the conversation seamlessly. I wasn't aware of this before purchasing, so the first time that a conversation started from four different points of view, and then converged into one, I was surely impressed. What's even more impressive is that Fullbright is able to keep this up for the entire game. There are some things that I could have been improved, however:

-When travelling to the different parts of the ship, you view the same repetitive animation sequence each time. It's not the longest thing in the world, but it would have been nice to give the player something else to do during this transition you'll be doing at least 8 times.

-Spoilers for the end ahead: The ending leaves a bit to be desired. While it does give a somewhat satisfying end to the crew, the twist at the very end seems to come out of nowhere. There are several hints at it throughout the game, so it makes sense "lore wise", but it almost feels like they couldn't come up with a good ending.

Overall, I'd say that this is worth a buy. I can't say that there's much replay value to this, since unless you intentionally skip over parts, there's nothing you'll really miss your first time through. At the time of reviewing (and purchase) it's $10.00 USD, which I would say is a fair price.

Happy Obsolescence Day!

Edit: I just remembered that there's a commentary mode. I have not played it, but if you're interested in the development of this game, that will almost double your playtime.
 
Colin Halter

1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
2.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 aout 2018
I must admit, at the beginning I was a bit skeptical, as the controls didn't allow for much contyrol of the character. However, the unique use of memory mechanics drew me in, and I am very glad it did. The further into the game I went, the more I was hooked into the story, which is the selling point of this game.
The beginning of the game makes for a truly interesting experience. The player is not sure what they are walking into and there is a sound in place at the beginning of them game that led me to belive that something was around each corner. This creates a feeling loneliness and insecurity one might imagine that someone might feel in space.
The story is phenomenal, and the ending is a million times better. I only hope that the development company uses this as the prologue for a deeper and more interactive game. I hope to play more in this universe, and maybe more control of my charcter.
I never thought I would be into a story-based game, but this game really put a smile on my face. I literally applauded at the end of the game. Thank you for the experience.

Évaluation publiée le 13 aout 2018
Produit reçu gratuitement

Short, but very good by walking sim standards. Great animations, worldbuilding (subtle and not intrusive) with plenty of visual storytelling and mystery. The plot is compelling but not trying to be more than briefly thrilling which suits the length.

I played it for free (gift) but it was an experience I'd pay for - albeit not full retail of 20 dollars. Recommend to grab it if you like story, sci-fi settings, or light mystery, but only on sale.

How does one make footsteps (which you do hear) without legs or feet? Guess you just have to uncover the mysteries of Tacoma.
 
h
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
5.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 juillet 2018
Tacoma intenta ser la consolidación de Fullbright después de Gone Home, pero queda corto en intenciones y la historia nunca termina de enamorar, algo imperdonable en un juego narrativo.
Vidéo YouTube™: Tacoma - Let's play! - No commentary 
Vues : 14
Tacoma intenta ser la consolidación de Fullbright después de Gone Home, pero queda corto en intenciones y la historia nunca termina de enamorar, algo imperdonable en un juego narrativo.

Más análisis y críticas aquí[www.simpatiaporlacritica.com]

Cuando la compañía independiente Fullbright salió al mercado ♥♥♥ su brillante opera prima Gone Home, nos sorprendió por la calidez de su historia y lo bien que había captado la esencia de la interacción humana en el marco de una relación de amor adolescente en plena década de los '90. Si bien siempre es difícil despegarse del primer juego (y sobre todo si es un éxito rotundo), los desarrolladores quisieron alejarse tanto de la sombra de Gone Home que terminaron en un terreno que claramente les es desconocido. Ni siquiera el gran trabajo narrativo puede maquillar el hecho de que Tacoma es un juego que nunca se consolida como tal, y no es creíble.

Jugamos como Amy Ferrir, una contratista que llega a la estación espacial Tacoma para averiguar qué pasó ♥♥♥ la tripulación, que aparentemente falleció debido a una falla de oxígeno que resultó irremediable. Para recrear los hechos, tendremos que apoyarnos en una inteligencia artificial que grabó todas las conversaciones -y movimientos- de los tripulantes como si fueran mensajes de audio guardados en un disco. Esta misma inteligencia, llamada ODIN, fue una parte sustancial en el manejo y mantenimiento de la estación, por lo que también nos será de gran ayuda para desbloquear alas y seguir escuchando porciones de mensajes.

Hay algunas sub-tramas que se desarrollan si tenemos la suficiente paciencia, pero la historia principal es simplemente averiguar qué ocurrió ♥♥♥ la tripulación. Si bien a priori puede ser un gran nudo de una historia enigmática, rápidamente nos encontramos ♥♥♥ la mayor dificultad que es lidiar ♥♥♥ el sistema de realidad aumentada controlado por ODIN. Lo que en Gone Home se resolvía abriendo cajones y revolviendo viejas revistas, en Tacoma siempre tendremos que lidiar ♥♥♥ pantallas virtuales donde hay que interactuar ♥♥♥ un menú. Como mencionamos al principio, el hecho de que la historia transcurra en una estación espacial, no necesariamente quiere decir que tenga que perderse todo rastro de calidez humana.

Esta "frialdad" hace que como espectador-jugador nos sintamos muy lejanos a los personajes, y por ende, a la historia que cuentan. Ni siquiera el hecho de resolver su supuesta muerte hace que nos enganchemos en la historia. En cuanto a los puzzles, son realmente sencillos, lo cual nos hace pensar que la idea era desarrollar un juego puramente narrativo, que nos vuelve a la cuestión inicial: ¿cuál fue la decisión de contar la historia ♥♥♥ una mecánica tan repetitiva y artificial?.

El error -a nuestro humilde criterio- de diseño en el juego hace imposible que podamos recomendarlo. Tacoma será recordado como un paso en falso dentro de la carrera de Fullbright, un estudio que sin duda cuenta ♥♥♥ gran talento (ver Where the water tastes like wine, por ejemplo) pero que en este casó falló el tiro.
 
Black Plague 💀
1,114 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0

Esperaba más de Tacoma. Seguir las conversaciones de gente durante 3 horas para ver lo que está sucediendo en una nave. La historia no es lo suficientemente interesante ni está desarrollada de manera especial para merecer la compra del juego. De todas maneras si lo tienes por algún humble y te gusta la ciencia ficción el juego es lo sufcientemente corto como para merecer jugarlo.
 
NETes
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 juin 2018
舞台は2088年、調査員の主人公が、宇宙ステーションTacomaに調査に行く。
そこでステーションのクルーがどのように暮らし、何が起こったのかを記録されたログを集める。
記録はARで再生され、早送りや巻き戻し、一時停止ができて、クルーがARデスクトップを開いていた時はそのデータの内容を見ることが可能。
そういった内容を読むことによって、ストーリーや背景を理解していくゲーム。

基本的に過去を観察するゲームなので、パズルや謎解きをしたり、主人公の行動でストーリーが変化するといったゲームではない。
全体的にボリュームは少なく1～2時間で終わる内容だが、攻略に一切関係ないオブジェなどもよく作り込まれていて持ったりして観察することができる。
値段はちょっと高めなので、短い時間でも物語を体験したいって人にお勧め。なるべくなら一度で最期までプレイするのを推奨。
 
12587415
1,704 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
11.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 mai 2018
I liked this game a lot! If you are a fan of "walking simulators" like "Gone Home," "Firewatch," "Edith Finch," etc., then you'll probably like this one. If those aren't really your cup of tea, I'd read some more reviews and maybe watch a video of someone playing it before you buy it. I really enjoyed making sure that I saw and heard and read everything I could possibly find (finding the cat hidden in each playback was a challenge for me) and I was pretty surprised by the ending (in a good way)! There are a few small puzzles, such as finding keys and codes to open things, but nothing too difficult. If you are looking for a "walking simulator" with more puzzles and thinking involved, I'd suggest checking out "The Painscreek Killings." I enjoyed both that game and "Tacoma" very much!
 
ChesterCopperpot
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 mai 2018
So I played through TACOMA in just under three hours. I never once got stuck on a puzzle/code but it was certainly worthwhile to snoop through all the rooms and papers. I thoroughly enjoyed the environmental storytelling, the linear and and parallel conversations, the individual character arcs, and the overall plot.

Honestly, I would recommend this if you want a plot-driven story with interesting, relatable characters with a few puzzles.

Also, there are two women in a gay relationship, two POC in a het relationship, and a POC man in what I believe is a gay relationship. The diversity was really great and the voice acting perfect.

Also also, at one point (after finding the cleaner bot) the two bots collided in a nose boop. I laughed.

Also also also! There is usable of ASL in this game for command prompts to the AI. It's small but reoccurring and really smooth.

The good: well rendered environments, good ambiance, and (other than the ending) a pretty good story

The bad: A high price tag for what it is. I got it in a humble bundle, if I paid full price for this I'd have been really angry.
It's short and after a while you get that your are just along for the ride, none of your decisions affect anything and the little details you think might be important aren't. (don't bother walking around the station with the key or the letter you found in the toilet). I enjoyed the ambiance but the ending and the issues mentioned made it feel like a total waste of time.

kashmiir
262 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 avril 2018
Fullbright ekibini Gone Home oyunu ile tanımıştık. Bu sefer 2. oyunlarını uzaya taşımak istemişler. Ancak yine bizi yürüme simülatörü türünde bir oyun beklemekte. Yine oyunun içeriğinde bir eşcinsel romantizmi konusu yansıtılmış. Sadece merak ettiğim acaba her oyunlarında bu konuyu işleyecekler mi? Yoksa bu tamamen rastlantısal bir durum mu? Çok ilginç bir özellik olmayıp aşina olduğumuz bir durumu farklı bişey gibi göstermek ve sürekli bir şekilde tekrarlanması oyunun konusunu bayatlaştırmaktan öteye gidememiş.

Oyunun özelliklerine gelicek olursak görsellik tamamen harikaydı diyebilirim. Oyundaki her bir öğenin modellemesi tüm detayına kadar işlenmiş. Bu öğeleri tek tek incelemek oldukça keyifliydi. İstasyonun içinden dışarı baktığımızda uzayı görüyoruz ve uzay istasyonu güzel gözürünüyor. Görsellik olarak iyi bir oyun demek yerinde olsa gerek. İşlenilen konu ise 2088 yılında geçmekte. Bir uzay istasyonuna ulaşıp Tacoma adındaki yapay zeka modülünü oradan alıp kurtarmak. Çünkü bu uzay istasyonu artık işlevini yitirmiş bulunmakta. Bu esnada 6 kişilik ekibin başından geçen olaylara eşlik ediyoruz. Ekibin AR görüntüleri ve konuşmaları ile yaşananları izleyip kanıtlar arayarak oyunda ilerleme sağlıyoruz. Uzay istasyonu 3 bölümden oluşmakta. Her bölümde 2'şerli olarak görevlendirilmiş ekibin bölümleri bulunmakta.

Genel anlamda oyun hakkındaki fikirlerim iyi olsada yürüme simülasyonu olduğu için ve ilgi çekici bir konusu olmadığı için sıkıcı olduğunu düşünüyorum. Oyun süresi ise oldukça kısaydı. Eğer tüm diyalogları okumak ve tüm öğeleri incelemek istiyorsanız maksimum 5 saatlik bir oynanış sunuyor. Bir yandan detaylı olmasını taktir ederken diğer yandan senaryosu daya ilgi çekici bir konuya sahip ve oyun süresi biraz daya uzun olsa daha iyi olurdu. Yürüme simülasyonu olsa dahi eğlenceli bir oyun olma potansiyeline sahip bir oyunu harcanmış olarak görüyorum.

Oyun Puanı: 6/10
 
Wulfrei 🎃

Recommandé
6.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 avril 2018
For the walking simulator/short-story it aims to be (you can expect finishing the game in ~3 hours, completing it in ~5), Tacoma shines bright.

The concept of recovering what happened in the space station by means of actually seeing the crew's steps and interactions through the Augmented Reality system works great and it allows you to understand everyone's point of view, personality and events that ultimately led to the way the story unfolded.

The ability to add bits and pieces to the story by checking personal desktops, messages, etc rounds up the great storytelling the game proposes to deliver.

Not spoiling, I can say Tacoma hits bull's eye on making you think about conciousness and what it actually means to be sentient.

Loved it and fully recommend it.

Évaluation publiée le 18 mars 2018
Tacoma é do tipo de jogo que não se joga muito e mais se expirencia,fazendo assim que não seja um jogo que eu possa recomendar para qualquer um porém para aqueles que gostam de jogos de exploração e querem uma narrativa curta,talvez Tacoma seja o que esteja procurando.

A Historia fica progressivamente melhor e o seu entendimento varia com o quanto você conseguiu descobrir antes de terminar o jogo.

A Soundtrack é muito boa,porém não sempre presente,varios momentos você apenas escuta os sons da estação espacial.

Gameplay é basicamente interagir com itens e ver/ouvir o que esta acontecendo.

 
Quejadinha
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 mars 2018
With these walking simulators I often feel like a detective, going through people's things, and learning about their lives, motivations, relationships.

The gameplay loop is very similar to Gone Home. Go through stuff, listen to recordings. Take your time, examine things. Though eventually you'll realize that this corporate space station was sponsored by the fictional equivalent of Mr. Noodle, Sunny D, Nestle, etc. Because a lot of the objects will be similar, yet there's so many touches to detail to be found. From the glass stains on paper, coffee stains in mugs, or a half eaten cup of noodles.

Voice acting was good, as well as the atmospheric sounds. The music was sparse though, which meant I had to hear things in the real world too while I was going through a lot of quiet moments. If you have noise cancelling headphones you may feel more immersed into the world.

Visually lovely, nice textures, lighting is well thought out. The living spaces could be out of a micro-apartment catalogue.

One thing I would wish for is more interactability. Whether it's something that breaks if I drop it, or being able to squeeze a paint tube or juice bag and have the contents spray out. Seriously spent a couple minutes playing with the various floppy items, they're entertaining!

I'm not going to mention price or time to completion, because that's something that I think is more subjective to what people want. If you want my opinion, wait for a sale - price of a movie ticket is definitely worth this admission.
 
Holderist

Évaluation publiée le 20 mars 2018
Heads up: this is only a 2.5-3 hour game and that's if you really take your time. There isn't replayablity here either. You should consider that when you buy it. If I didn't get this in a bundle, I would have probably been upset at the cost to value. Setting all that aside, I really enjoyed this game in the same way I enjoy reading a good book. Fullbright has mastered the art of storytelling through environment and if you're looking for a nice chill game, pick this one up.
 
Citizen Alpha
1,601 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 mars 2018
basically a detective story about investigating an incident on a space station.
and definitive an interesting experience.

obviously this is technically a walking simulator so if you can't have fun without guns and zombies then just stop reading now.
for everybody else it's fully recommended.

you are boarding an abandoned space station trying to salvage the AI core. time to explore the place, download data, collect notes and watch as the story unfolds. quite literally. the idea of using augmented reality to tell parts of the story in a movie-like way is a breath of fresh air and it works really well!
strangely enough this game doesn't come with actual VR support yet obviously it was designed with VR in mind. at any rate playing with mouse and keyboard works like a charm and even some games uninfluenced by the whole VR idea could learn a thing or two here.

you can't talk too much about it without giving away parts of the story so i wont do that. but it was fun to play with an interesting story and deep characters.

i finished the game in just under 3 hours and i spent some more time going for the achievements and making sure i didn't miss anything and i ended up with 6 hours on the clock.
you could say that's a little short for a 20 bucks game with no replay value (as long as you explore everything on your first run). get it while it's on sale or in a bundle and you will be perfectly fine.
 
Meister_Leuchte
1,137 produits enregistrés
1
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 mars 2018
An absolutely fantastic little gem. This was the first "walking simulator" that I've ever played, and I was surprised when it kept my attention from start to finish, all the way to that wonderful ending.

While the game itself is relatively straightforward, the series of converging plotlines and sense of mystery that it presents so adeptly kept me excited and engaged. Each individual scene generally packs a number of individual conversations; the set of characters may begin in a group, then split up into separate conversations, then reconvene again. I found myself viewing the same scene from several different perspectives each time, absorbing more of the plotline and character details from each separate conversation.

Despite their minimalistic graphical representations, all of the characters are impressively deep, and undergo significant, often eye-opening developments as the investigation unfolds. The story gave a bit of an odd vibe, as these developments felt significant and emotional, despite the fact that you are only viewing recordings of events in the recent past - kind of like reading a history book and still crossing your fingers that things will turn out ok.

The environment, and the immersion that it creates, is top-tier. The details found on objects - anything from crushed cans to magazine covers - is lovingly made, providing reasonably realistic information for absolutely everything on the station. Every section of the station is littered with hand-placed and often deliberately meaningful details, giving the game a consistent sense of meaning and direction, and rewarding further exploration of Tacoma's small, but well-crafted areas.

All in all, Tacoma provided a genuinely wonderful story from a unique perspective, all encapsulated in a lovingly crafted, immersive sci fi environment.
 
worth
217 produits enregistrés

Évaluation publiée le 6 mars 2018
Es basicamente una pelicula interactiva en la cual vamos a ir desarrollando y descubriendo una trama a traves de nuestras acciones, las cuales van siendo progresivamente mas interesantes a medida que vamos avanzando. Realmente me pareció una mejora ♥♥♥ respecto a su anterior juego, Gone Home, que tambien es muy bueno.
En resumen, comprenlo, a pesar de su corta duracion, al final del recorrido te va a brindar una experiencia muy linda y acogedora. Y me gusta mucho apoyar a gente que hace este tipo de obras, que realmente intentan contarnos algo.

Recommandé
2.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 février 2018
It is clear that this is made by the same people who did Gone Home. In many ways it works in the same way. It is basically a walking simulator without much of "actual" gameplay. However, it strongly leans on the exploration and reading the clues that support the whole story. They clearly got a lot more money for this one than the previous, since it actually has voice acting and (woah) animated characters! Sort of.

But yeah, to make it short, it is a sci-fi story set in a spacestation. It deals in fear, relationships and politics. It clearly has a strong leftist agenda, which is good if you lean that way. I personally do. It is also not all that surprising considering how political Gone Home was.

It is very short, and you will be able to play it thoroughly in one sitting. Keep that in mind when you purchase it.
 
SamwellD

Recommandé
3.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 février 2018
This game is really good. The music, the characters, and the cat was great! As thing was starting to get intense, it was like I was in the environment. The varity of songs played in each characters quarters was so worth to listen to, expect Nat, EV singing was really great. The voice actor of her deserve a more attention for that. The personality difference between the character is too realistic, it gives it more of a modern day feel to the game. The only bad thing about this game it that it was really short, it was too short for such a good game like this. I can the see opposite side of it, it did get alittle boring after a while but it worth to finish in one sitting. I'm still a little confuse about the storyline, but alittle research wouldn't hurt. I would really recommend this game to anyone who like a calm and short storyline. (Sorry if my gammar is horrible!)

A walking-sim with an interesting mechanic to work with, and as usual, lots of attention to detail, letting you really get to know these characters intimately. At the half price I paid for it, I'm very happy with what I got. Maybe not quite as emotionally intensive as something like Gone Home or What Remains of Edith Finch, but still thoroughly enjoyable.
 
Not Legato
330 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 février 2018
This game is the game that has finally set Fullbright apart from other story-driven "walking simulator" game developers. I enjoyed Gone Home to an extent. While it had great voice acting, a moving story, and decent enviroment design, it never excelled in these areas. Not to mention it's clunkey controls, weird pacing, and a story that might scare some people away from the genre/game (I enjoyed the story, however I found it was more ambitious than what it could produce. It takes a lot to craft a story with such energy built up around it. It was a pretty simple formula, also. I think it moved me quite a bit, though, and while I find almost all of the characters either too reckless, or too ignorant to their own situation, it's the same with any story in that I won't relate with all the characters, but I get something out of it.)

Now this is starting to look like a Gone Home review, however the game acts as great context for Tacoma. Fullbright comes out of releasing Gone Home with mixed response in the press, and from the players. What do we see from this indie team? Do they crumble and pander, like other indie developers? That's honestly what I thought was going to happen, but this is what I get for assuming. Fullbright takes the bads, and works on them. They see where their limits are, and where they do really well. Let's talk about that.

Tacoma has just plain good storytelling. It's nothing too impressive, but in this current game enviroment it's really refreshing. It has a twist that, when revealed, is pretty obvious, however the immersion around the game totally threw my mind of the scent. The game does a great job of letting you know who the good guys are, who the bad guys are, and who the cat is, without forcing it down your throat. At no point does anyone go "Gee-whiz I sure am a goodie-two-shoe (did you know I am a really good person that saves orphans?) and this other stuff is really bad." Instead the characters are almost human. They have flaws, there are no Mary Sues, it's just some contractors in space doing their damn jobs. The ammount of empathy that they show is real, it's never exageratted because they don't want to think their audience is too dumb to realize the brevity of the situation. Fullbright knows that it's audience is smart enough to understand a basic story. WHY CAN'T OTHER GAME DEVELOPERS BE MORE LIKE THIS?! There is no hand holding, there is no sugar coating. I love this story.

This may be one of the first "walking simulators" that I can honestly say has amazing gameplay. Back when I thought Firewatch having the amazing feature of holding down "tab" and talking with another person was fantastic for this genre, Tacoma comes along and is like "Hey kids, ya wanna travel through time?!?!". OF COURSE I DO! Without going too far and spoiling, at the begining of the game you get a set of A.R. (augmented reality) buds that you wear that allows you to access data and see what the lives of the Tacoma crew were like before the incident that pre-dated your characters arrival. It is simple, fun, interesting, and doesn't get stale. I love it, mang.

The last issue I want to bring up with the game is the price. This is the same issue we had with Gone Home. I played this game for 4 hours, yet the game costs $20.00 full price. I'm sorry, but when you can get Gary's Mod for $10.00 and play that for 1,000 hours, then you can see how it's a bit to ask. I understand that Fullbright had the best developers and artists on this team, and that at the end of the day this is the cost of business. But somehow I feel like either the game should have been longer, or they shouldn't of asked for that much.

BUY THIS GAME, THOUGH. Either buy it full price and feel good about supporting the team (which you should), or get it on sale (perhaps it will pop up in a Humble Bundle down the road). At the end of the day, get this game.
 
The Ocky Way

덤으로 도전과제 100% 달성하기도 쉽다.

2,555 produits enregistrés

1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
1.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 février 2018
This is an extremely well put together game, though I can see why it wouldn't be some people's cup of tea.

It would be harsh to call it a "walking simulator" with the negative connotations that has, but essentially I would say it is more akin to an interactive movie.

Tacoma plays out during your investigation of a space station by way of replays of crew interaction that were recorded. Like a video you can rewind, fast forward and stop these "replays" as you follow different groups of people around, gaining insights in to their feelings and plans as the drama plays out. This is done in such a cool way to be seamless.. people will split up and meet again later and it's possible to follow them to listen and view their interactions from all angles as it all goes on around you, rewind and follow the people that split off.

I got drawn in over the first 10 - 20 minutes and played until the end in one session. I like to look at stuff and make sure not to miss anything so this apparently took me 109 minutes including the end credits.. that is I don't know if I did miss anything but I tried not to - in the beginning I did skim read some of the texts as I didn't really know what to expect from the experience.

As a value proposition is £14.99 (or your regional equivalent) worth it for lets say 2 hours of interactive entertainment? It is rather subjective but to be honest I'd rather spend it playing this, than plodding to the cinema to watch another hashed up remake of another Hollywood action drama. Buyer beware though, it is rather short.

As a Linux gamer the experience was absolutely seamless, rock solid and no issues whatsoever like dual monitors being wrongly identified or performance, it was a smooth experience from beginning to end and I'm very pleased.

Review Edit: Looking at the achievements for this it would appear I did miss a few things.

Una aventura indispensable para todo aquel amante del espacio o las IAs.

2.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 février 2018
Produit reçu gratuitement

So when I got this game through Humble Bundle I was a bit put off by it, it has a 13GB download, and the pictures weird a bit odd, the other characters represintaions made it weird. I was fully epxecting a horror game.... But what I got was quite different.

You're a worker sent to recover an A.I from this dilapitated station, and when you're onboard you discover the truth behind what happened..

I of course reccomend this game, it has great story telling, the graphics are beautiful, there's alot to interact with, it's very short though as I got through it in one sitting in about three to four hours. Would I pay 20$? If I had a better job and had that spare cash yes. If you're on a tight budget wanting something with replayability? Then I'd pick it up on a sale, as once you get through it a couple of times and see all there is to see, then you're kinda out of luck. But all in all this game was an experince, I almost cried even when a certain someone I thught was dead.
 
GhostPower
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
4.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 février 2018
So, das war's jetzt? 4 Stunden und das nur, weil ich mir wirklich die Mühe gemacht habe auch jeden Winkel mehrmals zu durchsuchen, um in einem Durchgang alles zu entdecken. Für den aufgerufenen Preis von 20€ ganz schön gewagt liebe Entwickler!

Da bin ich ja mal froh, das Spiel im Humble Monthly bekommen zu haben. ;) ich kannt es bis vor 4 Stunden noch nicht einmal, es war nur das einzige was auf anhieb meinen Spieltyp entsprach. Walking Simulator, SciFi Szenario, eine Geschichte zum selbsterleben und Weltraum. Eigentlich kann man da für mich nicht viel falsch machen...

Im Prinzip ist es auch falsch zu sagen, Tacoma habe mir nicht gefallen, bitte nicht falsch verstehen aber es bietet einfach nichts besonderes finde ich. Der einzig wirklich gute Ansatz war die Möglichkeit, jedes Besatzungsmitglied mit der vor- und rückspulen Funktion separat beobachten zu können und so die Geschichte aus allen Perspektiven zu erleben. Wäre das übrigens nicht gegeben gewesen, könnte man das komplette Spiel wohl in 30 Minuten durchspielen denn man erlebt ja jede Szene im Schnitt 3-4x aus den verschiedenen Blickwinkeln.

Die Geschichte ist außerdem nichts besonderes. Wer ein bischen angesiedelt ist in diesem Bereich und die gängisten Filme und Serien gesehen hat, dem wird relativ schnell klar, worauf alles hinauslaufen wird. Kleine Diskrepanzen ja, aber am Ende ist die Geschichte flach und hätte tatsächlich ohne Probleme, mehr hergeben können.

Von technischer Seite muss ich sagen, ich hatte einen Crash in der Spielzeit den aber das Game dank Speicherpunkt ausgeglichen hat. Die Optik hat gepasst und war eine gute Basis. Zwar finde ich es etwas befremdlich, dass man zwischen den Bereichen gefühlt ne halbe Stunde mit dem Lift fahren muss aber dann die Level des Schiffs platztechnisch sehr beengt erscheinen. Ist es nun ein riesen Klotz im All mit mehreren Gravitationsringen mit gigantischen Durchmesser oder eine 4 stöckige Hutschachtel? Das Erscheinungsbild und das Gefühl passte einfach überhaupt nicht zusammen aber natürlich - größeres Schiff muss auch gefüllt werden mit Content und daran fehlt es ja leider ohnehin im Game. Die Tatsache, dass die Crew in jedem Zimmer und jeder Kammer ihre immer gleichen Überreste von Fertignahrung hinterlässt, stößt mir auch sauer auf. Überall liegt Essen rum, wie in einem Saustall und keiner räumt es irgendwann mal weg wie es scheint. Die Möbel sind teilweise scheinbar von deren Ur Ur Großeltern geklaut worden - auf einem Raumschiff im Jahr 2088+, natürlich. Alte Modelle wiederverwendet? Glimmstengel und Bier findet man auch zur genüge in jedem Winkel rumfliegen...

UND WAS ZUM TEUFEL, gibt es in der Zukunft nur noch Homosexuelle Paare? Ein lesbisches Paar und ein schwules Paar mit Sohn, sonst kommt in dem Game von Familien nichts zum Vorschein. Wird hier zwanghaft versucht Akzeptanz zu fördern oder hatte der Entwickler ein persönliches Interesse daran? Ich bin ja wirklich kein prüder, rückständiger Kerl, der denkt Schwule oder Lesben haben in einem PC Game nix verloren aber wenn es in jeder privaten Diskussion im Game um diese gleichgeschlechtliche Liebe geht dann fragt man sich einfach "Wieso?".

Also alles in allem, wer auf diese Art Spiele genauso steht wie ich, holt es euch mal in einem Sale zwischen 5-10€ oder am besten noch günstiger bzw im Bundle. Die aufgerufenen 20€ sind in meinen Augen, für das Gebotene, eine Frechheit. Es ersetzt einen seichten Film im TV aber viel mehr auch nicht. ;)

Nächstesmal bitte wieder etwas mehr für das Geld liebe Entwickler und vergesst nicht wieder die Zeit in der ihr die Geschichte ansiedelt. Wenn man das Jahr 2088+ auswählt dann bitte auch dementsprechend den Inhalt ansiedeln, keine Zigarettenraucher, Biertrinker, Omasessel, achtlos weggeworfener Müll in jeder Ecke, Tiertrophäen an den Wänden und und und... das würde die Glaubhaftigkeit eures Szenarios schon ordentlich pushen und wenn es auch etwas steriler wirken mag - wir sind auf einem Raumschiff und müssen mit dem begrenzten Lebensraum haushalten. Man beschmutzt ja nicht das Nest in dem man sitzt als erwachsene Person auf Mission.

Empfehlenswert... mit ach und krach noch: Ja.
 
AdAstra84

hakuthebearded
653 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 janvier 2018
I like a good story exploration/ambiance exploration game. Good is always subjective, of course, so my preferences not always were similar to what I heard from others. I like Dear Esther, for example, even prefer it to Everybody’s Gone to the Rapture but was mostly really bored in Gone Home. So I wasn't really that excited for Tacoma when I first heard of it. Damn, am I glad I decided to check it out, though.

Tacoma works similarly to how story exploration games usually, work, but adds a more interactive investigative element to everything, and also establishes a rather curious multi-layered mystery to the situation. You are a person sent on board a space station that suddenly got damaged and has only a few days left of oxygen, all right as the 6 people on board were getting ready to end the year of service and look into renewing their contract. Except, things look a bit off, and perhaps there was another reason for the accident, and that is something you will be investigating while watching the Augmented Reality recordings of the events on the station, following people around and watching them cope with this situation, and their normal life relationships.

It's a pretty simple setup, really, but the game is very smart about the storytelling and portioning the story bits you investigate, and also spending a lot of time on detailing every character personality. Voice acting is on point, as is the writing, and things just work together in a very nice simple way, that helps the game being very engrossing. You'll easily remember the characters, understand why they do what they do, get intrigued in their internal conflicts and then get through the whole story until its solid, if somewhat predictable (but not in a bad way), resolution in one go. Especially since the game will most likely take you under 3 hours to complete, even if you check, watch and read everything. Which some might find disappointing, but I'd say - the game lasts exactly as long as it needs to and tells as much as it needs to, so kudos to Fullbright on not doing the common mistake of adding pointless elements to the game.

If you're into story driven adventure games or story exploration titles, I would highly recommend checking Tacoma as soon as you get a chance. If you're not - hey, it's short and is a joy to play, so please do consider checking it out anyway.
 
Kain Klarden

1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 31 décembre 2017
Fullbright's taken their storytelling to the next level. While the tale told in this one isn't quite as poignant as Gone Home, they've put a bigger budget to good use in telling an equally engaging sci-fi existential introspective with some truly inventive methods, in addition to the exploration familiar from their previous title. Reminiscent of an immerse theatre experience, the player will rewind the same scene multiple times to follow different characters through the same 2 to 10 minute time frame, and they've deftly managed to weave those multiple paths to ensure that at no point in any of those scenes do you feel as if you're sitting around waiting for anyone to do something while others are engaged in conversation in another room. Once again, the experience is a short one, but we'll worth the cost of admission, particularly if you can pick it up at a discount.
 
thecheesiestburger

0
Recommandé
4.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 décembre 2017
Eins vorneweg, dies ist ein Spiel für Freunde einer tiefgreifenden und spannenden Story. Die Story wird durch holographische Projektionen erzählt, die man beliebig vor- und zurückspulen kann. Somit ist es einem Möglich auch Einzelgespräche mitzuhören wenn man den Hologrammen nach einem Treffen folgt.

Für mich war der interessanteste Aspekt das gadankliche zusammensetzen der einzelnen Hologrammsequenzen und Informationen aus E-Mails/Chats/Brifen zum Gesamtgeschehen. Auch sehr interessant sind die Beziehungen der 6 einzelnen Personen unterinander sowie Notizen über einschneidende Erlebnisse in deren Vergangenheit.

Évaluation publiée le 15 décembre 2017
ジャンルとしては社会派SFミステリーとでもいったところ。アガサクリスティーのミステリーやコロンボのように事件を淡々と追っていくような展開が好きな人にはお勧めです。ストーリーを語らせる登場人物(とAI)の動きや会話すべてがARによる録再というところがおもしろいです。複数の登場人物のタイムラインを操作しながら謎解きをするのは骨が折れるかもしれませんが、その時点での彼らの位置を想像しながらの探索が楽しい。AIについてこれから巻き起こるであろうテーマを盛りこんだことも、よくあるSFとして終らせないような制作側の意図を感じました。

865 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 novembre 2017
Empfehlenswert: Ja (persönliche Wertung: 7/10)

Errungenschaften: Ja (Leicht zu bekommen)

Positiv:
- Spannende Story
- Schöne Grafik
- Nettes Spielprinzip

Negativ:
- Merkwürdige Steam-Erfolge
- Keine Interaktion mit anderen Charakteren

Fazit:
Tacoma ist ein Walking Simulator im Weltraum. Dein Auftrag ist es die KI einer Raumstation zu bergen, dabei sieht man sich Aufzeichnungen der sechs Besatzungsmitglieder an, welche in den Raum projeziert werden. Nach und nach erfährt man mehr über ihr Leben und ihren Alltag auf der Station. Das schöne daran ist, das nicht nur die spannende Geschichte über die Kollision erzählt wird, sondern auch persönliche Werte, Ziele und Ängste der Crewmitglieder. Dadurch entstehen Symphatien/ Antiphatien für die einzelnen Charaktere, was auch Ziel des Spieles ist. Grafisch ist das Spiel schön anzusehen, auch wenn mir die projezierten "Männchen" persönlich zu klobig waren. Einige kleine Nebenaufgaben gibt es schon in Form der Steam-Errungenschaften. Es machte Spaß diese zu suchen (z.B. Die Katzen), obwohl es die Sache mit dem Schädel und dem Basketballkorb ein wenig merkwürdig war... Nichtsdestotrotz habe ich 3 Stunden in einer schönen virtuellen Welt verbracht und kann nur sagen: Empfehlenswert für jeden der es mal ruhig angehen möchte!!!!
 
Rain
777 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 aout 2017
I just finished Tacoma minutes ago. I was really unsure where the plot was truly going until the last 15ish minutes of play and I'm glad to say that it's another solid title by the creators of Gone Home.

Lacking the generally scary vibe that Gone Home had and instead trading it for an isolated, lonely trip aboard an apparently abandoned space station, Tacoma manages to tell a much fuller story (although I love both games equally) and skillfully misdirects the player various times into thinking that the game's goal is something that it isn't.

Tacoma has fairly interesting characters and I'd say that Fullbright learned some lessons from Gone Home (like less backtracking and better clarity of goals) and has a plot which evolves to be pretty rewarding.

3.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 octobre 2017
I absolutely loved this game and finished in all in a single night. Like Gone Home, this isn't a traditional game, but I'd argue it isn't a simple as a "walking simulator" either. The game allows for multiple levels of investigation, and this means its up to the player to choose how much and how deeply they want to investigate each room.

If you like mysteries and you like the "a ha" feeling that comes from finally putting puzzles together, this is the game for you. If you want excitement, maybe not.

Évaluation publiée le 14 octobre 2017
Fantastic game! Immersive experience. I got five hours of captivating gameplay and some surprises from it. Its way of storytelling reminded me of Her Story; the way of figuring out what happened by watching recordings, putting the plot together piece by piece. I loved to snoop around the crew's belongings, learning about them and their motivations.
If you care about "replay value" - there isn't much, once you gather all the recordings, read all the messages, and find the station's cat in every scene.
If you are interested in games with a story to tell - warmly recommended.

0
Non recommandé
2.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 aout 2017
Une grande déception. Je suis fan des expériences narratives mais je ne peux vraiment pas recommander et défendre ce jeu.

Pour le meilleur, Tacoma est beau esthétiquement et le voice-acting, l'écriture des dialogues/personnages a le mérite d'être fin et réaliste. Le problème c'est que l'expérience globale ne laisse absolument aucun goût.

L'histoire qui dans les grandes lignes parait intéressante, est trop courte pour qu'on ait la moindre implication émotionnelle, la moindre suspicion vis à vis des véritables tenants et aboutissants. L'aventure se présente sous forme d'enquête au sein d'une station spatiale qui fut habité. La grande trouvaille du titre c'est les hologrammes de l'équipage qu'on va devoir suivre, écouter pour comprendre petit à petit la trame. On peut rembobinner, accélérer, voir la même scène sous un autre angle.
Sur le papier ça a l'air génial, mais concrètement c'est superficiel et sous exploité.

Les mécaniques de gameplay sont quasi-nulles et ces gimmicks n'apportent finalement rien à part détruire toute tension dramatique qui était déjà trop absente. Je m'explique : Il n'y a pas de personnage principal, il y a un danger menaçant le groupe qui cherche une solution, mais tout cela est raconté avec une certaine platitude et de manière très terre à terre.
On va pouvoir se balader dans les chambres de chacun pour comprendre un peu leur personnalité, mais on se rend compte que ça n'apporte rien car il n'a quasiment rien à faire dedans. Aucune enigme ou puzzle caché dans le jeu, tout est indiqué à l'avance. Il suffit d'activer tous les hologrammes pour aller à l'étage suivant... Pas non la place pour l'imagination car la plupart des problèmes sont résolus dans l'instant quand ils sont pas simplement non intéractifs...

Bref, je pourrais parler longtemps de ce qui fonctionne pas dans l'écriture et la conception du jeu, mais ça serait de l'acharnement. Tacoma est un jeu avec des nobles intentions sur le fond comme sur la forme, mais c'est profondément raté et bâclé. Pas d'émotion, pas de tension, pas de densité nécessaire pour rendre le récit marquant, pas de vraie intéractivité et de réfléxion demandé au joueur, pas d'approfondissement de ses thématiques. On ressort de là avec l'impression d'avoir mâché de l'air, d'avoir lu le premier jet d'un pitch de film. Et même si c'était effectivement un pitch de film, ça manquerait trop d'ambition pour transformer l'idée de base en récit palpitant.

Qu'importe votre curiosité, ne payez jamais plus de 10 euros pour ce jeu. Préférez Her Story ou What Remains of Edith Finch.

3.5/10
 
Fab

Итак.
Такома... Великолепная ходилка, которая на одном дыхании была пройдена. Что в итоге? Наверное, я бы советовал для прохождения каждому человеку, который хотя бы раз в жизни замечал за собой смену настроения от просмотренного фильма или пройденной игры, прочитанной книги, который переживал за главного героя или второстепенных персонажей. С любовью Ваш Cat_Racoon и команда #Ncorp .

+ C'est beau.
+ Histoire sympa.
+ Succès faciles à avoir.

Les - :
- Durée de vie ridicule.
- Sitôt fini, sitôt oublié.
- Beaucoup trop cher (16€99)

Désolé pour ceux qui diront que je n'ai pas su saisir la teneur du titre, j'ai déjà joué à des jeux dits "narratifs" que j'ai réussi à aimer (Le suicide de Rachel Foster, To the Moon et sa suite entre autres) mais là c'est vraiment trop court et je n'ai pas réussi à "être dans l'ambiance", bref, non pour moi !

0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 aout 2017
As a huge fan of Gone Home, I've been eagerly awaiting this game since it was first announced. It's hard to imagine that I wouldn't like it, simply because what Fullbright is doing is so unique in the gaming space, rivaled only perhaps by The Chinese Room. In fact, this game did give me a lot of the same vibes as Everybody's Gone to the Rapture--which is a good thing, in my opinion. Like Rapture, the story is revealed through a series of flashbacks, which slowly piece together a narrative of what ensued in the final days before the player character arrived. And likewise, the visuals, sound effects, and music created a stunning sense of place, often bearing an even greater emotional impact than the story itself. Though of course the story was fantastic.

My only gripe is that the story ending does seem rather abrupt, maybe even a tad anti-climactic (though not entirely). I felt the same about Gone Home. Nonetheless, there's something to be said for defying expectations, and to me, that makes up for it. Fullbright does an amazing job of building tension and then--as a parent comforting a child--gently reminding you that not every situation is as hopeless as it seems. There's an odd reassurance in that.

Is the game short? Well, yeah, of course I'd love to see more of the amazing setting and get know more about the fascinating characters. But that doesn't make the existing experience any less valuable. Games with this level of detailed, immersive, heartfelt storytelling are so rare that the cost seems almost irrelevant. I can't recommend this game enough.
 
novanima
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 23 novembre 2017
Tacoma is the not-at-all related followup to the critically acclaimed Gone Home and Fullbright's second game. The sophomore game stereotypes suffer the same problems as a sophomore album from a band. Can they repeat success? Will they try to strike out in a different direction and potentially lose their fans with a bold change, or will they try to recapture and build upon the success of their first release? In Tacoma, you will find less of the former and more of the latter.

You are Amy Ferrier, a contractor for Venturis Corporation. Your task is to retrieve the AI named ODIN from Lunar Transfer Station Tacoma. While you're there, you can also learn the fates of the crew who are mysteriously absent. It doesn't take long to find out that a disaster aboard Tacoma is the cause of their disappearance.

Playing Tacoma is going to feel extremely familiar to fans of Gone Home. You're in space, on a space station, but you're still largely picking through other people's stuff and listening to their stories as you collect data on ODIN. The mechanical twist to Tacoma is that the stories are told mostly through wireframe mannequins of the crew presented in an alternate reality (AR) interface. ODIN was recording these scenes and allows you to view some of them. You can fast-forward, rewind, interact with physical objects and AR interfaces as you follow the crew through these scenes. The way these scenes play out is easily the most natural feeling presentation of video game cutscenes I've ever seen. A scene may start with half of the crew present, but some will walk in, others will walk out, and you can follow them through the scene to catch different conversations. It's really cool to watch in motion, and allows the game to present multiple storylines in an extremely seamless way.

Tacoma is packed with little side stories. If you were to solely follow the AR scenes or watch them only once, you'd absolutely get the gist of the main plot. However, in almost every drawer there's highly detailed notebook or tablet full of details that make Lunar Transfer Station Tacoma a place in the world, and make the wireframe cutouts into people. Tacoma accomplishes an incredible task of humanizing a seven person crew, in a video game, in a short amount of time.

The short play time is what will cause the most heartache for people. Like Gone Home, my personal playtime with Tacoma clocked in at a brief two and a half hours. I'm thorough too; I watched every AR cutscene multiple times to follow all of the characters in each scene, I read every AR interface, and I unlocked every locked door. A speedrun of Tacoma would only be limited to the amount of time it takes to watch each AR scene once, which is likely far less than 30 minutes total. If the short playtime doesn't discourage you, looking for anything more than a futuristic, AR-enhanced version of Gone Home might also bring disappointment. Make no mistake, for better or worse, Tacoma is very much a product of the team that made Gone Home. It didn't suddenly turn into System Shock or The Walking Dead. The puzzles to be solved are simple, and there is almost zero player input. In some ways, Tacoma would almost entirely complete itself without the player. In fact, you don't even need to watch the AR scenes. You can accomplish your mission by watching slow moving progress bars fill in over the course of three hours.

But you should watch those AR scenes, and interact with the objects around you, and get attached to these very human characters. Tacoma has some of the finest video game storytelling you will ever find. Just don't go looking for something more than that, because you won't find it. Tacoma is excellent, but it rides on the shoulders of Gone Home.
 
emnii
2,625 produits enregistrés

207 produits enregistrés
