4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
2.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 9 avril 2018
6/10

As was likely the case for many players, I was very excited to try Tacoma after playing Gone Home, the previous game by this studio. After the reviews began to trickle in, it was clear that this was perhaps not the masterpiece that the previous game was. However, I still wanted to play it, just perhaps without the sense of urgency I had previously felt. Perhaps those reviewers didn't "get it." I felt sure that I would. In addition, the game likely has newfound relevance in the aftermath of the death of a female pedestrian at the "hands" of an automated Uber vechicle (3/18/18).

The game makes a good impression. I loved exploring the ship, getting to know the details of these characters' lives. The central mechanic in the game is the use of an augmented reality overlay to watch past events. You will enter an area, and then be clued in to the fact that there is a AR record of an event that took place there. You can download the record, and then watch the event play out in real time with the bodies of crew members represented by colored holograms. These spaces are often large, and you may need to rewind and play the memory multiple times to catch the dialogue of characters that wander in different directions. In addition, crew members will sometimes access their own personal computer overlays, and you can interact with these overlays through AR to see what they were looking at.

I wondered, as I played, what role I would have in this tale. When you board the Tacoma, there are no longer any crew members on board. Will I relay the events I've witnessed in the AR memories to my superiors? To whom could I report any malfeasance?

Although it is difficult to speak about the game's conclusion without spoilers, I found that (at least in my view) my role was entirely insignificant. It is entirely possible, and perhaps probable (since so many likely contributed to the development and playtesting of this game), that I was supposed to make a mental and emotional leap in the way that I made sense of my role in the story. However, I was unable to make this leap, despite seeing details in the story that were designed to aid me along this path. It is unfortunate, since I enjoyed the majority of my time with the game, but I just can't recommend the title without feeling that my time with the game added up to anything.
 
frontman12
660 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 octobre 2018
It felt liberating to play a walking simulator that doesn't try to build suspense. The usual WS aspects were all there: an abandoned scene, the traces of its inhabitants, and a way to look into their past interactions. Still, contrary to most other games in this genre, Tacoma is not afraid to label itself as a pure walking simulator. It doesn't dilute the story with horror game features, like Gone Home, Ethan Carter, or SOMA, but lets the player know that they are safe, that they're not on a clock, and that they can enjoy their stay. The ability to rewind, pause, and play back the events on the station adds to this relaxed feeling, since you can watch it as many times as you want, from any perspective. I personally appreciate this type of gameplay very much.

As expected, the writing was the best part. The futuristic world it portrays is both convincing and intriguing, as were the characters and their motivations. I think it's already quite an achievement to build such an immersion in only 3 hours of gameplay, but combined with the story (which, too, was realistic and imaginative) Tacoma managed to completely pull me into its world. The often challenging balance between realism and fantasy was just right.

Frankly, I cannot think of a single bad aspect. Some may say it was too short, or there wasn't enough gameplay, but this happens to be what I was looking for. It also isn't exactly a moving or sentimental story, but not all narratives have to evoke emotions. All in all, Tacoma is a perfect choice for a lazy Sunday afternoon. 8/10
 
Jornam

Évaluation publiée le 1 avril 2020
Короткий (буквально на пару часов) и довольно типичный симулятор ходьбы, чем-то напоминающий "ADR1FT". С точки зрения сюжетной линии особо ничего нового: орбитальная станция Такома, потерпевшая крушение, и протагонист Эми, засланная корпорацией извлечь все данные станционного искуственного интеллекта. Параллельно Эми восстанавливает хронологию и детали произошедших событий по обрывкам AR-записей разговоров экипажа. Однако, несмотря на такую по нынешним временам заурядность, история развивается интересно и даже в какой-то степени неожиданно. Разработчики вовремя смогли понять, когда незамысловатый геймплей становится репетативным и скучным, и в самый нужный момент запустили развязку. Плюс, визуально игра выглядит весьма и весьма приятно.

Évaluation publiée le 3 janvier 2018
Tacoma is a thoroughly incredible experience. It's narrative is made stronger with its focus on a small, but memorable cast during a very short period of time, and while you experience this narrative from a fairly passive perspective, it never feels so with the way in which you can pore over the various scenes you investigate, rewinding to catch things from different angles, listening in on whispered conversations, and peeking into personal emails are all great outlets into these characters lives that draw you deeper into its world. While it was a bit on the short side, its airtight focus and intriguing setting made it all worth it.

While it's not a long game (it took me just under 5 hours to complete the story, then finish up the achievements), but that also means there's no filler. Well worth buying A) if you either loved everything about Gone Home, or B) if you enjoyed exploring the house, but couldn't get into the story *and* you're into science fiction. If you hated everything about Gone Home, I doubt Tacoma will convince you to love mostly-linear exploration games.

andiznit
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
6.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 aout 2017
Tacoma is the latest space disaster tale from Fullbright, the company behind Gone Home. Those looking for an experience with more interaction than the team's last game should look elsewhere. Tacoma is very much in the same vein as its predecessor. The game follows Amy Ferrier, a contractor sent to an abandoned space station in order to collect its central AI. Along the way Amy encounters fragments of recorded AR recordings and begins to piece together what happened on the station. These AR segments are what make up the core of the game and its most compelling feature. Most areas of the station have a central event that the other characters experience and it is up to the player to follow them as they go about their business, occasionally intersecting with the others and slowly fleshing out the situation. Its a novel mechanic but unfortunately the rest of the story-telling isn't always as strong. Much of the world-building is done with loads of emails, texts, and letters spread throughout the space station. Its these moments when the game hits a bit of a lull, even with its relatively short run time. Overall, its highs outshine its lows and Tacoma is still worth seeing. For more information, check out the VIDEO REVIEW:

Vidéo YouTube™: Video Review - Tacoma 
Vues : 91
Video Review for Tacoma Developer: Fullbright Release: August 1, 2017 Music: Kevin MacLeod - I Knew a Guy (http://freemusicarchive.org/music/Kevin_MacLeod/Jazz_Sampler/I_Knew_a_Guy_1821) Website:...
 
Lowered Hexpectations
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
3.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 31 décembre 2017
Tacoma é um jogo que se passa em uma base espacial que antes era habitada por 6 pessoas com o objetivo de ajudar uma empresa. A protagonista do game é escolhida para descobrir o que aconteceu antes de um desastre que força as pessoas a saírem da área por falta de oxigênio.

O jogo cria muitas expectativas no trailer e aparenta ser um excelente “walking simulator”. De fato, o jogo se sai bem em seu conceito, onde o player deve andar pelo mapa e desvendar a história das personagens que antes ali viviam. Durante o jogo várias frustrações vão aparecendo e com isso a vontade de continuar jogando vai diminuindo aos poucos. Dentre as várias frustrações temos:
• Tempo de gameplay muito curto, podendo zerar o jogo em 1h:30m/2hrs
• Em consequência do curto tempo de gameplay, o jogo parece te apressar em alguns pontos, querendo que você termine logo ele e tirando um pouco a ideia de explorar a vontade.
• O final é algo muito rápido, um pouco mal explicado e que dá a impressão que foi feito de qualquer jeito só para ser entregue.

Mesmo tendo seus pontos negativos não posso sacrificar por total o jogo que tem sim seus pontos positivos, podendo ser citados a ideia do jogo de explorar para entender melhor o que se passa na história e o seu estilo para descobrir melhor a vida das personagens antes de estarem ali, deixando um pouco mais claro cada um dos tripulantes.
Pelo hype que eu tinha em cima do jogo, ele me decepcionou perdendo um pouco do brilho do próprio jogo. O preço cobrado pelo tempo de gameplay é extremamente caro, não valendo a pena o custo/benefício.
Só pelo trailer eu recomendaria sem pensar duas vezes, mas após ter jogado, não recomendo. O jogo não vale o preço cobrado.

Nota: 4,5/10
 
pedro_it

Recommandé
1.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 avril 2019
Produit reçu gratuitement

I received Tacoma for free during a Humble Bundle last year.

The story is pretty good, and I enjoyed getting to know each of the crew based on the logs that are left in the Tacoma station, and it provided ample twists and turns that I enjoyed.

I would not buy this game at full price, however, because it was a relatively short game. I sat down for one evening and got it done within 2 hours. Wait for the game to go on Humble Bundle again or something before you jump on it, as it is a very cool experience to be a part of.

Non recommandé
3.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 9 mai 2019
Игровой процесс:
1) Иди в локацию №1, скачай данные и посмотри голограммы.
2) Иди в локацию №2, скачай данные и посмотри голограммы.
3) Иди в локацию №3, скачай данные и посмотри голограммы.
4) Забери с собой чип и улетай.
КОНЕЦ ИГРЫ!
Графика - полный кошмар! Игровой процесс - скучнее не придумаешь!
Читаю положительные отзывы об этой игре и смеюсь. Люди накрутили положительный рейтинг у игры из-за, типа, "хорошего сюжета и атмосферности". ОКСТИТЕСЬ!!!!!!
Перед нами совершенно мега-банальная история о космической аварии, о том, что бабки правят миром, и о том, что искусственный интеллект бывает честнее человеческого. "Окунаться с головой" в скучнейшую историю, герои которой предстают расплывчатыми пятнами голограмм, никак не получается.
Как же любят сейчас ставить приставку "инди" для игр, которые не примечательны ничем, кроме грошового бюджета. )))
И ведь при этом игра стоит полновесные 419р. Скажете, что мало??? Ха-ха!!!! Игра проходится за 3 часа!!!! Всего 3 часа, Карл!
Сравним...
Tacoma - 419р., прошел за 3 часа => 140р/час
The Witcher 3 в редакции "Игра года" - 1500р., провел в ней 269часов => 5,57р./час
Divinity: Original Sin 2 - 479р.(со скидкой), провел в ней рекордные 433часа => 1,1р./час
Жалею лишь о том, что не начал играть в Такому сразу после покупки. Чтоб пройти ее и без зазрения совести сразу оформить возврат денег.
 
YasenPepper
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
1.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 octobre 2023
Etwas habe ich mir erhofft beim kauf von Tacoma, als ich das menübild gesehen habe was Schwarz war. Wusste ich dass es Schrott wird und als ich erfuhr dass es der selbe Produzent von "Gone Home" war, hat es alles erklärt.

Die Übersetzung ist nicht vollstandig in Deutsch, keinen Übersetzten Untertitel.
Die vermeintliche Story von der Ehemaligen Besatzung die durch Meteoriteneinschläge das Schiff verlassen musste. Ist ziemlich lahm. Es gibst nicht wirklich viel in der "Welt" zu entdecken.

19,50 € ist eine Schande, selbst im Sale ist es zu viel verlangt.
Ich rate dringend ab und spart euch die Zeit und das Geld.

Évaluation publiée le 6 aout 2017
Produit remboursé

A short, sweet, polished as hell story driven game that kept me engaged throughout. Steve Gaynor and his folks at Fullbright really know how to tell a story in a way that is new and unique. Well worth the wait!
 
ABoltron
154 produits enregistrés
0
8 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
6.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 aout 2020
· 难得一见的治愈游戏！
· AI控的天堂，强推。（是时候找个AI当男朋友\女朋友了）
· 游戏流程很短，内容很充实，运气好熟练的话40分钟通关，全程摸索下来大概在2个小时左右。
· 女主角的AI太萌了。好想拥有！！！（曾经一直觉得萌软AI是废宅的YY……真香）
· 切换地图时间有点长……


【以下涉及完整剧透慎入】


这是一款在冷酷背景下，凸显“人性”温柔的作品。这里“人性”指的并不单单是人类物种所具备的道德价值观，而更适用于解读做智慧生命们具备的善良共性。

首先，游戏是HE，非常治愈。早就厌烦了黑深残才能体现深度和人性的套路，不死几个人都“不符合现实”，这样对现实的理解未免过于浅显和片面。这款游戏能够给予一个如此温柔的结局，从剧情体验角度我给高分。毕竟玩游戏为的是娱乐，心情好赛高！

主角以雇佣兵的身份去回收空间站所有者——Venturis公司的人工智能AI奥丁，在恢复数据的过程中我们逐渐接触到一个“意外”背后的阴谋。

游戏里有趣的不仅仅是人与人之间的故事，更有趣的是AI之间的性格差异。甚至背后除去人类之间的内斗，还涉及了AI与人类的复杂关系，AI与AI之间的复杂关系（此处游戏内并没有延展，但可以通过法案和主人公们的反应进行推断）。

【主线故事】

世界背景设定在AI兴盛、人力成本增加的时代，Venturis公司是一个善用AI的大型财团，在公司经济层面的决策AI朱诺（算刺客信条彩蛋吗，加上这款游戏，我对这个名字已经生理性反胃了）运筹下，想要以人工智能完全取代人类运行空间站的法案通过，就需要制造一些小小的“意外”，比如非人为失误情况下空间站人员的全体死亡。

于是，塔科马空间站被选定成为最佳“意外”实施地点，毕竟内部6个成员如果死亡，社会影响力和后续的麻烦综合判断而言，是性价比最高的。

因此，一开始，这场“缺氧”的灾难就是一个圈套，Venturis公司设下的局。而为了让这个局面更加真实，他们做了个错误的决定——那就是把参与布置圈套的塔科马空间站AI奥丁也算计了进去。

公司用最高权限强行要求奥丁执行氧气罐爆破，伪造数据并伪装成小行星碎片撞击，屏蔽船员外部通讯，在空间站氧气不足的情况下，确保船员进入冷冻休眠舱。

奥丁对此提出质疑，认为会威胁到船员们的生命安全，但总部以“会立刻派出救援”的讯息，从逻辑角度欺骗奥丁，并开始全程监视奥丁。

因此奥丁在不了解背后真实目的情况下，被迫执行最高指令。但当奥丁接到了救援飞船被取消的指令后，他已经觉察到不对了，开始顺藤摸瓜，发现了大量黑幕并通过联讯挖掘到了公司总裁瑟吉欧·文图里，为几个小时后即将死亡的船员们录制的讣告演讲录屏，让这场以杀戮来达到经济目标的阴谋完全浮于水面。他虽然无法绕过最高权限，但可以引导自己的朋友——医生萨拉去核心区直接查看自己收集到的全部证据，并且让她向外发布求救讯息。

最终，Venturis公司的竞争对手迅速前来救援，其他已经进入冷冻休眠舱的船员也因为冷冻时间短暂，而没有出现意外，在离开前，面对奥丁可能被回收重置的残酷命运，医生萨拉联系了一个在剧情里多次出现的重要角色迷狗。

于是大结局，一路上看似严格按照Venturis公司要求一丝不苟回收奥丁数据的女主艾米，面不改色地把奥丁带回自己温馨的小飞船，并告知奥丁，由于他的选择和举动，AI解放前线组织识别他为有知觉的意识体，承认他拥有生命，值得尊重与保护，因为他现在处境极为危险，因此为他提供避难。

最后，所有该救的人，都被救齐了。

当然，为了防止接下来的危险，船员们可能得先去木星旅行一趟了。

【人物关系】

女主的身份一开始就留下了伏笔，比如与她关系亲密友好的飞船AI米妮，充满趣味的飞船，风格可爱的数据硬盘收集器……作为一个转包过来做任务的雇佣兵，她对AI的态度过于友好。

女主非常谨慎，分寸把握极好。在飞船上，仍处于Venturis公司监控状态下，她没有任何语言互动和可能暴露自己态度的行为。因此不到结局没有人能猜到她其实是来截胡奥丁的。

看到奥丁成功载入飞船后，女主安心般长松了一口气，而奥丁答应接受救助后，女主带着开心笑意的回应……这些小细节都十分可爱，让女主从一个看客变得鲜活起来。作为AI解放前线的执行人员，这种类似虎口夺食的工作显然很危险，她是个合格的特工，同样也是个善良的人。

游戏里的船员们个性鲜明且真实，在灾难到来的时候，符合经过遴选加入到这份工作中的精英身份，呈现出一个心智健全的成年人应有的担当和责任，没有人可以平静面对死亡，也没有人不自私，但他们依然可以有尊严有勇气地去承担自己的责任。

具体角色关系就不赘述了，可以自己观看他们的邮件、对话了解。但不得不说有些小故事很好玩，比如儿子吐槽老爹那可以把人眼睛闪瞎的光头，老爹愤怒的感叹号……比如绝境下两个人的相拥，牵手……

奥丁与船员们的关系则更有趣，通过对话可以看出，船员们对奥丁的态度十分友好，不介意经常用他开玩笑，完全接纳他成为小组中的一份子。而医生萨拉的关系和奥丁更为亲密，算是无话不谈的密友，甚至奥丁还会和她抱怨自己曾经失败的社交经验（非常搞笑）。奥丁在绝境中给予了萨拉非常大的支持和帮助，而且最终为了空间站里的朋友们，选择对抗指令并独自面对“死亡”。而他的朋友也没有放弃他，这是个相互拯救的故事。

奥丁提到过Venturis禁止两个AI见面，因为公司恐惧不可控的情形出现——总裁瑟吉欧·文图里看似信赖AI，实则只信赖自己，信赖金钱。他才是全程否定“人性”的冷酷反派。但另一方面，提出任务执行方案的公司总部执行AI朱诺的态度又十分模糊了，一方面他支持对人类的杀戮以换取经济效益，一方面又让AI获得了更大的权益，表面公式化的冷酷逻辑下恐怕隐藏着更深的恶意，毕竟这是个AI具备无限衍化的时代。

会被追责的是瑟吉欧·文图里，那么朱诺呢？我至今记得女主离开飞船前，朱诺跳过公司转接人权限，直接出现在女主面前进行威胁的讯息。无声无息的战场显然已经开始很久了，AI解放前线肯定不是一帆风顺。期待飞船上奥丁与米妮的交流。

在此，感谢这款游戏，给与的感动。
 
Hisao

Für Leute, die story-driven Games sehr mögen und über einige Konklusionsfehler hinwegsehen können, ganz akzeptabel.

Golden
836 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
6.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 mars 2020
Короткая история про то, как злобные корпорации играют человеческими жизнями посредством ИИ. Звучит заманчиво и интригующе, но на деле всё не так круто. Увы.

Несмотря на серьёзную заявку, здесь нет ни гнетущей таинственной атмосферы покинутой космической станции, ни неожиданных поворотов событий, ни глубокого сюжета - это простая ходилка, где нам нужно слушать чужие разговоры, посредством которых раскрываются характеры персонажей и объясняется, что произошло незадолго до нашего прибытия.
Ещё к недостаткам можно отнести то, что игра короткая. За 6 часов я прошла её ДВАЖДЫ. Мне кажется, что для игры, которая стоит 419 деревянных без скидки, это непростительно мало. Плюс ко всему в конце нас ждёт весьма банальная концовка. Вот будь их хотя бы две...

Положительные моменты: почти все предметы можно потрогать и пощупать, записки можно прочитать (текста немало). Также весьма приятная музыка и графоний. В общем, всё, что касается окружения, сделано на весьма хорошем уровне. Хотя мы и проводим на станции мало времени, персонажи вполне раскрываются, их имена и истории запоминаешь. В минусы я записала отсутствие гнетущей и таинственной атмосферы, но в то же время это и плюс, т.к. игра явно нацелена на, эм, расслабление какое-то, что ли? Она лёгкая, ненапряжная, неторопливая, ты просто ходишь и смотришь, как жили люди. В этом есть своё очарование.

Из спорных моментов, которые мне не мешали, но у кого-то могут вызвать внутренние противоречия, пожалуй, можно отметить тему разного рода меньшинств. Она висит огромным красным флагом :)

Вердикт: у Такомы огромный потенциал, но разрабы, увы, не дотянули. Но. При всём при этом игра и не плохая. Крепкий середнячок. В общем, брать её любителям жанра, определённо, стоит, но только с большой скидкой.
 
AnRouwell
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 février 2019
What an incredibly thoughtful and profound game! I would love to explore more of the universe they've built. They've managed to create some truly original ways and plausible potential futures AI, among of other things.

In the end this is my favorite type of sci-fi.
 
sloan2
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 février 2019
Gerade durchgespielt, nachdem es fast zwei Jahre in meiner Library verstaubte.
Das Spiel ist OK. Es ist nicht so gut wie Gone Home, hat aber seine eigenen Stärken. Das Wiedergabe&Rückspul-feature ist das Highlight des Spiels, sowie die Station an sich.
Bezüglich der Story habe ich schon befürchtet, dass es Richtung 2001: Odyssee im Weltraum geht. Das ist zum Glück nicht der Fall, aber es gibt Parallelen. Zum Spannungsbogen muss man leider sagen, dass es für mich keine Höhen und Tiefen gab. Obwohl man durchaus mehr aus dem Setting hätte machen können. Die Geschichte war ziemlich trocken erzählt. Dadurch ist der emotionale Payoff am Ende leider ziemlich schwach. Das Spiel konnte keinen wirklichen Spannungsbogen erzeugen. Neugier hatte ich aber allemal.
Die Wertungen sind viel zu hoch, 7 Punkte wären angemessen gewesen.
Dennoch gibts einen Daumen hoch!
 
Ganslinger

Recommandé
7.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 juillet 2018
Produit reçu gratuitement

One of the most immersive games I've played.

Also one of the first games I played that required 6 GB of VRAM. The high res textures on WQHD, the light effects, the photogrammetry-like items, the credible environment and the high quality voice acting all contribute to a 4 hour long exploration of a space station and its stories.

Felt like playing a VR game without VR headset. This is the quality I expect of future games. Of course a higher quantity of playtime could help.

I give this 0451/10.

Évaluation publiée le 6 mars 2018
Aside from the fact that this game is about 20€ for approx 1,5h of playtime on a normal run and about 3 hours on a full run it is quite beautiful.

Using augmented reality you relive the fate of the crew of a space station. The interesting part comes for me that you have to listen to every segment multiple times from another corner of the room to get the part of every person, quite interesting.

I think if build out a little farther and maybe add some variety this AR thing could become more often.

Finised in 100 minutes with a normal playthrough. Go get it when it is on sale again.

I only wish these kinds of games didn't take so very long to produce, so that I'd have more of them to play.

I thoroughly enjoyed unfolding this quiet, thoughtful story and coming to know its cast of very human characters. Equal parts charmed and terrified by its vision of the future.

And that would be enough, but it's also managed to send all the right people into apopleptic fits of bigot rage, and frankly that's the cherry on top.

It is short but intricately detailed, and yes, $20. It's worth $20. It's an indie developer, just pay the $20.

3.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 23 septembre 2017
The developers did a good job crafting this story; it didn't take long at all for me to start caring about the crew members. The environment was nicely immersive as well; really scratches the "space" itch. It's important to note that this is a "interactive narrative", so if you're expecting to make choices, revise that expectation. What you can expect is an explorative experience into the characters' lives & struggles that border on the voyeuristic (though it is not at all explicit.)

Recommandé
2.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 aout 2017
I'm a fan of walking sims. I love games that take their stories seriously. In terms of the genre, I would put this in the same tier as Dear Esther. It has about the same staying power I would argue. That is to say, it is very compelling and unique. It's nothing amazing, but if you're a fan of the genre or if you think the setting is interesting, I would definitely recommend buying. Although maybe wait until the price goes down a bit. I would've priced this game closer to 10 USD. That being said, Fullbright really put a lot of work into this one, even if it is quite short (2.4 hours after some decent exploration).

Très très bon jeu narratif !
L'histoire est moins prenante que celle de Gone Home, car dans ce dernier, tout se joue autour d'un seul personnage et de sa psyché.
Ici, l'histoire se concentre sur un groupe de personnages et sur une situation tendue.

Néanmoins, j'apprécie énormément l'univers et le côté anticipation.
Graphiquement, c'est aussi très beau et niveau gameplay, le système de surveillance rajoute plus "d'action" que dans Gone Home.

ohnomelon

Recommandé
19.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 décembre 2021
A personal favorite.

So good. In Tacoma, you're a contractor who's been hired to recover the AI module from an abandoned space station. This is one of those games where you'll get out of it what you put into it. If all you care about is finishing the game, I don't think you'll get much out of it. The real opportunity, what the game really wants you to to, is to learn about the people who lived there and to discover why the space station was abandoned. If you're naturally curious, this game will feed your curiosity.
 
BlivetWidget
546 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 septembre 2017
Tacoma is a fantastic little indie title you can knock over in a few hours, in which, if you're like me, you'll spend invarious states of enthrallment as you piece together the story of Lunar Station Tacoma and it's six inhabitants. This is what Fullbright does best - telling story through environment and exploration, in an order entirely determined by the player. How you discover the end is up to you. While the writing is lovely and at times genuinely hilarious, the story doesn't pack as much of an emotional punch as Gone Home, but perhaps it doesn't need to. The game's mechanics and thoughtful construction speak for themselves. Gone Home and Tacoma are two very different games, and although they beg comparison, suffice it to say that Tacoma can stand proudly and strongly on it's own two feet as a title full of innovation and authentic design - and one that is absolutely worth playing.
 
C_Walshie
412 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
7.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 aout 2017
As you walk your way though the story, uncovering information and piecing together the truth, the attention to detail in this futuristic world is wonderful. Many reviews complain the game is too short, but I wonder if they even attempted to discover the weight of the game's message. If you play it in two hours you will only scratch the surface and get the basic plot, which is fine... if what you want to do is "beat a game".

Tacoma encourages the user to explore just like Gone Home. At times it feels a bit voyeuristic watching the crew go through some very traumatic and frightening experiences. There are also some very sweet and intimate moments. You learn so much about these people in such little time; their fears and desires. I really appreciate Fullbright's perspective and that they have a real story to tell. The philosophies on sentience, humanity, capitalism, and where they colide... all too real and what feels like what will be major issues in the future.

But enough of this navel gazing.

Pros:
-Story is interesting and kept me thinking long after I had finished the game
-Voice actors are superb (Sareh is my personal favorite)
-Gameplay is interesting and engaging
-Graphics and art style are neat (I love the attention to detail, everything feels lived in and believable/functional)
-Music (what little there is) is nice
-Characters are diverse; different races, religions, and sexual orientations.

-Maybe only cool to me: use of sign language!

♥♥♥♥:
-"Too short", But really if you look at everything, not really. I do wish it was longer, but I would also love to see a Tacoma 2 as well to find out what happens next!
-Load times. When traveling between hubs sometimes I would be in that tube FOREVER listening to that guitar ditty... but then on the way back it took half the time. :P
 
Melkbeg
0
7 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 octobre 2019
Ну что ж, историй про космические станции, ИИ и загадочные аварии — немало. Обычно, правда, в этом жанре встречаются хорроры-шутеры, и «мягкий» детектив типа «Takoma», где за всю игру ни разу не придется от кого-либо бегать — редкость.
Вот и прилетели... 
Une capture d'écran de Tacoma
Par : Аннаэйра

Посмотрим, что вышло?
Творческая и креативная страница Куратора YroMIR ReviewS ждет вас. Подпишитесь! Поддержите качество на просторах Steam. Приятного ознакомления!
ПЛЮСЫ

В процессе игры нам то и дело придется совать нос в чужую переписку. 
Une capture d'écran de Tacoma
Par : Аннаэйра

  • Внимание к деталям. Видно, что разработчики постарались каждому из своих героев придать индивидуальность, так что, зайдя в каюту к местному администратору или ботанику, сразу понимаешь, что это — разные люди. Практически каждую вещицу в игре, будь то монетка, кружка или обертка от батончика, можно поймать, повертеть и выкинуть... ну, кроме ключей — ключи нужно вставлять в нужные места, дабы получит доступ в ранее заблокированную комнату или открыть запертый ящик. Все как у нас, ничего сверхфутуристичного...
  • Ощущение будущего. Ненавязчивого и привычного, так что не удивляешься ни квадратным кружкам, ни треугольной изоленте. Все воспринимается именно как данность, ничего не выпирает — и благодаря этому реально чувствуешь себя так, будто перенесся во времени в 2088 год...
  • Неплохие диалоги. Не скажу, что прямо все сценки в игре срежиссированы на ура, но часть мне определенно понравилась, пусть даже приходилось несколько раз перематывать ролики, чтобы услышать реплики от всех-всех героев, находящихся в разных помещениях.
  • Краткость. В принципе, это тоже неплохо, ибо, окажись «Taсoma» часа на два-три длиннее — это превратило бы ее в жуткую жвачку.
МИНУСЫ

От рекламы даже в космосе не спастись! 
Une capture d'écran de Tacoma
Par : Аннаэйра

  • Слабоватый сюжет. Поскольку нам в самом начале игры честно признаются, что весь экипаж успел благополучно сделать ноги, сопереживать героям в их чрезвычайной ситуации получается с трудом. И даже концовка вышла... м-м-м... я бы сказала, обрезанная и слегка нелогичная, хотя и с намеком на неожиданность.
  • Нераскрытые персонажи. Увы, но сюжетного времени на каждого из шести членов экипажа «Такомы» приходится чуть да маленько, да и бегать по всей станции, чтобы собрать все-все-все потенциальные диалоги — удовольствие не из первых.
  • Высокая цена. Если не слишком вдаваться в подробности и не хватать что попало — игру реально пройти за полтора-два часа, и платить за это дело четыреста с лишним рублей — перебор. К счастью, я взяла со скидкой, но завышенной цены за продукт это не убавляет.

ИТОГО

Я прошла игру достаточно спокойно, прочитала все-все сообщения и даже нашла семерых кошек. :) Для «симулятора ходьбы» в космосе «Tacoma» получилась неплохой, пусть даже и довольно однообразной. Но, если заняться нечем, а заглянуть в ближайшее будущее хоцца — подойдет.

Общая оценка: ХОРОШО


P.S. Специально не стала ничего говорить о том, что из шести работников «Такомы» как минимум трое являются гомосексуалистами. Впрочем, если не заглядывать в личные данные Эндрю и не шариться по каютам Натали и Берты — вы этого даже не почувствуете... и это хорошо: люди с нетрадиционной ориентацией есть, но это не бросается в глаза. Все как и должно быть в жизни.
 
Аннаэйра

0

Évaluation publiée le 16 juin 2018
Конечно, игра хороша, исследовать станцию очень интересно, открывать новые подробности сюжета, плюс открывать какие-то закрытые места, не всегда правда получается, но все же. Плюс еще пять скрытых достижений, это что-то. Я заработал только два, да и прошел игру довольно быстро. Стоит ли она своих денег, думаю да, определенно стоит, в ней все как я люблю, исследование, изучение мест, никакой стрельбы или экшена. Добавляйтесь в друзья, подписывайтесь на канал, буду рад
 
Rider Death
3,994 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 septembre 2021
Tacoma, is a narrative heavy walking sim, where you watch recordings of an abandoned station's crew. You do this to understand the crew's final days and to gain insight into their daily life. It's a nice and short little game with believable presentation and characters, a very simple plot and a lot of filler elements.

Unlike other walking sims, there is sadly no player choice of any kind in the game, you could run through the whole thing in 20 minutes, if you wanted to. The main story and conflict of Tacoma is very simple and most of the game is side content that barely adds anything to the bigger narrative. The game is much more about showing snapshots of the life of the crew than about the mystery of what happened to them.

The graphics and voice acting work amazingly well, the characters are distinct, likeable and realistic. The ship's design and the routine of the characters makes sense. There are a few genuine and human moments in the game that really stuck a cord with me and I really felt for the people.

That's why it was kinda jarring when the game's ending turned the story and its themes into a completely new direction, that felt unexplored and underdeveloped.

Spoilers ahead:

So the game's big theme is about giant corporations controlling people and how corporate greed and the thirst for profit is willing to sacrifice anyone. ...but then the game replaces this in the final act with a clumsy AI liberation metaphor.

In the future, a group exists that recognizes sentient AIs as living beings and fights to protect their rights. Your final goal is to free the ship's AI from the corporation. This entire narrative is completely underdeveloped, while the AI does play part in the crew's daily life, it doesn't really exhibits human traits and never really gave reason for me to feel empathy towards it.

The game has so much filler moments with random bits of worldbuilding that don't go anywhere, yet it has barely bothered to develop it's main character, the ship's AI. There should have been a lot more stories with it, to make me care. The narrative feels padded and rushed because of this.
 
SABE
713 produits enregistrés
2
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
6.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 aout 2021
This is a three hour long story told in a relatively novel way. The story is told in voyeuristic VR-like recordings, like was pioneered in System Shock and Bioshock. It's incredibly clever, but also one of the most annoying parts of the experience: It can get incredibly boring to watch the same event three or four times, just to make sure you see it from everyone's perspective. You ARE able to spin forward and backward really effectively, though. Fortunately, in the grand scheme of things, it is still only three hours, and while there were places where I was getting bored, I felt more than a little disappointment when I completed the tumble to the end.

Progression is more or less linear, with a small number of zones unlocking as your story progresses. You're mostly along for the ride and don't actually have a lot of agency in the game. There's rarely anything to actually *DO* in the game, although there's a couple of keys and door-codes that expose more of the story, but I don't recall if any of them actually gated progress.

The voyeurism IS the game, and as far as that goes, it's a pretty good game. It was fun to learn, "Oh, these two are in love!" or "Oh, this guy's a jackass!". You get to get into people's heads, not just from hearing them speak, but also by seeing what books they read while they're on the toilet, or what web sites are on their phones or desktops.

There's zero replay value, unless you want to go through and try to find all the cats or other completionist activites. Even then, there's only a dozen or so achievements to pick up.

I think its base price of $20 and download size of 10GB -- just slightly smaller than Skyrim! -- are both too high. I picked it up in a sale at $8, on the other hand, which feels like a steal. I can't give it a strong recommendation, but it's great cart-filler for sale times, and you will probably enjoy the few hours it fills.
 
mdwyer

Nicolas Rage
591 produits enregistrés

1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 février 2020
Dá um ar novo e necessário aos walking simulators, com algumas pequenas mecânicas interessantes e um trabalho de localização incrível.
A trama não tem nada de surpreendente, com algumas questões éticas e políticas que nunca se desenvolvem o bastante para ter algum impacto. O maior foco é nos personagens e as interações entre eles, que infelizmente, mais uma vez, são poucas demais (pela duração do jogo) para realmente criar algo marcante, embora estivesse no caminho certo.
A ambientação é muito bem feita e dá pra ver que foi feita com bastante cuidado. Diria que já valeu a pena jogar por esse aspecto.
 
Volitio

2.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 janvier 2019
One of the most believably crafted takes on the future I've seen in any sci-fi in a long, long while. Interesting investigation mechanic, wonderful polish and great voice acting. I just assume that we won't (at least for the foreseeable future) ever get a sequel, but I'd love to see another entry in the ~2088 timeframe of this future they set up. Especially given the ending. It also is one of the few games I can remember playing that deals with fairly realistic labor issues, the ways people deal with their place in labor under capitalism, etc. The end got me so jazzed that I was sad to see it go!

Évaluation publiée le 27 février 2018
Play it if you like puzzles or interactive stories. Be warned that it's not hard though.
What I like most about it is that it uses the medium to tell a story in a way that no other medium ever could. The simple yet clever mechanics of this game had me entertained for all of its short duration. Good stuff.


Really minor SPOILER:
Extra points for subtly including the (future) issue of ethics and AI.
 
The Banana Massacre
114 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 janvier 2018
Tacoma is Gone Home in space. Quite literally, in fact. But that's not a bad thing.

As the game begins, you arrive at the space station Tacoma under orders to retreive an AI's data and its hardware. As you progress, you interact with the leftover augmented reality data from the crew, witnessing their story and piecing together what happened on board the station.

Fullbright once again proves that they know how to make a believable environment. The station feels lived in, a fact which is most evident when you visit each of the crew's quarters. You can pick up and interact with all manner of objects lying around, although it is not necessary to the game.

The big difference between Tacoma and Gone Home is how you piece together the story. In Gone Home, the story was told to you when you interacted with significant objects. In Tacoma, you have a recording of sorts with colored holograms representing the different crew members. You can pause, rewind, and fast forward the recordings to get the information you need and want. It's fasincating to follow one member of the crew through the recording, then rewind and go watch what another was doing before their paths intersect. In fact, if you want to get the fullest out of the story, you will need to do this multiple times for each recording.

There's really not much else to say about the game to be honest. It is a short one, roughly 2-4 hours in length on average (I finished in three). So while it is slightly longer than Gone Home, it is still an experience that can be finished in one sitting. Whether or not that's worth twenty bucks is something you'll have to decide for yourself. I can say that for ten bucks on sale, it was definitely worth it. It's a genuine, heartfelt story that, while it won't always surprise you, still manages to make you feel something by the end.

It's not as groundbreaking of a game as Gone Home. But then again, it was never going to be. If you like good stories and characters, definitely give this one a shot.
 
Lincoln Balloon
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
7.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 décembre 2017
Tacoma
by Fullbright
Genre: Environmental Narrative
Release: August 1, 2017

-----

From the creators of the enjoyable Environmental Narrative Gone Home comes another one, this time set aboard a failing space station rather than a dark house in the middle of a storm.

Space Station Tacoma, a cargo-processing point, has seen better days. A recent meteor collision has forced the evacuation of the six personnel, and Venturis, the megacorp who runs the station, has sent you, a lowly subcontractor much like those six, to retrieve the station’s onboard AI, ODIN, who ran the station’s systems. Along the way you have the chance to retrieve augmented-reality recordings which show life on the station, both long before and just before the incident, and rewind and view them from any angle. Many times they show multiple characters conversing in small groups, so this is to your benefit!

The personalities you encounter are colorful and memorable. They each have individual experiences on the station, and feelings about being posted there, and reactions to suddenly being displaced due to the incident. You can also access their AR Desktops, which contain messages and logs which further flesh out their characters.

I’m not saying anything else, so that you may experience the story as thoroughly as possible. Check it out if you love stories like this!
 
EazyCheeze1978
1,770 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
6.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 avril 2020
GONE HOME 2 ?

Good Si-Fi game from the creators of GONE HOME with twelve easy achievements and eight cheap trading cards. You don't need much time for it and there's not much replayability, maybe only if you missed some achievements or want to listen to the audio commentary from the developers. Anyway, this game has an interesting playing concept. As if you were playing back a 3D video and were live in it at the same time. Just like with a real video tape you can rewind, fast-forward and pause it. The story is simple and intriguing at the same time. You were sent to the space station TACOMA and have to recover the on-board AI and find out what happened to the crew.

BTW, the pleasant voice of the main protagonist is already known from GONE HOME. It's Sarah Grayson again. But unfortunately this is not a sequel.

Absolutely OK for a sale price. You can get a discount of up to 85% for The Fullbright Collection, which consists of GONE HOME and TACOMA. I highly recommend both games.
 
sanyok

Évaluation publiée le 26 mai 2020
Recommended. It's a pretty nice short interactive story, in a pretty fresh way. Also, the technologies portrayed in the game are kind of realistic: Just-start-becoming-recognized-as-sentient-beings AI, spinning artificial gravity, not-too-high-res AR technology, slow data transfer, radiation and meteors still being a problem, etc.

The story is quite fast-paced, and the plot is a little bit flawed though.

2.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 décembre 2018
Fullbright of "Gone Home" fame is back and have knocked another exploration-mystery-story title out of the solar system. This takes place in the near future where you're a contractor assigned to a job on a defunct space station and it's your job to figure out what happened. It uses environmental storytelling and holographic logs to excellent use to tell its story and is well worth checking out.
